loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen del Carmen está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar en sus emprendimientos.
Una de las personas que se destaca por su trabajo es la Sra. Rita, quien con sacrificio pudo montar para su mercería, hoy ya tiene un negocio bien formado y también una buena clientela ya que tiene muy buena variedad de productos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos de todo tipo para poder surtir su mercería, como ser prendas, artículos de bazar, calzados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen group is in its second cycle of the women's committee program, where they are participating in a poverty elimination survey. Each one puts forth their greatest effort to be able to grow and improve their enterprises.

One of the persons who distinguishes herself by her work is Rita who, with sacrifice, was able to start her haberdashery. Today she has an established business and also good customers since she has a very good variety of products.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy products of all types so she can stock her shop, such as clothing, bazaar items, shoes and other things, in a way that she can continue with sales as before. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy clothing, bazaar items, shoes and other things.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her business buying and selling rice grains.

Lilia is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy additional sacks of rice seeds and fertilizers for her farm. Lilia dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Fatima Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FATIMA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de hierbas, tienda de barrio, venta de chompas, venta de mantas, venta de muebles, venta de enaguas, venta de comida, venta de refrescos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución, que se realizó en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace cuatro años. En la actualidad quienes le ayudan en la atención de su tienda son su mamá y hermano.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de gaseosas y dulces por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Fatima" community group will start its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Collpani. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Maria is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association manage are varied. Among them are: selling herbs, a neighborhood store, selling sweaters, selling blankets, selling furniture, selling underskirts, selling food and selling refreshments.

The loan they are taking will benefit the small business women where Maria is the president. She indicates that it is their second cycle with Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of an institution promotion made in her area. Currently, she has a neighborhood shop business. She tells us that she learned this business by her own initiative four years ago. Currently, the people who help her run the shop are her mother and brother.

The loan she will now take will be to expand capital (buy sodas and sweets and wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and later she will sell from her place of business. This type of work allows her to earn to support her family economically since she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy sodas and sweets at wholesale.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen’s age is 60. She is married and lives with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Nasreen owns a small clothing sales business at home. She purchases clothes from the market at low prices and sells them for high prices in her community. The ladies in town like her clothing collection and selection a lot. Her family members appreciate her efforts. Now that the winter season is going to start, she wants to buy winter season clothes to sell, but she does not have the money due to household expenses.

Nasreen requested a loan so that she can buy winter season clothes to fulfill demand. She wishes for a bright future for her children and dreams of providing them a better education. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal clothing stock for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza está en su primer ciclo, es un grupo nuevo que se unió para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del trabajo en equipo. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Romelia, quien es artesana, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sombreros hechos de karanday, ramas procesadas de una planta típica de paraguay, comenta que gracias a su humilde trabajo ha podido dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones, es una mujer muy trabajadora que pese a los problemas ha podido salir adelante. Ella se define a si misma como una persona que se esfuerza por salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de los materiales que necesite para hacer sus artesanías como hojas de karanday, ramas, pinzas y otros, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group named "La Esperanza" (the hope) is in its first cycle. It is a new group that came together to improve their living conditions through working in a team. They are participating in a poverty elimination survey where four of them can be found below the poverty line, a.k.a. in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Romelia who is an artisan. She is dedicated to making and selling hats made from karanday, branches processed from a typical Paraguayan plant. She says that thanks to her humble work she has been able to give her family a dignified life, without hardships. She is a very hard working woman who, despite problems, has been able to progress. She defines herself as a person who works hard to get ahead and to help her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of the materials she needs to make her artisanal items like karanday leaves, branches, tweezers and other things. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow and to improve.

loans.use: to buy the materials that she needs to make her artisanal items like karanday leaves, branches, tweezers and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres En Lucha Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres en la lucha lleva ese nombre ya que las integrantes se unieron para poder luchar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo unido. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 5 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, que están en una pobreza extrema luchando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien vende comidas hechas por ella misma y que vende de manera ambulante por su barrio, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por sus seres queridos para poder darles una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella quiere seguir capacitándose para poder crecer y mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group named "Women in the Struggle" take this name since the members came together to be able to fight and to improve their living conditions and to help themselves and each other through working together. They are participating in a poverty elimination survey where five of them are below the poverty line, a.k.a. they are fighting against extreme poverty.

One of the members is Maria who sells food made by herself and that she sells on foot in her neighborhood. She is a very hard working person who works hard for her loved ones to be able to give them a dignified life without hardships. She wants to keep training to be able to grow and to improve.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy ingredients to make her food, such as vegetables, meat, condiments, breads and other items and thus be able to keep delighting her customers with the delicious food she makes. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her food like vegetables, meat, condiments, breads, and other items.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida, 40-years-old and a mother of six is a dedicated housewife. She looks after her children and house. Her husband owns a spice making and selling business. Spices are a speciality in every cousine in Pakistan. Giving each dish a particular aroma and flavor its also known to cure certain diseases and increase the shelf life of food.

Her husband buys spices from wholesalers and then crushes and mixes them to make different variety of spices. His spices are famous in the neighborhood.

Her husband wants to buy more spices as he has more customers and greater demand. Shahida has therefore requested for a loan to help her husband with his business. They are thankful to BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to help her husband with a spice selling business by buying different spices.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scolastica is 63 years old. She is married and blessed with five adult children.

Her business is a retail shop and livestock trade. She has been in the shop business for four years. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a cow and goats for resale. She will use the profits from expanded business to support her children and her widowed daughter-in-law.

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business to bring more income to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow and goats for resale.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a buy and sell gasoline in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gasoline to sell for her business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Leonita dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional gasoline to sell for her business.

loans.name: Liliane Olivette

texts.fr:
Liliane a 46 ans. C’est une femme débrouillarde qui vit en milieu rural, elle a comme activité secondaire la culture de légumes. Le conjoint est un maçon. Le nombre d’enfants est de quatre (18-15-13-10 ans), tous scolarisés. 
Liliane a ouvert son magasin général en 2008.Les produits étaient encore peu diversifiés. En raison de la hausse du prix à l’approvisionnement, elle a recouru à ce prêt pour augmenter le stock des produits. Les produits achetés par le prêt sont les plus demandés par les clients actuellement. Le prêt servira  à acheter des produits de première nécessite ( huile, sucre, jus, riz) , des produits locaux ( haricots secs, pois de cap ) et des fournitures scolaires ( cahier , stylo, rame de papier).
Le rêve étant de devenir  grossiste approvisionnant toutes les épiceries  et magasins générales de la zone.
texts.en:
Liliane is 46 years old. She is a resourceful woman who lives in a rural area. Her secondary activity is growing vegetables. Her husband is a mason. They have four children aged 18, 15, 13, and 10, all enrolled in school.

Liliane opened her general store in 2008. The range of products was still not diversified. Because of the spike in prices when she replenishes her stocks, she turned to this loan to help her grow her inventory. The products she plans to buy with the loan funds are those that are most often required by her customers at present. The loan will allow her to buy staple goods (oil, sugar, juice, rice), local produce (dried beans and Cape peas), and school supplies (notebooks, pens, and reams of paper).

Liliane's dream is to become a wholesaler supplying all the grocery stores and general stores in her area.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, notebooks, pens, velum paper, and dried legumes.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra hails from the town of Dagohoy, Bohol.

Her main source of living is by means of operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like catsup, pouch vinegar, cooking oil, salt, powdered milk, noodles, shampoo, matches, candles, and soap.

She is a 58-year-old married woman with six grown children. Her husband engages in farming. He grows rice to help defray the family's daily expenses.

Aside from running a sari-sari store, she raises hogs to sell.

As of the moment, she is doing her best to improve both her sources of living, but she needs funds to improve the content of the store.

Petra has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI. She wants to buy groceries such as beverages, soft drinks and assorted goods. She could now start to do bulk purchases. In that way, more potential customers will come and shop.

In the future, She is hoping that she will continue manage her business to become more productive.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as beverages, soft drinks and assorted goods.

loans.name: Felecita

texts.en:
Felecita is 51 years old, married, and has three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like mineral water, coffee, canned goods, etc.

Felecita has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like mineral water, coffee and canned goods.

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr:
Denise a 62 ans. Elle est veuve depuis 2012. Le nombre d’enfants est de 11, tous déjà mariés. L’aîné a 45 ans et le dernier 20 ans. Elle a 3 années d’expérience dans l’élevage porcin. Après quelques mois d’engraissement, les porcs sont vendus au marché de la Commune , les clients étant les bouchers. C’est une activité rentable qui est également une passion pour Denise. Le prêt servira  à acheter des porcelets  ainsi que des provendes et du son pour l’alimentation du cheptel.
L’objectif est de pouvoir augmenter l’effectif du cheptel de l’élevage afin de constituer une épargne pour préparer l’avenir.
texts.en:
Denise is 62 years old. She has been a widow since 2012. She has 11 children, all already married. The oldest is 45 and the youngest 20 years of age. She has been raising pigs for three years. After several months of fattening, the pigs are sold at the community market. Her customers are butchers. This is a remunerative activity that Denise feels passionate about.

The loan will be used to buy piglets as well as feed and bran for the livestock. Denise's goal is to expand her herd of pigs so that they become a kind of savings for her future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and bran.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a machinery-rental business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending and furniture-making businesses.

Lorena is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her machinery-rental business.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is 28 years old. She is a farmer and she’s a mother of three children. Her husband is a worker but they live under difficult circumstances. This is what led Rasha to help her family.

She wants to increase her crop to get more earnings, and so she needs to repair the well to collect more rainwater that they use in farming. In this way, she can improve her crops and get good income.

Rasha is asking Kiva’s partner ALIBDAA for $1,500 to meet the goals and achieve a good income.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails, etc. in order to repair the well before winter and then to collect more rainwater in the well.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 43 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Angeles works very hard to provide for them.

Angeles runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Angeles has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, bread, candies, soft drinks, noodles, shampoo, soap and other groceries.

In the future, Angeles would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Poty Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucia Poty se formó en la Ciudad de Itá  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde pusieron como meta el crecimiento de cada una de las integrantes, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Melissa, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, comenta que por medio de este humilde trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se gana la vida por medio de su sacrificio y duro trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con la venta de comidas que ella hace y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante por su barrio. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Santa Lucia Poty was formed in the city of Itá. It is in its first cycle with the Women's Committee Program, where they have the goal of growth for each one of the members; not just in finances, but also as a person.

One of the members of this group is Señora Melissa who dedicates herself to selling food of all kinds. She says that through this humble work she has the means to be able to help her loved ones. She is a very hard-working woman who earns a living through her sacrifice and hard work.

She asks for this loan to be able to buy vegetables, meat, seasoning, baked goods, and other items, in order to continue selling food as she does and then later go out to sell in the streets of her neighborhood. She is thankful for the loan that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, seasoning, baked goods, and other products to be able to make food to sell.

loans.name: Pmr Group

texts.en:
Marites is the featured borrower of Pmr Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Marites is a 32-year-old married mother of two children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved children and improve their living conditions, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Marites is the first lady on the right.

With respect to the other group members, Pia Mae is the lady standing in the middle, while Rosalina is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Kibo Group

texts.en:
Maimuna is in her 40s, married, and has five children, three of whom attend school. She has been running several business, including operating a grinding machine and pulping machine, selling water, and operaing a transportation business. She works from 5 AM to 9 PM daily and is able to earn a very good monthly profit.

Maimuna requested her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her business. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees for her three children, to reinvest in her business, make loan repayment, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her businesses and open a broiler chicken business. She hopes to become the best breeder of chickens.

Maimuna will share this loan with her loan group, Kibo, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a chicken business.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Clotilde is 48 years old now.

Clotilde has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Clotilde requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Clotilde has been in this business for four years. In the future, Clotilde would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en:
Sabiha is a old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of 1 child. Sabiha has also been doing her business of clothing selling for past 8 years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

Sabiha needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

On this financial assistance Sabiha is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: she wanted to increase her cloth business

loans.name: Gyulnara

texts.en:
Gyulnara is 53 years old and she lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She lives here with her husband and three children. All of them are married and they live with their families.

Gyulnara has higher pedagogical education and she has been working for 30 years at the school as a teacher of elementary classes. She mentions that she loves and cares each of her pupils who are very various, clever and unique. She does her best to make her lessons very informative and useful for each of them.

Gyulnara now greatly needs this Kiva loan in an amount of 700.000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional methodological literature as she needs all these for her self-development works.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional methodological literature as she needs all these for her self-development works

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Yahaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Yahaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Yahaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Jibo

texts.en:
Jibo is a maize farmer from Maiyashi village. As a Babban Gona member, Jibo is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Jibo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Jibo will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Jibo no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Jibo hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Selinah

texts.en:
Selinah is married and is a mother to one daughter. She has been running an ECD (Early Childhood Development) center for the last 11 years. Her patience and business acumen have seen her grow the center into a respectable pillar of the community.

Her school is so popular such that she now needs to buy a second swing-set to comfortably accommodate the children. She also intends to put a shade by the playground so that the children are protected from adverse and unpredictable weather.
"This loan will help me advertise my center more and make my family proud." says the bubbly 59 year old.

loans.use: to buy and install an outdoor swingset and playground shade.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is 41 years old and he lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Hovhannes graduated Yerevan State Economical Institute the faculty of Economy and Accountancy. For many years, he worked as an accountant at different organizations.

Now he is busy with his gardening and vegetable cultivation. His fruit and vegetable garden is so colorful and nice since he takes care of it properly and skillfully. He manages to have very good harvest of potato, beans, peppers, eggplant and greens. From fruits he has apple, fig, persimmon and plum trees in his garden. Hovhannes is very clever gardener and he manages to have good profit from the sale of all of these. The part of it he also uses for his family. He is married and he has three school-aged children.

Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams he asks as he wants to fence his garden and he also must buy new networks for fencing since the greatest part of it is damaged and he must change it.

loans.use: to fence his garden and he also must buy new networks for fencing since the greatest part of it is damaged and he must change it

loans.name: Riad

texts.en:
After taking the first loan, Riad improved his business performance. He bought new equipment and upgraded his toolkit which allowed him to take more projects and extend his client outreach to new areas of the camp. 
One of his children graduated from school and is aiming to pursue his higher education and get a university degree, but at the same time he is helping his father in the business. 
For the second time, Riad is asking for 1,850,991 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. This time, he needs to buy a new power generator and a welding machine. He also hopes this loan will have the same impact on his business and income as the first one.

loans.use: to buy electrical tools and equipment

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a maize farmer from Maiyashi village. As a Babban Gona member, Isah is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Isah will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Isah no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Isah hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is 27 years old and he is already father of two children and a perfect farmer, despite of being employed as a contractual military serviceman. Tigran lives with his family in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. He farms with the help of his beloved wife and together they takes care of their farm cows, a calf, bulls, pigs, sheep, lambs and chickens. Tigran also is skilled in potato and cabbage cultivation in which he became experienced thanks to his father’s advises. Tigran sells his farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat, eggs and his land’s vegetables to his regular customers who come for these products to the city’s wholesale market and buy it from him.

With this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Tigran decided to buy a lot of fodder for his big farm’s cattle, since it is very urgent to store fodder beforehand since with the first snow it will become very expensive but will still be needed.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his big farm’s cattle since it is very urgent to store fodder beforehand

loans.name: Pretty

texts.en:
Pretty (46) is married and has 1 girl and 2 boys. Out of her passion for children, Pretty, with the support of her husband, opened a daycare center in her backyard. Now, 6 years later, the center has developed rapidly, having moved out of her yard into an its own space and now wants to expand even further.

She is thus requesting for a Kiva loan to buy building material for constructing new classrooms and also for renovating the older rooms.
This loan will give the center a bright look and Pretty hopes that it will attract more parents to enroll their children in a quality and comfortable environment.

loans.use: to buy building material and pay labor for her daycare centre

loans.name: Emelson

texts.en:
Emelson is a farmer living at Solana with his wife and three children. He plants and harvests rice to sell as a source of income. His wife also raises hogs to sell in order to supplement their income.

Emelson has insufficient funds to sustain his crops, and that is why he is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This loan will also help improve his crop production with good plant nutrition. He hopes to continuously produce an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Las Obreras Group

texts.es:
Las Obreras lleva por nombre este grupo, ellas se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, y por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las personas que integra este grupo, y que se destaca por su sacrificio, trabajo y gran entusiasmo es la Sra. Estela, quien es peluquera y por medio de este trabajo se esfuerza por poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, quiere darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener  evitar que tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con los productos variados que necesita para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes en su peluquería, como ser: tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros insumos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Las Obreras is the name of this group. They got together to help each other, and through the program for the elimination of poverty they can improve their life quality and the lives of their loved ones. One of the members of this group who stands out for her sacrifice, hard work, and enthusiasm is Mrs. Estela. She is a hairdresser and, through this job,  she tries hard to improve her family's quality of life. She wants to give them everything she did not have to avoid having them go through the necessities she had to.  She is asking for a loan to supply her business with assorted products needed to continue providing a good service to her clients in her hair salon, such as hair coloring dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and other inputs. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting which will be of great help.

loans.use: To buy hair coloring dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and other inputs.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 40 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Lea is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lea requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lea has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Lea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 27 years old. He is a farmer. He is very young. Elchin is energetic and passionate in everyday life. He sows some wheat and grows some vegetables. He takes his products to the local bazaar.

Elchin is aware that people like natural goods, so he sells natural, good quality wheat and vegetables in the local market.

He wants to expand his business. He is planning to make good living conditions for his family. He is going to buy new fertilizers. For this, Elchin requires a new loan. He hopes Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers.

loans.name: Nazirahan

texts.ru: Назирахан, 55 лет, замужем,есть сын. У Назирахан - среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). У Назирахан и ее семьи большой опыт в разведении скота. Благодаря упорному труду, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 30 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 26,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назирахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Назирахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nazirahan is 55, married, and has a son. She has a secondary education and earns income for her family by raising livestock, which she began 22 years ago when she bought livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Nazirahan and her family have a lot of experience breeding livestock. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has four cows and 30 sheep. Her monthly income is 26,000 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her farm, Nazirahan applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy cows and sheep to increase her livestock headcount. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in additional livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and some sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is 60 years old, married and had five children. One is still studying. Pedro is a farmer and wants to continue improving his profits to sustain the needs of his family. His wife is a farmer.

He is now asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. He hopes to continue nourishing his crops for a better harvest.

He promises to pay back his loan in return and keep generating good profits for his family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Ruth Lean

texts.en:
Ruth Lean operates her restaurant business with her husband. She is 33 years old and blessed with two children.

According to her, in her three years of running the business, her customers have increased.

Ruth Lean would like to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP 50,000 for the expansion of their restaurant and to buy needed materials to keep her restaurant business profitable. She hopes to obtain the said amount of loan for the continuous development of her business.

loans.use: to pay for the expansion of her restaurant.

loans.name: Vai

texts.en:
Vai, 26 years old, is a garment worker whose workplace is far away from her house. Her husband is a farmer on the rice field. They live in the Cheung Prey District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. The daily profit for this couple is (USD) $7 a day.

Currently, Vai would like to request her fifth loan cycle through Kiva to buy a motorbike for her to ride to her workplace that she cannot afford. Therefore, she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help them.

She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 43 years old. He is married and blessed with four children. His business is growing mangoes and fruit vending. He has been in the business for 21 years. He earns a monthly income of 35,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use part of the loan to buy fruits like oranges and watermelon for sale, and the other part to buy chemicals to spray his mango trees against fruit weevils.

Thomas will use the profits from his expanded business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fruits like oranges and watermelon for sale, and to buy chemicals to spray his mango trees against fruit weevils.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru: Рахат, 29 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении нескольких лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, также торговлей детской одежды на рынке. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 2 теленка и 12 овец, фруктовый сад. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 35,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS). Часть средств будет потрачена на увеличение товарооборота, 50,000 сом (KGS) Рахат направит на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса и завершение строительства дома.
texts.en: Rahat is 29, married, and has three children. She has a high school education and has been farming for a few years in addition to selling children's clothing at the market. She has two cows, two calves, twelve sheep, and an orchard. Her monthly income is 35,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her business, Rahat applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank. She will use part of the funds to expand her inventory and 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in the future expansion of her business and to finish building a new house.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing to sell and to buy two cows in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул успешно погасила свой кредит, она использовала средства по назначению и выражает свою благодарность Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Назгул есть 3 коровы, 20 овец и 2 лошади. На 0,60 Га земли она выращивает люцерну. Она получает ежемесячную прибыль в размере около 22,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назгул вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 дойных коров для увеличения удоя экологически-чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и приобретение дополнительных наделов пахотной земли.
texts.en: Nazgul successfully repaid her loan, having used it for the intended purpose. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. She currently has three cows, two horses, and 20 sheep. She grows alfalfa on a 0.6 hectare plot of land and earns 22,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her farm, Nazgul applied for a new loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy three dairy cows so she can sell more organic milk. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to expand her farm and acquire more arable land.

loans.use: To purchase three cows in order to increase her sales of organic milk

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is 58 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Trinidad is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 40 years old and single. She works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Nani, who is a 46-year-old married woman with one son. Nani has a small restaurant, and her husband has been a driver for 20 years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation facilities at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Nani will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to build toilets and water sources at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 52 years old and married with two children. Estrella works very hard to provide for them.

Estrella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Estrella has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, soap, rice, shampoo, coconut, fruit, coffee, dried fish and other groceries.

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amor is 33 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Amor has a frozen foods retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of frozen foods to sell.

Amor has been in this business for four years. In the future, Amor would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Madlen

texts.en:
Madlen lives with her mother in Vanadzor city of Lori region. She has higher pedagogical education and has been working for 10 years at the Vanadzor State University as a lecturer in Armenian History. She also managed to have a group of students whom she helps to get prepared for the entrance exams and she also helps them in their diploma works. Madlen likes her profession and mostly the subject that she teaches very much and she finds it one of the most important and interesting among many subjects.

She happily mentions that she has a lot of students who are really interested in the subject and they learn it very thoroughly. Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a computer and also some professional literature she wants to use for her self-development activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature that she wants to use for her self-development activities.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun, 25 years old, is a garment worker who lives in Cheung Prey District, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hard-working mother of one child. Her husband is a fisherman and a farmer. This couple can make a net profit approximately USD 7 a day.

During this time, she is facing with a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy some materials needed for fishing and farming for her husband where is it so far from their house but she cannot afford to. She has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help them. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy some materials that are needed for fishing and farming.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La clienta lucia se dedica a vender salchipapas en la vía publica, este negocio lo hace en las tardes y noches, tiene sus clientes seguros y ella quiere expandir su negocio mejorando sus condiciones y capital de trabajo y en un futuro dedicarse a una salchipaperia en un local con las condiciones que ella se merece y sus clientes.
ella tiene 42 años y tienes 5 hijos por ello también tiene la necesidad de dedicarse a vender leña , esta actividad es fuerte y necesita mucho esfuerzo, gracias  a su empeño aporta en gastos familiares con el fin de sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta ya que KIVA le prestara el capital que necesita  para comprar una freidora ,papa, aceite y salchicha.la socia se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas en el plazo acordado.
texts.en:
Lucia sells 'salchipapas' [sausages and fried potatoes] on the street. She conducts this business in the afternoons and evenings. She has secure customers, and she wants to expand her business. She wants to imrove its conditions and work capital. In the future she wants to have her salchipapa business at a place with the conditions that she and her customers deserve.

She is 42 years old and has five children. Therefore, she also needs to sell firewood. This business activity is tough, and you need a lot of effort. Thanks to her effort, she contribues to the family's expenses in order to get her children ahead.

She is very happy that Kiva will lend the capital she needs to buy a fryer, potatoes, cooking oil, and suasages. She pledges to make her payments acooring to the agreed upon time frame.

loans.use: to buy a fryer, potatoes, cooking oil, and sausages.

loans.name: Munyiva

texts.en:
Munyiva is 53 years old. She is married and blessed with five children. Her business is selling charcoal. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy charcoal for sale. She will use the profits from expanded business to increase her business stock.

Her hopes and dreams are to diversify business and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El grupo está trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación d la pobreza, cada una se propuso poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, a través de las capacitaciones que van recibiendo y de la ayuda de las unas con las otras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, quien se esfuerza para poder mejorar a través de su trabajo en la venta de verduras que hace, comenta que por medio de su lucha está ayudando a sus seres queridos, y trata de darles una vida digna. Rosa participa siempre de una manera activa dentro del programa y de las capacitaciones que les brinda la fundación paraguaya.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras frescas y de estación, de manera a poder ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes, y al mismo tiempo luchar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: The group is working in the elimination of poverty programme. Each of the members joined with the aim of improving their living conditions by means of the finding which they receive and the help they give one another. One of the members is called Rosa. She works hard to improve her life through her vegetable selling business and she says that her hard work enables her to help her loved ones and try to give them a decent life. Rosa always plays an active part in the programme and in using the funding which the Paraguayan foundation gives them. She is seeking this loan to buy fresh seasonal fruit so she can offer her customers a wide choice and, at the same time, endeavour to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is 45 years old. He is married, with four children. His business is M-PESA (Mobile money transfer). He has been in the business for seven years. He earns a monthly income of forty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to add float in the mobile money transfer business. He will use the profits from expanded business to increase business float and open other M-Pesa outlets.

His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and be a full Money Transfer Agent.

loans.use: to add float in the mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 42 years old. He is married with three children. His business is selling herbal(natural) medicine. He has been in the business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy stock herbal medicine. He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to prosper in business.

loans.use: to buy stock herbal/natural medicine.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada es una mujer de 28 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de prendas de vestir, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con este pequeño negocio. Ada cuenta con vivienda propia desde hace 5 años y en ella vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas la mayor de 4 años y una pequeña de 4 meses de edad. Ada desea continuar aumentando sus productos y de esta manera ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas por mayor para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ada, age 28, is a hard-working woman. She has been selling clothes for two years. This buisness activity allows her to get her family ahead. Therefore, she is happy to have this small business. Ada has had her own house for five years. She lives there with her husband and her two daughters. The oldest is four years old, and the little one is four months old.

Ada wishes to continue increasing her products. This way she will offer a greater quantity of products to her customers. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy pants, skirts, blouses, and t-shirts wholesale in order to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, bouses, and t-shirts wholesale in order to improve her earnings.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth thought that it’ll be difficult managing a variety store business, considering the market competition/customer’s demands. However, she’s grateful that by using Center for community Transformation (CCT), the prior loan of Php 30, 000 was approved and became a great help for her business to step up. Lilibeth once again wants to express her gratitude.

She considered the business growing, despite of having competitors on the same business line. Approximately Php 11, 000 is her monthly earnings that became one of the source for their day-to-day expenses.

Lilibeth applied for a loan amount of Php 60, 000 that she’ll use an added capital for her to stock grocery products to incorporate with her existing inventory. Complete products will indeed increase sales and profit. She believes that this amount, if ever granted will make a drastic change on the business’ current status.

Lilibeth believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to add stock grocery products for her variety store business. .

loans.name: Yoyen

texts.en:
Yoyen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business farming rice in the Philippines.

She requested  PHP 7,000 loan through GDMPC to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Yoyen has been in this business for 3 years now.

 She has requested  loan to further build her business.

In the future, Yoyen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 33 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Ma. Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, eggs, home product care, and other groceries.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, condiments, soy sauce, coffee, oil, peanut and other groceries. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, eggs, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 39 years old and she lives with her family in Kapan city of Syunik region. Lilit has higher pedagogical education and at the school she is a teacher of English Language and Literature. She also gives paid private courses of her subject and on this way she helps her pupils to get prepared for the entrance exams. Lilit is very patient and skilled specialist and she works hard and very much to help each of them. Lilit has two school-aged children. Her husband works at the city’s combine.

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams she asks as she would like to furnish the room where she works with the students; she will buy a computer, a round table and professional literature and all this will provide effectiveness of her private courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a table and professional literature, to provide effectiveness of her private courses.

loans.name: Elmadin

texts.en:
Elmadin, 33 year-old married man, lives in village Chapala. He lives with his wife, mother and 3 children. Elmadin is busy with a small scale agricultural business.

He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for trading business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The only source of the income for the family is monthly income from their agricultural business. They have an agricultural land where potatoes, cucumbers and potatoes and also own a dairy-cow. They sell the products at the local market. The income is hardly enough for food for a six member family.

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Elmadin's loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Elmadin plans to purchase a mini-bus and start trading through the district. He will get more customers and will be able to increase the productivity of his recent activity.
Elmadin and his family members will be very grateful for the financial support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus and start trading with harvested products.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Dorothee is a 28-year-old married mother with two children. She has operated a tailoring business for the past seven years. She works everyday from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. While the work is tough and the hours are long, Dorothee is committed to her business so that her children may prosper. She is the president of TUZAMURANE group and she is the one who has a child in front of others, first line.

Dorothee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more materials and machines to use in her tailoring business. With this loan, she will earn more profits which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability, as well as pay her children's school fees, to pay medical insurance and to buy new clothes for her children. Over the next five years, as her business continues to grow, Dorothee hopes to earn enough money and to build her own house for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and machines to use in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Peninna

texts.en:
Peninna is 55 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. Her business is rental houses. She has been in the business for two years. She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy building materials like iron sheets, nails, paint and doors. She will use the profits from expanded business to expand the rental houses.

Her hopes and dreams are to build more rental houses to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy building materials like iron sheets, nails, paint and doors

loans.name: Give And Get Group

texts.en:
Hợp is 39 years old and married. Hợp lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of "Give and get", which consists of three members.

Hợp has had a manufacturing business for 5 years making metal appliances. Her family is a low-income household in her village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Hợp faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to increase her income by purchasing raw materials to produce more good quality products. This is Hợp's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standards.

In the future, Hợp hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to increase her income by purchasing raw materials for producing more good quality products.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios can’t thank you enough lenders for the financial support and Center for Community Transformation (CCT) as well for the approval of her previous loan amount of Php 10, 000. She was able to maintain and add another unit of computer for her internet café business. Sincerest gratitude she wants to send to every people who’ve been part of the business’ success, CCT and all of the lenders.

This is where she gets support for her grandson’s educational expenses and to have savings as well that can be used for future purposes. The business’ revenue will indeed increase if another unit of computer will be added. That’s why she applied for a loan of Php 10, 000. She hopes that once again, her request will be considered.

Remedios has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy another unit of computer for her internet cafe business.

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Loan, born in 1974, is an ethnic Thai woman. She currently lives with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son District, Son La Province, Vietnam. Her daughter has just passed the entrance exam of a college. Her family’s main income is from farming, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. Loan wants to pay for her daughter’s education fees, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. She hopes that the loan will help her pay for her daughter’s education fee. Loan will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7 Microfinance Institution on time.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s education fees

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 40 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill.

Jenelyn has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from general store and raising livestock businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She sells gasoline in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from fish vending.  Elizabeth is borrowing 8000 PHP through NWTF to buy gallons of gasoline to sell in her business. Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to sell

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 56 years old and married with nine children. With four children in school, Nila works very hard to provide for them.

Nila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, home product care, and other groceries.

Nila has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as coffee, shampoo, soap, straw, candies, school supplies and other groceries. 

In the future, Nila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is a 44 year-old mother of 3. She runs a daycare center assisted by her husband who has a transport business ferrying children to and from school. She has been running the center for 8 years now and has been successful in establishing a good reputation. 

She is requesting for a Kiva loan to buy a deep freezer, a stove, several mattresses and educational toys. All of these purchases will upgrade the center and provide  more comfort for the children."Our neighborhood is known for a lot of crime and violence. My wish is to provide hope to the kids by giving them a brighter future than the one they see in the streets" says Rochelle about her passion and drive.
 
She is ambitious and hopes to one day, expand the center into a private primary school giving quality education to children from impoverished and unstable families.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer, 6-cylinder gas stove, mattresses and educational toys for her daycare centre

loans.name: May's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. May, born in 1979, is a Thai ethnic woman who has been joining in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 2002. Her family consists of four members, including her husband and her two sons. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. Each harvest, after deducting all costs, they can get the income of VND 50 to 60 million. However, the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She wants to buy a breeding buffalo, but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes much that the loan amount will help her family have a good breeding buffalo, and the buffalo will give birth to lovely buffalo calves. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy a breeding buffalo

loans.name: Agalelei

texts.en: Fialelei  is 34 years old and married with 4 children. She is Samoan citizen, she owns and operates a convenience store in her village. She has been running her business for 5 years now, and sells her item. Fialelei is applying for a loan to help her expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2009. She requested for a loan to buy to buy a freezer, box of twistiest , box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of twistiest , box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk

loans.name: Mujeres De La P Ila Roja Group

texts.en:
Fourth street in the large town of Patzún in Western Guatemala, the department of Chimaltenango, is home to the 7 women of “Mujeres de la P ila Roja” trust bank. They are neighbors, living together in their families, supporting one another in their lives and businesses. In addition to Spanish, the majority of the group speak Cakchiquel, as well, which is the indigenous language of their area. 

María, group president, is 45 years old and studied through 3rd grade. Mother to 5 children between 8 and 20 years old, she is providing education to them along with the support of her husband, who works in agriculture. Her oldest children have already finished their secondary school degrees. María Rita manages a tortilleria in her home to bring income to her family, making delicious tortillas, a staple food in Guatemala,for all of her neighbors to buy each day. With her loan that she is requesting, she will invest in corn and gasoline to restock her supply for the masa, tortilla dough, and stove where she cooks her tortillas. María dreaming of how she will expand her business and invest the rest of her loan, hoping to gain tools and ideas in the educational workshops offered by Friendship Bridge, accomplishing increased profits through her investment.

loans.use: to invest in corn and gasoline to restock her supply for the masa, tortilla dough, and stove where she cooks her tortillas.

loans.name: Douaa

texts.en: Douaa is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 29 years old and has two children. She is really attached to her family. Her husband works tirelessly to be able to cover the heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. Today, the fact that the new school year is coming, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children educational fees. The family only target and dreams is to see those achieving higher positions.

loans.use: to pay her children educational fees

loans.name: Costureras Barrio 2 Group

texts.en:
The 8 women who make up “Costureras Barrio 2”, or “The Tailors of Neighborhood 2” trust bank who live in San Marcos La Laguna, a beautiful peaceful town that rests beside Lago Atitlán in Western Guatemala, want investors to know how happy they are to be supported in their growth as business women through Kiva. 

Rosa, the group president, is 33 years old and studied through 4th grade. She has been with Friendship Bridge for 3 years, and really likes the opportunities she has received through this organization. Rosa has been able to see growth in her business, a convenient store where she sells items of basic daily consumption, as well as fruit, perfumes, and “fajas”, which are traditional. In order to expand her business Rosa is requesting a loan, with which she will be able to buy inventory for the story including, rice, noodles, sugar, oil, oat meal, beans, eggs, among other products.

Most if the women in Costureras 2 are married, but there are several single mothers in the group who are managing their businesses and caring for their families without the support of a spouse. The businesses they run are various, some selling fresh produce, others selling corn, running cake shops, convenient stores, or weaving and selling clothing and other textile products traditional to San Marcos. With 3 years of work in Friendship Bridge and Kiva, these women are thankful for the credits which give them the opportunity to grow. The group meetings each month bring motivation, and the workshops offered by Friendship Bridge excite the women, always teaching them something new, interesting, and helpful.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the story including, rice, noodles, sugar, oil, oat meal, beans, eggs, among other products

loans.name: Muema

texts.en: Muema is 47 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. He operates a motorcycle taxi business and a retail shop, which he has been running for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy inventory of sodas, sugar, bread, milk, paraffin, detergents, rice, maize flour, etc. for the shop business. He will use the profits from expanded business to improve the standard of living of his family. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his shop.

loans.name: Iryn

texts.en:
Filipinos are resourceful and hardworking. Like Iryn, a 61 year old business woman, who is committed to her goals. Currently, she’s involved in a buy and sell business of personal products, with total earnings of about 22,000 PHP every month. As per Iryn, her business is growing over the past six months and she’s thankful to God for providing patrons.

She perseveres to make the business grow and earn more profit. She considers Center for Community Transformation (CCT) as God’s extension of blessing to her, since they’re not just providing support financially but able to impart their knowledge as well on how to properly run a business. 

One marketing strategy is to have products in stock. She believes that this will help increase the business’ revenue and an amount of 20,000 PHP is what she needs. She’ll buy personal products such as foot wear, different kinds of make up, ready-to-wear clothes, toiletries and other items.

Iryn regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy personal products such as foot wear, different kinds of make up, ready-to-wear clothes, toiletries and other items.

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn is a 33 year old married woman. Her husband is a fisherman who does fishing, while Emilyn owns a farm producing mahogany. She has been selling her mahogany to her loyal customers just to earn more profit. With her generated revenue, she was able to repay her previous loan and was able to pay the household bills.

Emilyn wants to expand her business. Recently, she took a new loan to pay for labor costs for land preparation.

Emilyn's plan for the future is to save more money and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for land preparation.

loans.name: Flora May

texts.en:
Flora May is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flora May is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Flora May has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. Flora May requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more banana to resell.

Flora May has been in this business for four years. In the future, Flora May would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more banana to resell.

loans.name: Vina

texts.en:
Vina is 39 years old and has three children. Vina is married and has two children who are in school.

Vina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Vina requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Vina has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Remy Jinet

texts.en:
Remy Jinet is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and food vending businesses. Remy Jinet is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store business.

Remy Jinet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung, born in 1984, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her lovely daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main income is from her husband’s meager civil service salary, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She wants to repair her house but the saved amount is not enough to buy building materials. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a beautiful house, and for herself she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Tumaini Mbagala Group

texts.en:
Juma , who is in his early 40's, is married and has two children, who are still in school. He has been selling Irish potatoes at wholesale price for ten years now. He has been in his business since 2010. He works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Juma's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on his  Irish potatoes business. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy sacks of Irish potatoes to resale especially to chips seller. He dreams of improving his business buy going himself up country to buy the Irish potatoes at a cheaper price. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Tumaini  Mbagala " which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of Irish potatoes to sell, especially to chips sellers.

loans.name: Nelly Sonia

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer de 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tienen 2 hijos de 14 y 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad.
Ella es buena persona, amable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por reunir a la mayor parte de la población y por la producción manufacturera.
Nelly es morena, de cabello negro y baja estatura. Su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, bien en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; arroz, fide, azúcar, refrescos, golosinas, detergentes y otros, actividad que realiza en su tienda de barrio ubicada en un cuarto de su casa, “trato de mantener el negocio surtido y abastecido para no perder clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes frecuentes, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para abastecer y surtir el negocio. Su sueño es ampliar su tienda y convertirla en mini mercado, ella desea comprar abarrotes de primera necesidad por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. 
Es por esos motivos que Nelly solicita un préstamo para comprar abarrotes de primera necesidad para abastecer y surtir su tienda.
texts.en: 37-year-old Nelly lives with her husband and their to sons, aged 14 and 18. Her business involves selling basic goods and foodstuffs. She is a good, friendly and very hardworking person. She runs her business in the southern part of the city, which is where most of the people live and where there are a lot of manufacturing businesses.
