Nelly is dark-skinned, has black hair and is quite short. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she also speaks Spanish. She lives with her husband, who works as a builder, and her school-age children in their own home, a brick-built house with a corrugated iron roof, drinking water, electricity and plumbing. Her business involves selling basic goods and foodstuffs such as rice, noodles, sugar, soft drinks, sweets and detergent from her convenience store which is located in a room in her home. "I try to keep the shop well stocked so I don't lose customers" she says. The advantage of her business is that she has regular customers and the disadvantage is shortage of money with which to stock the shop.  is to extend her shop and turn it into a mini-market. She wants to buy basic groceries in bulk. This is her first loan cycle with the institution since she set up in business 4 years ago. This is why Nelly is applying for a loan to buy basic groceries to stock her shop.

loans.use: to buy basic groceries to stock her shop.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es:
Morena, vive en casa de su hermana junto a su madre y sus dos hijos; es madre soltera pero recibe una ayuda económica del padre de sus hijos para la manutención de los mismos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, empezó esta actividad económica hace más de tres años con fondos propios, hoy en día ya cuenta con dos puestos de venta de ropa los cuales están ubicados en el Mercado Municipal de su localidad, Morena empieza su jornada laboral a las 8:00 a.m. y termina a las 4:00 p.m., 
Ella solicita un crédito para el fortalecimiento de su negocio mediante la compra de un fardo de ropa usada, de esa manera busca tener más productos que ofrecerle a sus clientes, y así obtener más ingresos económicos para poder pagar puntualmente su crédito.
Sus sueños son ayudar a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Morena, her two children and her mother live with Morena's sister.  Morena is a single mother and her children's father helps to support the children.  Morena operates a business selling used clothing.  She used her own savings to start the business three years ago and has two stands in the local market now where she can meet her customers.  She normally works from 8:00am to 4:00pm.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy bulk supplies of used clothing.  The investment will increase the supply of clothing she can sell and strengthen her business.  Her hope for the future is that she can provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, vieron una gran oportunidad de mejorar a través de las capacitaciones que ofrecen los programas de la fundación paraguaya, en especial el de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Silvina, una mujer muy comprometida con el grupo, ya que es la presidenta, se esfuerza por ser el ejemplo para sus compañeras, a la vez que trabaja en la venta de ropas variadas, es una persona muy trabajadora. Pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con una buena cantidad de ropas, como ser jeans, camisas, remeras, pantalones, blusas y otros, de manera a poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes una buena variedad, y a la vez seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The 17 members of our community bank are hard-working businesswomen.  They saw an opportunity to improve their skills by taking classes offered by Fundación Paraguaya and are making the most of the foundation's efforts to eliminate poverty in the country.  

Sra. Silvina is strongly invested in the group and its members have elected her as their president.  She is a hard-working woman and strives to be an example to her fellow members.  She operates a business selling clothing and will use her share of the loan to stock her business with jeans, shirts, t-shirts, trousers and other clothing that she will resell.  The investment will give her a wider range of merchandise to sell and, in turn, allow her to continue working for the good of her family.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima, hails from the town of Clarin, Bohol. She is married and has six children. Five of whom are still attending school. She raises and sold hogs. She works hard to support the needs of her children. She has been raising hogs for almost ten years now.

She needs funds to support her existing project. She has requested a loan to buy feed for the pigs . It could boost her income and continue to handle it wisely. Thus, she could support her family and provide better living condition. She dreams of having a car that could be used in transporting his livelihood to become at ease.

She is hoping that someday, she will be productive in her chosen field.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a flower pot making in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to pays for laborers salaries for making flower pots.

Mely has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Mely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pays for laborers salaries for making flower pots.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is a 33-years old married woman and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

Her husband has been running a restaurant for many years and handling the financial condition of his household. One of her sons serves as a waiter. This restaurant has been supporting the whole family for many years. Nowadays, her husband wants to offer more menu items to his valuable customers, so that he can grow his income.

Samina is requesting a loan for the restaurant establishment. In fact, her husband wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. Sheis hopeful that this loan will help to generate more profit and savings as well.

Samina thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy food items for her husband's restaurant so he can increase the menu.

loans.name: Phong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phong, 34 years old, is the Thai ethnic woman. She has been joining in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since 2009. She currently lives with her husband and her three children, one son and two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main income is from farming, so the income after each harvest is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount. She wants to buy a breeding cow but her savings are not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. 

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a good breeding cow, and in the coming period, the breeding cow will bring her family lovely calves. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy a breeding cow.

loans.name: Cerilina

texts.en:
Cerilina is in farming to support her family. She and her family lives in San Miguel, Bohol. Since her husband is not earning enough from carpentry, she helps him by farming.

Cerilina's money was used for farm inputs and she is as asking for a loan so she can further support the school needs of her children. She will use it to buy school uniforms for her seven school- aged children and to pay for their tuition fees. She and her husband help each other in tilling the land, hoping for a good yield. They anticipate a better life with the help of this loan. Any income derived from this business will be spent on her family’s daily consumption, school expenses and future business investment.

loans.use: to buy school uniform and pay for school fees for her seven children

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.es:
Crecencia es de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella tiene 3 hijos por quienes está luchando para poder darles una buena calidad de vida, y comenta que por medio de sus ventas en la despensa tiene los medios necesarios para procurar una vida digna.
Crecencia es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere crecer y mejorar, es por ello que pone todo de sí para poder lograrlo. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas variadas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Crecencia lives in the city of Encarnación.  She is working hard to support her 3 children and provide them with a good quality of life.  She tells us that her earnings from her business provide a sufficient income for a decent standard of living.

Crecencia wants to grow and improve her business and is applying for a loan that she will use to buy soft drinks.  The investment will allow her to stock a product that she needs to carry on her business.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Maloumie

texts.en:
Maloumie is a 35-year-old member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and she lives in Pasay City. She runs a buy-and-sell business which focuses mainly on selling ready-to-wear clothes for women. Others thought that having this kind of business would be easy. However, revolving funds are indeed a big factor to succeed in any industry.

Currently, Maloumie is just renting a space to run her business. She aspires to have her own space so that she will no longer have to pay monthly rental. She decided to apply for a loan amount of PHP 10,000 to buy more quality designs of ready-to-wear clothes as she wants to make the business succeed for her family.

Maloumie believes that if you want to have success, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly meetings of her fellowship group of CCT partners, which consists of 15 to 30 members. Here she can gain spiritual strength from each member’s life-changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, repay microfinance loans, and hear God’s word conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy more quality designs of ready-to-wear clothes for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 28-year-old single young man. Three years ago, he graduated from college and opened his own shop where he sells mobile accessories to cover his needs and expenses. Ihab is an ambitious and independent man who has a good reputation in his area.

Ihab is working hard to develop his business, thus today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with new collection of mobile accessories to satisfy his customers' needs.
Ihab hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with new collection of mobile accessories to satisfy his customers' needs

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La clienta luz Marina quiere seguir expandiendo su negocio , ella sigue dedicándose a sus tienda de abarrotes y su deseo es abrir otro negocio mas con el tiempo, con si tienda de abarrotes ella sustenta a su familia y lucha por tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella sueña tener todos los productos posibles para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.
Luz necesita capital para comprar un mostrador, arroz ,leche,aceite, entre otros productos que la demanda requiere, por fines de año. 
luz es muy responsable y emprendedora ella esta feliz que los inversionista de KIVA confíen en ella.
texts.en: Our client, Luz Marina, has long operated a corner grocery and hopes to open another one day.  The business has allowed her to support her family and work toward a better quality of life.  For now, she wants to offer all the products that her customers might want and is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy a display case and the rest to stock her business with rice, milk, cooking oil and the other products she sells.  Luz is a responsible businesswoman and grateful for the confidence that Kiva lenders have placed in her in the past.

loans.use: to pay for a display case and merchandise that she will resell.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is a married mother of 4 children. She has 2 sons and 2 daughters.

Sayora’s husband is Gulomjon. He is a kind man. His income is not enough to provide his family with all necessary things. Sayora during many years has dreamed to start her own business. With this aim she took part in a course “To Get Ahead” from a women's organization. She learned a lot of new and useful information for herself.

Sayora is going to start a business buying and selling milk products. She will buy milk in bulk, process it, and sell in a local market. Sayora will manage this business alone. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somonis to buy milk. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Ccochayoc Bajo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal CCOCHAYOC BAJO, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quellouno, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Concepción  continua dedicándose a la agricultura y crianza de animales, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes entre otros.
Los socios en general se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "CCOCHAYOC BAJO" communal bank. The bank is located in Quellouno district, in the province of La Convención, Cusco department.

The member Concepción continues working in farming and raising animals. She continues to raise animals to later sell them to her clients when they request them. She is a responsible person and she has had her business for some time. It provides her with personal satisfaction amongst others, this being her manner to get her family ahead.

Concepción is requesting the loan to buy manure and fertilizer amongst others.

The members as a group are grateful for the loan awarded and promise to comply with their established payments.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer amongst others.

loans.name: Together Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy is 43 years old and she is married. 
She has been working in agriculture farming rice for more than 10 years. 
Thúy lives in Yen Dinh district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough for her to cover the life cost and save money.
The main hardship that Thúy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to improve productivity and increase her income by purchasing more good quality seeds and fertilizer.
In 2013, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of "Together", which consists of three members. 
In the future, Thúy hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to improve farm productivity and increase income by purchasing good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina has been engaged in a sari-sari (general store) store business to earn a living. She is a married woman and lives in Calape, Bohol. Her husband works hard as a farmer.

Aside from having a store, Fedelina is focusing on selling food to the community. This is her main reason why she is asking for a loan; she needs capital to buy food ingredients such as sugar, milk and flour. Another problem is they need an amount to buy seedlings and fertilizer for their farm.

Her goal in life is to improve her food selling business, and we can help her by lending her the amount she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as sugar, milk and flour and to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Tulozizi Group

texts.fr: A l'issu de son précédent crédit, Norbert a réalisé un gain de cent dollars sur les deux cents investis. Il a pu agrandir son étendue culturale et répondre à quelques besoins sociaux de sa famille (frais scolaires, alimentation et soins médicaux). L'eau d'irrigation qui constituée l'obstacle majeur au cours du crédit a été résolu grâce à l'intervention d'une organisation. Ce présent crédit demandé servira à renforcer les travaux de labour, sarclage, achat d'engrais et de produits phytosanitaires.
texts.en: As a result of his previous loan, Norbert made a $100 dollar increase on the $200 dollars invested. He was able to increase his growing plot and meet some of his family's needs (school fees, food, medical expenses). Water for irrigation posed a major problem during the loan and was resolved thanks to assistance from an organization. This new loan will help to strengthen manual labor, hoeing, and purchasing fertilizer and pesticide products.

loans.use: to transplant, hoe, and buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, diapers, noodles and various spices.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to ensure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester, who is in her mid 30s, is married with four kids. Three of her children are still in school while one is only young.

Ester has been selling fruits and vegetables for five years now. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Ester’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her genge (grocery store) stock, and she is now serving more people. She paid back her first loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, and to cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to restock the missing items in her genge (grocery store) business in order to meet customer demand. She dreams of opening a genge duka (a grocery shop).

Esther will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in her genge (grocery store) business in order to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Mungu Bariki Group

texts.fr: Eliakimu reconnaît la contribution du précédent crédit dans l'achat de produits phytosanitaires, le paiement de la main d'œuvre,...Les résultats atteints l'ont permis de rembourser ce crédit, d'acheter une chèvre et la survie familiale. La carence d'eau, principal obstacle  en saison sèche du fait que le canal a été dérouté, a été résolue grâce à l'intervention d'une organisation locale. Ce deuxième crédit lui permettra de renforcer le peu qu'il a dans ses activités champêtres tenant compte du fait qu'il s'est ajouté deux champs de plus.
texts.en: Eliakimu appreciates the contribution of the previous loan used to buy pesticides, to pay for manual labor... The results achieved allowed him to pay back the loan, to buy a goat and to help his family survive. The lack of water (the primary obstacle during the dry season as a result of the canal changing course) was resolved thanks to assistance from a local organization. This second loan will allow him to strengthen the little that he has in his rural business, taking into account that he has added two additional fields.

loans.use: to pay for manual labor, buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Marybel

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Marybel owns a farm and grows rice. She is a single woman residing in the town of Bilar, Bohol. She has been working the farm for 10 years but now she is in need of funds to be able to support and continue to improve her main source of income.

Marybel has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers. These will improve her yield and then help to improve her earnings too. In this way, she may be able to settle her obligations and start to set aside some of her profit for expansion.

In the future, Marybel is hopeful that she can continue to manage her rice farming livelihood and become prosperous.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, es una mujer de 46 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos, vive con su hijo menor de 17 años y su esposo de 50 años, ella se dedica a cultivo de maíz, desarrolla esta actividad desde que tenía la edad de 25 años, hoy en día lo trabaja junto a su esposo y todos los años siembran su cultivo de regadillo.
Marina solicita este crédito para poder realizar la compra de abono, fertilizante, semilla y para pagar la preparación de la tierra, con la compra de todos estos insumos ella espera obtener una buena cosecha y de esa manera fortalecer su negocio.
Sus aspiraciones son tener mayores ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Marina, 46, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband, 50, and youngest son, 17.  The family has operated a farming business, growing maize, for many years and Marina works alongside her husband to sow and harvest their crop.

Marina is applying for a loan that she will use to pay for the labor and supplies the family needs for their next crop.  The investment will increase their chances of a successful growing year.  When we asked her what hopes she has for the future, she told us that she wants a higher income and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Monus Bibi

texts.en:
Monus Bibi is 25 and the mother of 4 children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan.

Monus Bibi engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business two years ago because she wanted to help her husband to support the family and meet the household expenses.

Monus Bibi buys materials such as hand-embroidery kits, ribbons, needles and embroidery machines from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has now become an expert in the embroidery business. She has therefore asked for a loan so she will be able to buy these raw materials from the market.

She will be very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for embroidery to sell herself.

loans.name: Honaida

texts.en:
Honaida is a 27-year-old married mother of two. She runs a clothing sales shop in her village, to support her husband in making their living and develop their social and financial situation.

Her business is going just fine, but external financial support will help her increase her merchandise. Thus, she acquired a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. The loan will help Honaida purchase a newly released autumn and winter collection with encouraging prices.

She hopes that in the future, she can improve and develop her shop situation and do necessary decoration.

loans.use: to purchase a newly released autumn and winter collection with encouraging prices.

loans.name: Yande Diodio's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 20 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 17 avril 2010. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs. Elles ont de bonnes relations et s’activent dans le commerce, l’agriculture et l’embouche.Une bonne ambiance règne pendant les réunions de groupe.
NDEYE SIGA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 filles et 2 garçons. Elle s’active dans le commerce de produits agricoles et parallèlement dans la vente de beignets.
Avec le prêt reçu elle compte acheter  1 sac de navets à 5 000 FCFA  qu’elle revend à 7500 FCFA. Elle achète aussi 1 sac d’aubergines à 5 000 FCFA qu’elle revend à 7 000 FCFA. Elle achète également 1 sac de gombos à 20 000 FCFA qui est cédé à 25 000 FCFA. Pour  la vente de beignets qu’elle fait parallèlement, elle achète un sac de farine à 20 000 FCFA et un bidon d’huile de 20 litres à 20 000 FCFA. Le reste du prêt constitue son fond de roulement. les achats se font hebdomadairement.
Une partie des bénéfices sera réservée pour rembourser son prêt  et l’autre partie pour répondre aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
This group of 20 members is part of a Banc Villageois created on April 17, 2010. It consists of women from the same village and surrounding neighborhoods who get along well. They engage in commercial activities, farming and animal fattening. Their meetings take place in a good atmosphere.

NDEYE SIGA is the featured borrower from this group. She is the member seen standing on the right in the group photo, and raising her left hand. She is a 39 year-old married mother to 4 girls and 2 boys. One of her activities is the sale of produce, the other the sale of beignets.

She plans to use her loan to buy one sack of turnips for 5,000 FCFA to sell for 7,500 FCFA, one sack of eggplants for 5,000 FCFA to sell for 7,000 FCFA, and one sack of gumbo for 20,000 FCFA to sell for 25,000 FCFA. To make and sell her beignets, she will buy one sack of flour and one 20-liter jug of oil for 20,000 FCFA each. Any remainder will be added to her working capital as she stocks up weekly.

Part of her profits will be used to repay her loan, and the rest will help to provide for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy produce, oil and flour.

loans.name: Faranavela

texts.fr:
Le prêt précédent a permis à Faranavela d’augmenter le nombre de poules pondeuses à élever et l’agrandissement du poulailler. Elle a pu payer les frais engagés par la rentrée scolaire de ses filles, elle a de même augmenté son niveau d'épargne.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte développer encore plus son activité d’élevage en achetant 150 poules pondeuses et 1.5 tonnes de provendes pour ces poules. Elle a déjà les clients prêts à acheter les œufs. Elle espère constituer encore plus d’épargne pour garantir l’avenir de ses enfants et pense être autonome financièrement avec ce dernier prêt.
texts.en:
The previous loan allowed Faranavela to increase the number of egg-laying hens she raises and to expand her chicken coop. She could pay her daughters' fees for the start of the school year. She even increased her level of savings.

With this loan, she intends to increase her poultry business even further by purchasing 150 laying hens and 1.5 tons of feed for these chickens. She already has customers ready to buy the eggs. She hopes to save enough to secure her children's future and thinks she will be financially independent with this last loan.

loans.use: to buy 150 egg-laying hens and 1.5 tons of feed meal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a variety of furniture to sell.

loans.name: Hamidah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Hamidah, who is a 47-year-old widow with one son and one daughter. Hamidah is a housemaid for three years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Hamidah will be able to repay the loan received. She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Maris

texts.en:
Maris is a 21-year-old woman who lives in the rural town of Carmen, Bohol together with her partner in life. Maris runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries including soft drinks and other beverages, as well as other assorted goods. With these, she can better maintain her inventory and attract potential customers to the shop. In that way, she can roll out her capital and start to set aside some of the profit for expansion.

Maris is determined to make her shop more productive to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries including soft drinks and other beverages, and assorted goods.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 41 years old and married with seven children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Teresita has a buying and selling of bananas business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of bananas to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Dembe Seeta Group

texts.en:
Margret, a resident of Seeta, is a widow with two children. She is also a business lady dealing in grocery stores. She has applied for the loan of UGX 1,000,000 through the group.

She is currently faced with the challenge of limited capital and resorted to borrowing from UGAFODE Microfinance in order to increase her working capital. She appreciates the generous support of the Kiva lenders and UGAFODE.

The extra person seated is the group chairperson, who has a running loan but has to appear in the group because she is an executive. The group appreciates the commited support from you, the Kiva funders.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Umodzi Group

texts.en:
Wema is 32 and married. Her husband is running a business selling textiles. She has one child and one relative who depends on her.

Wema owns a business selling fruit juice. She has to buy more juice to stock up her business. One of her family members helps her with the running of the business. She started her business to support her family by providing household necessities, and to be self-dependent.

The profits from the business help her to feed her family and to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to build a good house and to open a big shop selling fruit juices on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: to buy more fruit juices for the business.

loans.name: M.asso Group

texts.en:
Matseliso is an 80-year-old mother of five children and grandmother of four, aged between 14 and 6 years. She, however, now lives on her own and has to take care of herself, and her children rarely visit.

Matseliso lives in a traditional hut that is not well ventilated, nor warms up well in winter. She works long hours to ensure there is enough food for herself on a daily basis, and only gets help on Saturdays and Sundays from her neighbour's children. She has to wake up very early, between 4:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m., during the week to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water, and warming the house for herself, and her day begins.

Collecting firewood, setting up the fire, and doing the actual cooking demands a lot of her time. Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high; winters can get very cold, and often Matseliso has to start the fire inside her hut. Starting a fire releases smog and smoke, which, when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time, can lead to lung diseases, eye problems, and in the worst case, to death. In these circumstances, life for women like Matseliso has been very difficult.

Matseliso has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, in order to be able to purchase a clean cookstove. These provide her, and 13 other people from her village who are living in similar circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families and that does not require a lot of fuel, which is hard to find in Lesotho, nor expensive paraffin and gas. This stove can be started with the use of very little, readily available biomass like dry twigs and dry cow dung that do not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the homes.

This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery, which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones, and a mini LED lamp. This is a life-improving package for these people. This stove saves them time to be with their families, saves energy, eliminates the element of toxic inhalation and house-burning, and has given them the freedom to have a better-lit home to see better in the evening while cooking, and enables children to do their homework.

For stove info, please check www.africancleanenergy.com.

loans.use: to pay for the ACE cookstove, which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel, and the time she spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Kabayan Group

texts.en:
Juanita is the featured borrower of the Kabayan group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. They have always been friends since they came from their hometown in the Philippines to work as housekeepers to provide their beloved families with the necessary standards of living.

Juanita is a 46-year-old, married mother of nine children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. Juanita is the second lady on the right.

As for the other group members, Nelly is the second lady on the left, Matilde is the first lady on the left, and Gorgonia is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino cumplió un año más de vida y continúa con su negocio de reparación de aparatos electrónicos. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando una computadora portátil, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio funcionó correctamente. Actualmente su negocio funciona mejor que antes porque cuenta con nuevas herramientas de trabajo, las cuentas las maneja mejor porque cuenta con computadora, “llevo más de 16 años reparando televisores y radios…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes frecuentes, la desventaja es la falta de una máquina para ensamblar los equipos. Su sueño es ampliar su mercado, él desea comprar una máquina ensambladora para mejorar el acabado de sus reparaciones. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marcelino solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina ensambladora para reparar televisores y radios.
texts.en:
Marcelino has completed another year of living and continues with his business of repairing electronic equipment. His last loan was invest in the purchase of a laptop. His loan payments were on time as his business ran well.

Currently his business is functioning better than before as he has new work equipment. He manages his accounting better since he has a computer. "I have been repairing televisions and radios for more than 16 years", he commented. The advantage of his business is that he has customers he sees frequently, his disadvantage is the lack of an assembly machine to improve the completion of his repairs. This is his second loan in the sixteen years he has run his business.

It is for these reasons Marcelino is requesting a loan to buy an assembly machine to repair televisions and radios.

loans.use: to buy an assembly machine to repair televisions and radios.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be caring.

He operates a retail business where he sells eggs. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to pay his children's school fees.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was successfully repaid.

He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Mebro

texts.en:
Mebro is a widow with four kids, three going to school. She does farming in Ruhaama Ntungamo.

In addition to farming bananas, she operates a bar in their trading centre where she sells local brew. All these activities have been the pillar supporting her and the family.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX to help her buy mulches and add stock of beverages, especially local brew in her business.

She requests Kiva funders and lenders for support.

In the picture is Mebro and a UGAFODE credit staff member at the banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy mulches.

loans.name: G.s Mar -Tinez Group

texts.es:
El Señor Jorge tiene 31 años de edad, es padre de cinco hijos, vive con su esposa de hogar una aldea al oriente de Honduras, Su actividad principal es la agricultura cultiva maíz y frijoles, donde cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de esta actividad.
Don Jorge  esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de fertilizante y semillas y poder cultivar 2 manzana de frijoles y una de maíz que es su proyecto y esto le ayudara a que le generen mayores ingresos en el hogar y con esto poder cubrir los gastos familiares para tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Su sueño es mejorar en su negocio y apoyar a su familia, esta solicitando el préstamo  de forma grupal sus integrantes.

Doña Jenny se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años.
Doña Jolany se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años.

Trojes, Honduras - Septiembre 2015
texts.en:
Jorge, age 31, has five children. He lives in a home in a village in the east of Honduras.  His main business activity is growing corn and beans.  He has a lot of experience managing this business activity. 

Jorge is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds, and to have the necessary capital to cultivate two squares of beans and corn, his main project.  This will help him to generate more income for the household.  With this he will be able to cover the family expenses in order to have a better quality of life.  His dream is to improve his business and support his family. He is requesting a group loan. 

Mrs. Jenny has been a farmer for many years
Mrs. Jolany has also been a farmer for many years

Trojes, Honduras - September, 2015

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his business

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia es una cliente dedicada y trabajadora tiene dos pequeños negocios, su sueño es expandir sus negocios y consolidarlos en su localidad. ella se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes y a su restaurante los fines de semana. 
la clienta tiene 58 años y es casada,su deseo es mejorar su negocio de restaurante para poder atender mas días a la semana.
Necesita el préstamo para comprar mesas, sillas, arroz, azúcar, aceite y bebidas refrescantes. Con este negocio saca  adelante a su familia.
La clienta esta contenta con el préstamo que Kiva le dio,se compromete  a cumplir sus plazos de pago puntualmente.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 58 years old and married. Dedicated and hardworking, she runs two small businesses in order to provide for her family: a grocery store and, on the weekends, a restaurant. Her goal is to expand her businesses in order to become well established in her community. Specifically, she wants to improve her restaurant so that she can be open to the public a few more days a week.

This borrower needs a loan to buy tables, chairs, rice, sugar, oil, and soft drinks. She is very happy with Kiva's support and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, rice, sugar, oil, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Fabiola Del Rosario

texts.es: Fabiola es una madre soltera, ella es muy trabajadora,  es dueña de su propio negocio de servicio de alimentos (vende pollos); solicita un préstamo con el fin de construir un patrimonio para ella y su hija.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a single mother and a very hard worker. She has her own business in the food-service industry, where she sells chickens.

She is requesting a loan in order to build a house for her daughter and herself.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials and expenses to build a house.

loans.name: Chimvano Group

texts.en:
Eunice is 45 years old and married. She has two children. Her husband is working as a watchman.

Eunice sells fish. She would like to use this loan to buy more fish to sell. She started her business to support her husband in some of the family's financial needs, such as buying food and clothes. The profits from the business will allow her to buy food for her family.

Eunice hopes to grow her business, whereby she will be able order more fish to supply in various large markets.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.es:
Visitación,  vive con su compañera de vida, un nieto y el grupo familiar de este; pero nadie  depende económicamente de él, trabaja de forma independiente en la siembra de maíz y frijol, también se dedica a la ganadería y a la venta de los mismos, su jornada laboral la comienza a las 6:00 a.m. y la finaliza a las 2:00 p.m. la ventaja es que conoce del negocio y hasta la fecha no presenta ninguna dificultad para el desarrollo de sus actividades. Él aprendió esta actividad gracias a su familia y ya cuenta con una experiencia de 50 años
Solicita un crédito para la compra de un toro, que le permitirá tener una mayor producción de ganado de buena raza, le permitirá aumentar la venta de leche y por ende obtendrá más ingresos.
Uno de sus sueños es tener 10 vacas lechera para poder distribuir la leche por todo su caserío y dar empleo a algunas personas de su localidad que más lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Visitación lives with his wife, a grandson and his family; but he has no one who is dependent on him. He is self-employed, growing corn and beans, and also rears and sells cattle. His working day begins at 6 a.m. and ends at 2 p.m. The advantage is that he knows the business and, so far, has had no difficulty in developing his activities . he learned his trade from his family and now has 50 years' experience.

he is applying for a loan to buy a bull, which will enable him to breed more pedigree cattle. This will then allow him to sell more milk and ultimately boost his income.

One of his dreams is to have 20 dairy cows so he can distribute milk throughout the whole village and provide employment for some local people who are in most need.

loans.use: to buy a bull, which will enable him to breed more pedigree cattle.

loans.name: Jubaedah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Jubaedah, who is a 43-year-old married woman with one son and one daughtrer. Jubaedah has been selling breakfast food and her husband has been selling grilled chicken for five years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but her income is able to repay the loan.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Grisli Cristel

texts.es: Grisli es una joven emprendedora que posee experiencia en trabajos de soldadura y desea desempeñarse en este campo de forma propia, para esto necesita un préstamo de quinientos dólares ($500) para poder desarrollar su proyecto y generar ingresos propios.
texts.en:
Grisli is an enterprising young woman with welding experience.

She wants to pursue this occupation on her own, which is why she needs a loan in the amount of $500 in order to carry out her business project and make her own income. She will invest this loan in welding equipment.

loans.use: to buy welding equipment.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El Sr. Isidro es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene una despensa bien surtida en la cual todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo comprar insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo de vuelta en la compra de verduras, frutas, carne, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas y cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Isidro comes from the city of Itá. He owns and runs a well stocked grocery shop where he works every day from very early in the morning. He says that thanks to his previous loan he was able to buy supplies so he could continue selling goods. He is applying for this new loan so that he can invest it in the purchase of vegetables, fruit, meat, baked goods, etc. This will enable him to keep his business going and meet the demand from his customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, baked goods and other supplies for his grocery business.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo es un hombre trabajador de 57 años de edad que habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y el hijo de ella de 9 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de albañil independiente, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante, además se apoya en el cultivo de granos básicos. Domingo siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante ha decidido cambiar las láminas del cuarto de su vivienda que le permita brindar seguridad a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar las láminas del cuarto de su vivienda, ya que el crédito anterior lo invirtió en insumos para la agricultura.
texts.en:
Domingo is a 57-year-old working man who lives in a house of his own along with his life companion and her 9-year-old son. 

He is a very hard-working man who makes a living offering his services as an independent builder, which has allowed him to get by.  In addition, he also relies on farming basic grains.  

Domingo, always looking for a way to move ahead, has decided to change the metal sheets on the room of his house which allows him to provide his family with security.  This is why he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to change the metal sheeting of the room of his house, since he invested the previous loan in agricultural supplies.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to change the metal sheets of the room of his house.

loans.name: Rosalina De La Paz

texts.es: Rosalina es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Rosalina vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 14 años de edad en casa de su propiedad desde hace 7 años. Ella desea invertir en maíz por mayor, además de zapatos y sandalias, ya que ella es una mujer visionaria que siempre busca la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz por mayor para su venta de tortillas, zapatos y sandalias para vender.
texts.en: Rosalina is a hard-working woman who for 3 years has made and sold tortillas for a living.  This job has allowed her to advance her family forward. Rosalina has lived with her life partner and their 14-year-old child in their own house for 7 years.  She wishes to invest in wholesale corn in addition to shoes and sandals, since she is a visionary woman who always looks for a way to improve her quality of life.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in: wholesale corn for her tortilla business, and shoes and sandals to sell.

loans.use: to invest in wholesale corn for tortilla sales, and shoes and sandals to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando a la venta de escabeche, plato que necesita muchos ingredientes y esfuerzo para  realizarlo, ella sueña con abrir un restaurante dado que tiene en cuenta  el boom gastronómico  que hay en el país en la gastronomía. La socia sueña tener las comodidades pertinentes  en su restaurante, ya que así podrá trabajar más cómoda y producir mejor.  La socia que pertenece al Banco Renovación, pidió su préstamo para comprar utensilios de cocina, pollo, yuca, zanahoria y cebolla; que son necesarios para realizar su escabeche.
La socia agradece el crédito que le otorgarán y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas en las fechas que se acordó en el contrato.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to sell escabeche (dish of cooked, marinated meat or fish, served cold), a dish that has many ingredients and requires a lot of work to make.

She dreams of opening a restaurant as she is aware of the boom in gastronomy in her country. She would like to have all the conveniences a restaurant requires so that she can work comfortably and be more productive. The borrower belongs to Banco Renovacion and is asking for a loan so she can buy kitchen utensils, chicken, yucca, carrots, and onions which are all required to make her escabeche.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on the dates agreed to in her contract.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, chicken, yucca, carrots, and onions

loans.name: Maikudi

texts.en:
Maikudi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Maikudi is grateful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Maikudi would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maikudi will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Maikudi now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to expand his agriculture business for himself and family members; he would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Philibus

texts.en: Philibus is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Philibus is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Philibus would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Philibus will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Philibus now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: Shehu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Shehu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Shehu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Shehu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a maize farmer from Yan Gwari village. As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Ayuba will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ayuba no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Ayuba hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a maize farmer from Kozo village. As a Babban Gona member, Daniel is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Daniel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. He will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Daniel no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Daniel hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saáde

texts.en: Saáde is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Saáde is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Saáde would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saáde will store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Saáde now has the opportunity to actualize her dream of growing her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sani is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 MT/Ha, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Sani would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sani will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Sani now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 40 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

Evangeline has been farming rice for eight years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

loans.name: Mandisa

texts.en:
Mandisa is 25 years old, single, and has one child. She operates a daycare center and a transport business ferrying children to and from school, which she has been doing for three years. She is diligent and has remained resilient expanding her business and employing two people.

Mandisa faces the challenge of a lack of space, resulting in overcrowding in the center. She wants to create more space and is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy building material and pay for construction of an extra classroom, thus expanding the center. She hopes to set a good example for her daughter and the community.

loans.use: to purchase cement, paint, and roofing material.

loans.name: Ronal Alexander

texts.es: Ronald es un hombre trabajador de 37 años de edad que vive con su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos dos niñas de 6 y 1 años y un varón de 3 años de edad. Ronald se dedica a prestar sus servicios de soldador de obra de banco, elaborando puertas, balcones, ventanas entre otras estructuras metálicas. Ronald desea construir un desagüe, en el área de su huerto casero, además desea encementar el piso de una parte del corredor, ya que el agua se estanca anidando plagas de mosquitos, lo que causa enfermedades a su familia principalmente a sus hijos. Por lo anterior Ronald solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina y polines para construir un desagüe y encementar el corredor evitando las enfermedades a los más pequeños.
texts.en:
Ronald is a hard worker. He is 37 years old and lives with his life partner and their three children: two girls and a boy. His daughters are ages six and one, and his son is three. He works providing welding services in construction projects. He makes doors, balconies, windows, and other metal structures.

Ronald wants to build a drainage system in his home garden, and also cement part of the floor in the veranda, because water stagnates and becomes a breeding ground for mosquitoes that can cause disease. He wants to protect his family from this risk, especially his children, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal, and beams to complete these two projects.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal, and beams in order to build a drain and cement his veranda.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary is 36 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Cheung Prey District, Kampong Cham Province, where she is a farmer on a rice field. Her husband is also a farmer. This couple can make a net profit of approximately $6 a day.

Nary is facing a financial issue in her family in that she needs money to buy some materials that related to making palm and farming on the farmland. She requested a loan, which she will use to buy the needed materials.

loans.use: to purchase materials that related to making palm and farming.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is from Solana. She lives with her spouse and four children. She is managing a store and her spouse is involved in the farming business. Together, they earn income for the family, especially for the education of her children. Two among her children are being sent to school.

She wants to continuously provide for their needs. Her income from the store is not enough to cover all their expenses. He wanted to improve the farming business, that is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy insecticides and pay labor costs in farming. Giving enough nutrition to crops will help improve production, leading to a good income someday.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and pay for labor costs in farming.

loans.name: Chasing Hoyalty Group

texts.en:
Diana, in the center of the picture, is the featured borrower of Chasing Hoyalty's Group. She and her group members have been friends since they came to Lebanon to earn a living.

Diana is 33 years old, single, and has three children. She works as a housekeeper. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to pay for her children's school fees.

As for the other group members, Jenelyn, who is on the left, will also use the loan to pay for her children's school fees. Anthoniette, who is on the right, will use the loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lolita is 61 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Lolita has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of rice to resell.

Lolita has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to resell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Zenaida is 47 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Zenaida has a buying and selling of beverages business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of beverages to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Zenaida has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger tiene la edad de 47 años, está casado  y vive con los hijos y la esposa  actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Roger is 47 years old, married, and currently lives with his wife and children.

He wants this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to help start a new coffee crop. He wants to be able to properly maintain his crops in order to achieve higher production, which would in turn increase his income.

His long-term goal is to give his family a better quality of life and more financial stability. He wants to keep growing as a person and as a coffee grower. This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR. He has never had access to other loans, such as through a public bank, but FUDECOSUR grants loans with easier payment terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Lanie

texts.en:
Since Ma. Lanie operates a motorized tricycle unit (one of the common means of public transportation in the Philippines), she’s thankful to Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and lenders for considering her previous loan application and story in the Kiva website. Without the amount, she would not know how the business would survive every time something needs to be fixed on the vehicle, since supplementary capital is what she’s lacking.

The amount that she applied for before was used for buying spare parts needed for the tricycle unit. Each month, she’s earning approximately PHP 6,000.

Aside from operating the vehicle, she also wants to establish another business, which will be focused on selling snacks like hamburgers and soda. She’ll apply for another loan of PHP 10,000 that will be used for establishing the food business, and the spare amount will be used for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

She’s praying for God’s guidance since entering a different business line will be very challenging, and hopes that God may touch the hearts of people who have the capability to help and return abundant blessings to them.

Despite being busy managing the business, Ma. Lanie spares time for attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals, where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners, is able to hear God’s word, studies the Word of God, builds social relationships with other partners, and pays microfinance loans.

loans.use: to establish an added business focused on selling snacks like hamburgers and soda, and she'll use the spare amount for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Angelica works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and a general store. Angelica is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of clothes to sell.

Angelica has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives in his native city, Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region, with his wife, daughter and retired mother. Artur has one more daughter who is already married and lives with her family. His youngest daughter is 19 years old and she works as a hairdresser. Artur has worked as a watchman for many years. Artur’s wife has a vocational medical education and for many years she has worked at the hospital and sanitorium.

Artur is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as the amount will help him to solve his beloved wife’s dental problems, which cause great discomfort and hardship for her in her everyday life.

loans.use: to solve his beloved wife’s dental problems, which cause great discomfort and hardship for her in her everyday life.

loans.name: Nasreen Bibi

texts.en:
Nasreen Bibi is 49, living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a very hard worker. He owns a small hotel in which he offers types of delicious food two times a day. He has been running this restaurant for three years and earning a good profit from the business. He offers tea to his customers also.

Now he wants to establish his hotel by purchasing new plastic furniture, utensils, etc. Due to household expenses, his savings are not enough to buy the desired things. Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils, etc. She thanks Kiva and appreciates the warmth support for her.

loans.use: invest in her husband's hotel

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe hails from the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol. She is married and has a 17-year-old son. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods ranging from eggs, seasonings, edible oil, assorted canned goods and biscuits to soft drinks. She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for almost five years now, serving mostly locals in her place.

Ma. Fe decided to avail herself of a loan to buy groceries like beverages, condiments and toiletries. With the presence of these, she could maximize her resources, enabling her to maintain the flow of merchandise. Thus, she could start to save and invest in any possible business to become successful.

She has successfully repaid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting another loan to further expand her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy groceries like beverages, condiments and toiletries.

loans.name: Mtondo Group

texts.en:
Mirriam is 52 and single. She has two children and three relatives who depend on her.

Mirriam sells sorghum and tomatoes for a living. With this loan, she is going to buy more tomatoes and sorghum for her business. She started her business to be self-reliant and to be able to send her children to school.

The profits from the business help her to feed her family and send her children to school. Her plan is to renovate her house and to grow her business to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and tomatoes for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a vulcanizing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Evelyn is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her 7 past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is 27 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jocel has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

Jocel has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Cebu Group

texts.en:
Rhoda is the featured borrower of Cebu Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. They trust each other since they came from the Philippines to work hard to cover their families' living.

Rhoda is a 39-year-old married mother of four children who works as a housekeeper to provide her beloved family with the necessary standard of living. The loan she has applied for will be sent to her family back in the Philippines to pay her children's school tuition fees. Rhoda is the first lady on the right.

With respect to the other group members, Lucila is the lady standing in the middle, and Annabelle is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Saldy

texts.en:
A 51-year-old man named Saldy raised his family by being in the fishing business. He is a married man who has four children aged 24, 19, 17 and 11 years old. In spite of the obstacles that Saldy has encountered, including bad weather conditions that always hinder his ability to increase his catch, he is determined to continue running his livelihood.

He aims in the future to enhance his livelihood so he can provide the necessities for his family. In addition to fishing, Saldy does buying and selling of scrap. With this, he is asking for a bigger amount of loan for boat maintenance and to buy more scrap to sell.

loans.use: to pay for boat maintenance and to buy more scrap.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo, who is 68 years old, runs a general store selling goods such as sugar, edible oil, eggs, canned goods, soft drinks, and school supplies (e.g., notebooks, intermediate pad paper, ball pens, and bond paper). He is married and has seven grown children. He also engages in farming; he grows rice.

Alfredo decided to join Kiva, through its field partner CEVI, to boost his sources of income. He wants to purchase supplies such as soft drinks, canned goods, and fertilizers for his farm. These supplies could enhance the inventory of his store and improve the yield of his farm. He is determined to make his income more sustainable in the coming years.

Alfredo is thankful to Kiva for the continued support.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as soft drinks, canned goods, and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Black Tiger 1 Group

texts.en:
Jhona is the featured borrower of Black Tiger 1 Group. She is the first one from the right, wearing a pink top. Along with the other group members, she has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. They have been friends since they came to Lebanon to earn a living.

Jhona works as a housekeeper. She is a 33-year-old widowed mother of two. She has applied for a loan to pay for her children's school education fees.

As for the other group members, Aileen is the lady in the center and Elani is the first from the left. Their acquired loans will also be invested in paying for their respective children's school education fees.

loans.use: To pay her children's school education fees.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 54 years old and married with five children.

Mila works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Mila has been in this business for 13 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Mila aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nunufar

texts.en:
Nunufar is 55 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Sevan City of Gegharkunik region. She has a high medical education and works at the city’s hospital as a doctor-neurologist, which she has been doing since 1984.

Nunufar’s husband is retired and their son works at the police station of Sevan City. Her daughter like her mother is going to become a doctor and is in her last year of studying at the Yerevan State Medical University. She is an intellectual young woman, who has a fiancé.

Nunufar requested a loan for 700,000 Armenian drams, which she will use to organize her daughter’s wedding party and purchase presents for her daughter and her future husband.

loans.use: to organize her daughter’s wedding party and purchase presents for her daughter and future husband.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is the age of 33; she is a mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is living with her brother due to some family disputes. Her brother is a rickshaw driver by profession.

For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

Therefore, Shahida has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her brother to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Shahida is so much thankful to Kiva and brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the rickshaw for her brother's transportation services.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is the age of 40 and a mother of five children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 5 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Kousar buys materials such as a hand- embroidery kit, ribbon, needles and embroidery machine from the market. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in embroidery business. So, Kousar demanded a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

Kousar will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw material for herself.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is the age of 48; she is mother of five children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc.

He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up a very good relationship with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town. That is the reason his business is running well.

Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Haleema requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Haleema thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Haleema hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demand. Her family. Haleema thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Tumaini Riz Group

texts.fr: Les travaux de sarclage, de repiquage, l'achat de produits phytosanitaires et d'engrais ont été facilités grâce au crédit que Godefroid a reçu de PAIDEK. Il a réuni une somme de cent-vingt dollars après déduction des coûts d'exploitation et les charges familiales. Au cours de la saison passée, il a fait le constat que son petit lopin de terre influencé sa faible production, raison pour laquelle pour cette campagne, il a élargi son champ afin d'atteindre des résultats conséquents.
texts.en: With the loan that Godefroid received from PAIDEK he was able to pay for hoeing and transplanting work and the purchase of herbicides and fertilizer. He made $120 dollars after deducting the farming costs and family expenses.
