Over the course of the last season, he made the observation that his small plot of land impacted his weak production; for this reason he expanded his plot this season in order to achieve better results.

loans.use: to pay for labor, transplanting, hoeing, herbicides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rainbow Group

texts.en:
Lily is the featured borrower of Rainbow Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work as housekeepers and support their beloved families.

Lily is a 41-year-old married mother of four children. She has been working as a housekeeper to provide them with the necessities of living and education. She is working hard to make sure that her children can benefit from the best education and living standards to make sure they can acquire a better future. Lily is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Lily is the first lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Perlita is the lady standing in the middle, and Maridel is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is very happy to have a chance to repeat her deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon. Her first Kiva loan, in 2011, was very helpful, enabling her to enlarge the number of her farm cattle and thus increase her family's income.

Lilit is 37 years old and lives in Lchashen village, in the Gegharkunik region. She has a son and a daughter. Her husband is now working abroad in the Russian Federation. For several years, Lilit worked as a geography teacher at Lchashen's village school; since 2006, she has been working for the village's administration as a secretary. She also takes care of her farm and has a nice, rich vegetable garden.

Lilit is happy to say that, with her farming income and her husband’s support from abroad, she managed to do some repairs on her cute house. She will be so thankful and pleased if Kiva lenders help her with a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, which she plans to use to buy furniture for her sleeping room. She is so hopeful and greatly impatient for this support.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her sleeping room.

loans.name: Tisaiwale Group

texts.en:
Mercy is 49 and married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children who depend on her.

Mercy owns a grocery store. She would like to use this loan to buy groceries in bulk to stock her store. She has a family member who helps with the running of the business. She started her business to be self-reliant. The profits from the store help her to provide for daily household necessities and to pay for her children's school fees.

Mercy hopes to buy a minibus and to start irrigation farming in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is a 22-year-old, married mother of two. She started, almost a year ago, working as a tutor to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She has professional skills in this domain. She studied nursery in an institute. She is a very patient teacher who is loved by her students.

Today, Nour is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her driving license, which will help her use a car to facilitate transportation to her students’ houses. Nour hopes to expand her business more in the future and open her own nursery to increase her income and provide her family with descent living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her driving license to facilitate transportation to her students' houses.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
This woman is 44 years old and she lives with her large family in Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region. Sona lives with her husband, son, daughter and her parents-in-law. Sona and her family members are busy with farming and only the sale of the farm products makes their large family’s income. Potato production also brings some more income since this region has a perfect climate and also farmers here are just masters in the cultivation of this vegetable. Sona sells it to resellers right from her farm.

Sona and her husband are doing their best to have more income from their farming since in the near future they are going to organize their nice daughter’s wedding party. Like any parent they just dream to see their daughter as a nice and happy bride on that day and forever as well. Sona is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, which will greatly support them for their daughter’s wedding party organization, making a cheerful and magic day in the life of the just married couple.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s wedding party organization to make a cheerful and magic day in the life of the just married couple.

loans.name: Kyzdarkan

texts.ru: Кыздаркан, 60 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, занимается животноводством. Стартовав с 2,000 сом (KGS) в 1994 году, благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Кыздаркан имеется 3 коровы, 30 овец и 5 лошадей, фруктовый сад для собственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кыздаркан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Кыздаркан хочет вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Kyzdarkan is 60 years old, married, and a mother of five children. She has a secondary education, and works in animal husbandry. Having started with 2,000 som (KGS) in 1994, thanks to her hard work Kyzdarkan now has 3 cows, 30 sheep, 5 horses and an orchard for growing fruit for her own consumption. Her monthly income is around 25,000 som (KGS). In order to further expand her farm, Kyzdarkan applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. With income from the loan, Kyzdarkan wants to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Zhyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан, 55 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2005 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Жылдызкан на сегодняшний день имеет 10 овец, корову, на участке также выращивает плодовые деревья. Она в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Zhyldyzkan is 55 years old, and married with five children. She has a secondary education, and to earn an income for her family she works in animal husbandry, having started in 2005. Thanks to her tireless hard work, today Zhyldyzkan has 10 sheep and a cow, in an area of land where she also grows fruit trees. In order to further develop her business, she applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. With income from the loan, Zhyldzkan plans to invest in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a 47-year-old, married mother of four. She has worked hard for seven years from her house, selling women’s special deigned traditional Abaya, to support her husband who is abroad seeking a better income business.

Today, since Safiya and her business are well known in her region, she is investing an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her Abaya capital with a special newly released autumn and winter collection.

She might also help her son to buy a car in the near future, in addition to that she will make sure to develop her business properly, and open a wider shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her Abaya capital with a special newly released collection.

loans.name: Davliyor

texts.en:
Davliyor was born in the year 1995. He is a young, smart man from north Tajikistan. Davliyor dreams to work for the well being of the society. He now is a student of the 2nd course, Medical University of Tajikistan. Davliyor studies well to be a good specialist in the future.

He is asking for a loan because his parents are workers and they do not have opportunity to pay for his university tuition. Davliyor awaits your mercy and hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 27 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Because it was hard for Naseem to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband, some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work, and she has gained great confidence as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

Now Naseem has requested a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell.

loans.name: Yehowa Dzi Mila Group

texts.en:
The Yehowa Dzi Mila Group is in its sixth loan cycle with ID Ghana. It is in the city of Accra, in Chorkor, an urban poor area of the capital of the country. They are very tenacious and sacrificing women who are into local food, smoked fish, gizzard and sausage.

Comfort is one of the members who makes a living by selling smoked fish from house to house to her customers. She will buy more fish from the fishermen, as well as firewood, and she will smoke the fish and sell it to her customers. In this way she makes a living in a dignified and honest way.

Through her sacrifice, she is helping people that she wants to help and those who struggle. The profit that she will make from her sales will be used to take care of her two children and to expand her work. She is a single parent who is responsible for every expense incurred by her family.

The business will help her to continue with her efforts as she has been. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to be someone in life and improve her small enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more fish and firewood to smoke the fish, which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Akeela

texts.en:
Akeela is 42 years old and married. Some years ago she started her tailoring business to help support her household. She is very talented and well-respected in her community for the quality of her work. She works hard continually to provide an income for the family’s everyday expenses.

Akeela has now applied for a 45,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner Kashf to buy more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors to sew more dresses without delay to boost her earnings. She wants to spend it on providing a better quality life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors.

loans.name: Tiyamike Group

texts.en:
Grace is 48 years old. She is divorced and is raising her five children and one orphan on her own.

Grace sells maize for a living. She would like a loan to buy more maize for her business. The profits from the business will help her pay school fees for her children and house rent. She started her business to be self-dependent and to be financially stable.

Her plan is to build her own house and she hopes to own a farm so she can do commercial farming.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 39-year-old married mother of two who opened her current clothing shop in December 2014 to support her family and develop their livelihood. Farah has eleven years of experience in her domain, and she is investing this experience in a well-managed way.

She is obtaining a loan today, from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise by offering special autumn and winter collections.

She is working hard to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: increase her merchandise by offering special autumn and winter collections.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Erlinda works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns income from fattening pigs and farming rice. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to realize her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду, Гулмира на сегодняшний день имеет 4 коровы и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulmira has successfully repaid her loan, having used the money as intended. She thanks Kiva and everyone who helped finance her loan. Thanks to her tireless hard work, today Gulmira has 4 cows and 10 sheep. In order to further develop her business, Gulmira applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves for fattening and resale. With income from the loan, she plans to invest in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Taggi

texts.en:
Taggi is a hardworking lady. The need to meet everyday expenses compelled her to initiate her own business selling milk. She is a 60-year-old married woman. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Her job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them.

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income to meet their everyday expenses. Therefore, Taggi has requested a loan of 45,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy one more buffalo so she can cater to more customers and thus provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: buy one more buffalo so she can cater to more customers and thus provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani, 51 years old, is an energetic, married woman. She along with her husband (also shown in the photo) is doing a business manufacturing garlands and gajras (a flower garland, which women in Pakistan wear during traditional festivals). They have become popular in their community for selling beautiful garlands for parties and weddings.

To meet the increasing demands of her customers, Rani has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase a variety of flowers such as roses, jasmine and chrysanthemums, along with threads and needles. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of flowers such as roses, jasmine and chrysanthemums, along with threads and needles.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home, as her husband’s income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Nasreen is popularly known in her area for her skills in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business.

Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 60,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase a new stitching machine, along with threads of different colors to stitch up more dresses on time. She hopes to get an increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, along with threads of different colors to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Taj

texts.en:
Taj is 52 years old, married and the mother of five children. Her husband's income is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she started selling milk produced by her buffalos. Taj has been in business for many years and has become well-known in her area for providing good-quality milk. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to earn an extra amount of income.

With the support of Kiva's field partner Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She is currently applying for a 40,000 PKR loan to buy another buffalo to increase her profits so as to better provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She aspires to increasing the number of animals she presently owns.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo to provide her with more milk to sell.

loans.name: Danlami

texts.en:
Danlami is a maize farmer from Sabon Gari Daji village. As a member of Babban Gona, Danlami is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With its support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, in order to meet his immediate cash needs Danlami would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Danlami can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Danlami is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en:
Shamil. a 40-year-old married father of a daughter and a son, is an IDP (internally-displaced person) from Bilasuvar region. A very stern and hardworking man, he repairs cars and is a well-known master in the local market. People are aware of his skills and talents.

Because he is his family's sole support, Shamil tries to learn as many aspects of auto repair as possible and is familiar with various types of cars. Usually in rural areas auto mechanics are more familiar with Soviet style cars, but Shamil is also familiar with new types of automatic shift gears.

Currently he is planning to expand his business and is requesting a loan of 1200 AZN to buy new tools for repairing automobiles. He hopes that KIVA lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy new tools for repairing automobiles

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza is a kind woman from north Tajikistan. She was born in the year 1973. She is married and has two children and a grandchild. She is a very hardworking and smart woman. Shahnoza always tries for well being of her family. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 18 years. She has a great experience in this field.

Shahnoza needs financial support, because her grandchild is ill now. Shahnoza loves her grandchild very much. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy medicines for treatment of her grandchild. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of her grandchild.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 37-year-old, married mother of two. She has been working selling women and children’s clothes for four years to support her beloved family in developing their living and covering their increasing living needs.

Today, since living needs are increasing, Nada is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a newly released autumn and winter collection to attract more customers, and reply to current needs. She hopes to develop her business, so that one day she can diversify her products and might start selling men’s clothes too.

loans.use: to buy a newly released autumn and winter collection to attract more customers, and reply to current needs.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 37 years old and lives in Sevan, a city in the Gegharkunik region, with her husband and her daughter. Narine’s son is now doing his military service at the army. Narine’s husband is a worker, and he also helps Narine with the farming with which Narine is mainly busy.

On her farm she has cows, calves, a bull, pigs, sheep and chickens. From her farm Narine sells milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and eggs. For all these products Narine already has regular customer from her city. Narine likes her farm work, and she does it very properly and with pleasure.

Now she has a new idea, which she decided to realize if Kiva lenders help her. She needs this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to purchase a lot of bee families and all the needed items connected with beekeeping activities, since she is sure that she will develop this idea and have good honey product as well.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of bee families and all the needed items connected with beekeeping activities.

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo crédito ya que se avecina una de las mejores temporadas para las ventas y necesita tener fortalecido su negocio para poder continuar percibiendo ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su familia, realizará la compra de maíz, aceite, harina, bebidas, etc.; para la elaboración de pupusas y comida para vender.
Ella dice que con la ayuda que se le brinda con el otorgamiento de los créditos anteriores, ha podido continuar aportando a su grupo familiar y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Actualmente mantiene su negocio en las mismas condiciones pero que aun así ha  cancelado con la puntualidad requerida el crédito.
texts.en:
María is requesting a loan because the best season for sales is approaching and she needs to strengthen her business so she can keep having the income to support her family. She will buy corn, oil, flour, drinks, etc. for making and selling pupusas and other food.
She mentions that with the previous loans she's been able to continue supporting her family and have a better quality of life. She keeps her business in the same conditions but has been able to make the payments for the loans on time.

loans.use: buy corn, oil, flour, drinks, etc. for making and selling pupusas and other food.

loans.name: Tiaragail De Francis

texts.es: Tiaragail, es madre soltera, con ganas de construir un patrimonio para ella y su hija, solicita el préstamo a SGS para comprar materiales para construir una vivienda, es muy responsable y comprometida, ella estudia odontología y trabaja en un consultorio del mismo giro, por otro lado administra su propio negocio de venta de calzado por catalogo.
texts.en:
Tiaragail is a single mother with the desire to build a patrimony for her and her daughter. She's requesting a loan to SGS to buy materials to build a house.
She's very responsible and committed. She studies dentistry and works in a dental office. She also manages her own business selling shoes by catalog.

loans.use: to start construction of a house for her and her daughter.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 38-year-old, married woman. She is living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is doing embroidery work by her hands at home and is financially supporting her family. She belongs to a poor family; her husband’s income is very poor, so she decided to start embroidery work at home. She has been learning these arts since her childhood, and now she has adopted it for her occupation. She enabled herself to be independent and is earning sufficient income.

Rehana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stock of threads, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to purchase stock of threads, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors, for her own embroidery work.

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en:
Akbari is sixty years old, married and has operated a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough in profits to provide for her family.

To fully stock her store Akbari has applied for a 60,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner Kashf Foundation, which she will use to buy extra rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour at wholesale rates. In this way she will be able to meet her customers’ increasing demands consistently. She wishes to use part of her profits on providing a good quality life for her family.

loans.use: to buy extra rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour at wholesale rates for her store.

loans.name: Oscar Isaias

texts.es: Oscar es un hombre trabajador de 30 años de edad que vive con su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 2 y 6 años de edad. Oscar se dedica a prestar sus servicios de transportista, pero además vende pescado fresco, lo que le permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Oscar desea construir un muro en su vivienda que le permita brindar seguridad a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro perimetral para brindar seguridad a su familia, ya que con el crédito anterior logro cambiar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que en este invierno no hubo filtraciones en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 30 year old hard working man who lives with his life partner and their 2 children of 2 and 6 years of age. Oscar works in transportation and also sells fresh fish which helps him obtain a better income.
Oscar wants to build a perimeter wall in his house to safeguard his family. He's requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a perimeter wall to increase his family's security. With the previous he was able to rebuild the roof of his house which allowed them to spend the winter without roof leaks.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a perimeter wall to increase his family's security.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Federico es una persona muy trabajadora que se dedica a la construcción, el es un maestro de obra , tiene 36 años y dos hijos.el tiene años dedicándose a esta actividad, pero este trabajo es duro y desea dedicarse a otras actividades en un  futuro cercano.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar botas de jebe, casco y ropa , para poder seguir trabajando seguro , así seguir juntando su remuneración y conseguir sus sueños.
El cliente está feliz y satisfecho de recibir el préstamo de Kiva , Federico se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas acordadas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Federico is a very hardworking person, who makes his living in construction. He is a foreman. He is 36 years old and has two children. He has many years at this job, but the work is difficult, and he hopes to work in other areas in the near future.

He needs the loan to buy rubber boots, a helmet and rope, to be able to continue working safely, so that he can continue collecting his income and reach his goals. The borrower is happy and satisfied to receive the Kiva loan. Federico promises to comply punctually with the required payments.

loans.use: to buy rubber boots, a helmet and rope.

loans.name: Señor De Choquekillca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CHOQUEKILLCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucrecia, la socia continua con su  negocio de venta de ropa, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo pantalones, blusas, polos entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una mujer  luchadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, casacas entre otros.
Las socias que están pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque no les quisieron dar permiso en su trabajo para el día que se realizo el desembolso de crédito.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Señor de Choquekillca” communal bank.  This bank is located in the Ollantaytambo district, which is part of the Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Lucrecia is one member of the group.  She continues with her clothing sales business.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  She still sells pants, tops, and polo shirts, among other items, to her customers who request them.  She is a real fighter who, through her business, wants to get her family ahead.

She is asking for this loan to buy shoes and coats, among other items.  She is grateful to those people who are part of her dream in this way and is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

The other group members work in animal sales, grain sales, food sales, and a grocery store.

The group members who are attached to the group photo took a picture after the meeting because they weren’t given the day off from their work for the loan disbursement.

loans.use: to buy shoes and coats, among other items.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Lchashen, a village in the Gegharkunik region. The main source of income for this family is farming, mainly thanks to Susanna’s hard work.

Susanna’s husband is a constructor and he works by order. Susanna has a cow, a calf, a heifer and chickens on her picturesque farm. She sells milk, macun (national dairy-product), meat and eggs to her neighbors.

Susanna notes that they were saving up for a long time to do repairs on their house, and this summer they were able to do part of the needed repairs. Now their savings have been spent but the repairs are only half done. She is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to finally finish repairing her house’s walls; they must glue wallpapers on the walls of all the rooms.

loans.use: to finally finish repairing her house’s walls; they must glue wallpapers on the walls of all the rooms.

loans.name: Shamila

texts.en:
Shamila is a 28 year-old, married, vigorous lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life.

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una cliente muy responsable e innovadora, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales oriundos del lugar, esta actividad es tranquila pero necesita tiempo, para a producir y esperar que estos animales se incrementen y venderlos , es por ello que ella necesita el préstamo para comprar jaulas , pasto y alfalfa. 
ella tiene 44 años y dos hijos que dependen de ella, es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, y está muy agradecida con el préstamo que le da Kiva . Asegura que cumplirá sus pagos acordados en su contrato para con sus acreedores.
texts.en:
Hilda is a responsible and innovative client. She breeds local animals. This is calm work but requires time for the animals to breed and reproduce so their numbers increase and she can then sell them. She needs a loan to buy cages, grass, and alfalfa for feed.
She's 44 years old and has 2 sons who depend on her. She's very responsible and dedicated to her work. She's very grateful for the Kiva loan and assures that she will meet the scheduled payments to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy cages, grass, and alfalfa for feed.

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul is a 49-year-old married mother of three. She has been working in Mouneh from her house for two years in order to support her husband in improving their family's living. Her business is highly requested in her region and that's why she is investing in developing it properly.

At the same time, her family's needs and priorities must be managed. Batoul is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her daughter's university tuition fees.

She will also do the necessary maintenance for her house to keep it a healthy living and business place before the coming winter season.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's university tuition fees

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia se gana la vida hilando lana y vendiendo huevo sancochado .
la cliente tiene 59 años y se dedica a esta actividad artesanal muchos años y quiere seguir produciendo diferentes tipos de lanas de forma tradicional ,  para poder ofrecer mejores productos y buscar más mercados donde pueda expandir sus ganancias.
Basilia necesita capital para comprar tintes naturales, lana y algodón. Ella es emprendedora y muy responsable por eso asegura que pagara puntualmente su préstamo que los inversionista de KIVA le han otorgado.
texts.en:
Basilia works spinning wool and selling hard-boiled eggs. She is 59 years old, has been doing this artisanal work for many years, and wants to continue producing different types of wool in a traditional way, in order to be able to offer better products and find more markets where she can increase her profits.

Basilia needs capital to buy wool, cotton, and natural dyes. She is enterprising and very responsible, so she affirms that she will punctually pay back the loan that the Kiva lenders have given her.

loans.use: to buy wool, cotton, and natural dyes

loans.name: Musammat

texts.en:
Financial constraints, alongside the desire for a better life and good quality education for her six children, are only a few, valuable factors that encouraged Musammat to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.

Musammat is 49 years old, and she is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business, selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses.

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, vive con sus hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 2 años, gracias a ello María es una mujer reconocida en su lugar de domicilio y puede sostener su hogar. Por su experiencia no representa dificultades en desarrollar sus actividades.
María solicita un crédito para la compra de más cerdos, de esta manera tendrá más oportunidades atender a nuevos clientes, espera incrementar sus ingresos económicos y podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus seres queridos.
Ella aspira a seguir siendo una madre responsable para darles una buena educación a sus hijos y que ellos cuando crezcan sean hombres de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
María lives with her children. She was worked breeding pigs for 2 years. Thanks to her job María is a woman known in the area of her home, and is able to support her home. Due to her experience carrying out her job is not difficult for her.

María seeks a loan to buy more pigs, in order to have more opportunities to serve new customers. She hopes to increase her economic income and to be able to meet the needs of her loved ones. She aspires to continue being a responsible mother, and to provide a good education to her children, so that when they are grown, they will be good people for society.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, in order to have more opportunities to serve new customers.

loans.name: Hajra

texts.en:
Day-to-day increasing expenditures, but not having the ability to meet them, compelled Hajra to start her own business. She is a 36-year-old married woman who has been running an animal purchase and sales business with the help of her husband for many years.

Hajra is the mother of six children. She is working very hard to providing her family with the basic necessities of life. Her business has provided her family with a decent life.

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Kaiyrbubu

texts.ru: Кайырбубу, 54 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Кайырбубу высшее педагогическое образование. На протяжении 34 лет работает учителем географии в местной школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Кайырбубу с 1980 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 30 овец, 3 лошади, также есть 1,70 ГА собственной и 3,0 ГА арендованной земли, где Кайырбубу выращивает люцерну и ячмень для реализации. Кайырбубу решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Кайырбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Kaiyrbubu is 54 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Kaiyrbubu has a degree in teaching. She has worked as a geography teacher in a local school for 34 years. Kaiyrbubu has been rearing animals and growing crops since 1980 for additional income for her family. Today she has three cows, 30 sheep, and three horses, and she also has 1.7 hectares of her own land and 3.0 hectares of rented land where Kaiyrbubu grows alfalfa and barley for sale. Kaiyrbubu has decided to apply to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy two steers for fattening and resale. Kaiyrbubu plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business and the building of a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Jean Kalito

texts.en:
This loan helps Jean Kalito get connected to his local prepay microgrid.

Jean Kalito is a teacher and lives with his three kids in the town of Les Anglais in southern Haiti. Their house has no reliable access to electricity and thus Jean Kalito is forced to use costly and harmful kerosene for lighting. With two of his kids still in school, he wishes they had better light for studying at night.

A solar-powered microgrid is being installed in Les Anglais, giving Jean Kalito and his family the opportunity to connect to a higher quality, lower-cost energy source. He is looking forward to being connected as it will allow him to save money.

He is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to cover the upfront cost of connection to the grid, which he will repay through his payments for electricity.

An electrical connection dramatically reduces the cost of lighting in towns such as Les Anglais while offering far superior light quality and more generally providing opportunities for people to dramatically improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid

loans.name: Lisiene

texts.en:
This loan helps Lisiene get connected to her local prepay microgrid.

Lisiene is a 62-year-old mother of 4. She lives in a small pink and green wooden house in Les Anglais, in southern Haiti with her husband.

She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to connect to the local solar-powered microgrid, and to complete her small solar lantern to get light in her house.

Mainly, she is looking forward to being connected as it will allow her to save money. Lisiene and her family will now be able to benefit from a reliable, durable, and clean power source.

After running pilots since 2012 that proved the benefits of prepay quality electricity to people in Les Anglais (first with 14 households, and up to 54), EarthSpark International is developing a full-scale, solar-powered microgrid. This micro-grid is expected to meet the needs of up to 500 households. Kiva loans allow EarthSpark to increase the number of beneficiaries by reducing the up-front costs for customers, and will be repaid over time by electricity sales.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en:
SHAFQAT is a 47-year-old married mother of four children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband earns a very low income which is insufficient to provide for his whole family.

SHAFQAT owns a small business selling ladies' ready-made garments from home. She purchases clothing from the market at a low price, sews it, and sells it for higher prices in her community. The ladies in town like her garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the winter weather has started and people are demanding warmer clothes. Her husband meets all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings.

SHAFQAT has requested a loan so that she can buy more varieties of delightfully colored cloth to sew and sell to locals. SHAFQAT wishes for a bright future for her children. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy delightfully colored cloth to sew and sell to locals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid

loans.name: Cristian Alexander

texts.es: Cristian es un hombre de 20 años de edad que vive en casa de sus padres, pero cuenta con un  terreno en el cual desea construir, ya que también vive con ellos su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad. Cristian se dedica desde hace 5 años a la elaboración y venta de pan francés actividad que le permite sostener a su familia. Él es un hombre visionario que siempre busca lo mejor para su familia, es por ello que ha decidido construir su pequeña vivienda para ofrecer un hogar propio a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, lámina hierro, etc., para construir su vivienda y ofrecer un lugar propio a su familia.
texts.en:
Cristian is 20 years old and lives in his parents' house, but has a plot of land on which he wants to build, since he also lives with his partner and their 2 year old child. For 5 years Cristian has worked making and selling french bread, a job that allows him to support his family. He is a visionary man who always seeks the best for his family.

For that reason he has decided to construct a small home to provide a place of their own to his family. Accordingly he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in brick, cement, laminated sheeting, iron, etc. to construct his home and provide a place of their own to his family.

loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, laminated sheeting, iron, etc. to construct his home and provide a place of their own to his family.

loans.name: San Cristobal De Aparquilla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN CRISTOBAL DE APARQUILLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina ella es casada y tiene 61 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de maiz,la socia vende en diferentes mercados, la socia por medio de este negocio le gustaría abrir una tienda de abarrotes, ella es una personas muy emprendedora y quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maíz.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de carteras.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "SAN CRISTOBAL DE APARQUILLA"; This bank is located in the district of Anta, belonging to the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

The partner is Ms. Marina She is married and is 61 years old and has 4 children.; The partner works on his business selling corn, sold in different markets partner, the partner through this business would like to open a grocery store, it is a very enterprising people and wants to get ahead. The partner requesting a loan to buy corn.

The other partners are in the business of selling clothes, shoes selling business, grocery store business and sales business portfolios.


The partner is grateful to those who are part of her dream through this platform and she is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 41 years old and she lives with her husband, son, and daughter in Lchashen village of the Gegharkunik region. Anahit works at the local polyclinics as a nurse. Anahit is also engaged in farming (in her farm she has cows, calves, a heifer, pigs, sheep and chickens) and agriculture. Her husband helps her greatly since being unemployed. Their son is a builder, and he works by order. The sale of their farm products such as milk, meat, cheese, curd and eggs make the family’s main and constant income.

Anahit’s family now has some financial hardships but they must somehow overcome them since Anahit’s daughter is going to get married. Anahit is so hopeful that Kiva lenders will help her family with loan amount of 700,000 Armenian drams and they will be able to organize nice and cheerful wedding party for her daughter.

loans.use: to organize nice and cheerful wedding party for her daughter

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José, nuevamente se acerca a Padecomsm ya que tiene con la necesidad de invertir en su negocio para esta temporada y no cuenta con los fondos necesarios para hacerlo, invertirá el crédito en la compra de insumos agrícolas para reforzar el cultivo de hortalizas y de esa manera poder obtener una buena producción. Con este nuevo crédito José pretende mejorar su situación económica mucho más y poder seguir ayudando a su familia y aumentar las ganancias de su negocio para poder seguir sobrellavando la responsabilidad de su hogar ya que él es único sustento de su grupo familiar.
José manifiesta que el crédito anterior le fue de gran ayuda ya que mejoro la calidad de vida de él y su grupo familiar, aunque cabe mencionar que las necesidades son a diario.
texts.en:
José is approaching Padecomsm again because he needs to invest in his business for this season and he lacks the money to do it. He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies to strengthen the vegetable crop thereby improving output. With this new loan José expects to further improve his financial situation and be able to continue to help his family. He is the sole family breadwinner so increased income from his business means he can continue to take responsibility for his household.

José declares that his previous loan was a great help to him and allowed him to improve the quality of his life and that of his family, nevertheless it is worth mentioning that he faces daily hardship.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to strengthen the vegetable crop and thereby improve the output.

loans.name: Viviana Paola

texts.es:
Viviana es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 31 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 1 hija a la que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 2 años se desempeña en el campo de la fabricación de calzado, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió a través de clases y trabaja con 2 empleados todos los días, así genera los recursos suficientes para llevar la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor como cueros, Hormas, suelas, entre otros, esto le permitirá tener material disponible para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar a sus clientes actuales.

Viviana manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Viviana is an energetic woman, who is helpful and hard-working. At 31 years old, she is single and the mother of one daughter whom she has raised with great effort and dedication.

Two years ago she became a shoemaker, working for third parties and for direct clients. She learned this trade by taking classes and works with two employees every day. In this way she generates enough income to sustain the household finances.

At this time she is motivated to request a loan so she can buy supplies at wholesale such as leather, shoe lasts, soles, etc. This will allow her to have materials available so she can deliver her pending orders in a timely manner, maintaining her customers' loyalty.

Viviana states that she wants to continue to work hard at her job so that she can expand her business and create employment opportunities in addition to ensuring financial stability to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale such as leather, shoe lasts, soles, etc.

loans.name: Ma Yan Village

texts.en:
Pictured above are Maung, Myo, Pho, Myo and Sein and these members form Ma Yan Village are aiming to increase their duck livestock business. The group includes 17 members. Relisting new loan will be used to purchase additional ducklings and high quality feeds.
Previous loan from Proximity helped the group to pay off debts and purchase more duck feeds. Most of the families’ income have been boosted and that allowed them to buy motorbikes which is used as main transportation. All the members are very grateful for all the generous support that they are getting from Kiva community.

loans.use: to help 17 villagers of Ma Yan Village Community to purchase ducklings and to buy high-quality feeds.

loans.name: Francy Monica

texts.es:
Ella es Mónica es una mujer de 43 años de edad que a través del emprendimiento busca obtener la independencia económica, ella es madre de tres hijos, en los tiempos actuales es necesario que los dos padres trabajan para sostener un hogar y más cuando reciben ingresos modestos.
Mónica es muy consciente y solidaria, vio que en su casa habían necesidades y busca la forma de ayudar monetariamente, por ello inicio hace poco una venta de mercancía de productos de uso personal y se encuentra solicitando un apoyo para abastecerse y tener productos para salir a la calle a vender, buscando una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
This is Mónica. She is a 43 year old woman who through her entrepreneurship is looking to reach economic independence. She is the mother of three children. These days it is necessary for both parents to work to sustain the household, even when they only make a modest income.

Mónica is very conscious and supportive. She saw need in her house and looked for a way to help economically. So she recently started the sale of personal use products. She finds herself requesting support to stock up and have products to go out in the streets to sell, looking for a higher quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to stock up on personal use products like lotions, hand cream, hair products, deodorant, etc.

loans.name: Mivio

texts.en:
This loan helps Mivio get connected to his local prepay microgrid.

Mivio lives with his wife only child in the town of Les Anglais in southern Haiti. Their pink and green house has no reliable access to electricity and thus Mivio is forced to use costly and harmful kerosene for lighting. A solar-powered microgrid has been installed in Les Anglais, giving Mivio and his family the opportunity to connect to a higher quality, lower-cost energy source - he is looking forward to being connected as it will allow them to save money.

He is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to cover the upfront cost of connection to the grid, which he will repay through his payments for electricity.

An electrical connection dramatically reduces the cost of lighting in towns such as Les Anglais while offering far superior light quality and more generally providing opportunities for people to dramatically improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-paid microgrid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid

loans.name: Norotiana

texts.fr:
Norotiana est une jeune femme de 31 ans. Elle vit avec son mari et ses 3 enfants. Elle exerce une activité d’élevage de poulet de chair depuis 2 ans. 
Norotiana a déjà pris des prêts chez Vahatra auparavant pour développer son activité d’élevage de poulet de chair. Actuellement, elle a réussi à avoir d’autres nouveaux clients prêts à acheter ses poulets, c’est pourquoi, elle va prendre ce prêt. Elle va acheter 200 têtes de poussins de chair et 500 Kg de farine alimentaires pour les nourrir.
Elle espère gagner beaucoup de bénéfices afin de construire une maison sur le terrain qu’elle avait déjà acheté avec les bénéfices des prêts précédents.
texts.en:
Norotiana is a young 31 year old woman. She lives with her husband and his three children. She has had a chicken-raising business for two years.

Norotiana has already had loans from Vahatra in the past for developing her business of raising chicks. Recently, she was able to acquire new clients, ready to buy her chickens. That's why she would like to take a loan. She is going to buy 200 chicklings and 500kg of grains to feed them.

She hopes to earn more profits in order to build a house on the land that she bought with the profits from the last loan.

loans.use: to buy 200 chicklings and 500kg of feeding grains.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 12 años y una hija de 9 años, y su negocio es el tejido de pantalones para bebé.
Ella es emprendedora, dinámica y muy paciente. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Sajama’ caracterizada por encontrarse cerca del cruce de caminos, de donde se puede encontrar transporte público a todo lugar.
María es de tez morena, baja estatura y vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por el comercio, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como ayudante de transporte interdepartamental y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de buzos para bebes, los buzos son pantalones hechos de lana que utilizan los bebes por su forma fácil de poner y sacar, “inicie mi negocio tejiendo para otras personas, vi la demanda e inicie mi propio negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de sui negocio es que puede trabajar en su casa y estar al cuidado de sus hijos, la desventaja es que no cuenta con una lista de clientes fijos. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta, ella desea comprar lana por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
 Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para comprar lana por mayor para tejer buzos de bebé.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old, lives with her partner, has 2 sons of 7 and 12 years of age, and a 9 year old daughter. Her business is making pants for babies. She's very entrepreneurial, dynamic, and patient. She has her business in the zone of Sajama which is close to a road junction where she can find public transport to any place she needs.
Maria is tanned, short, and wears traditional attire from the region with hat, blanket, and skirt. Her native tongue is Aymara and speaks Spanish for business. She shares her life with her husband who works as an aid in the inter-county transportation system. Their children attend school. They live in their own house made of adobe with running water, electricity, and sewage system.
Her business is selling "buzos" for babies. "Buzos" are pants made of wool that are used for babies because of their easy way of slipping them on and off.
"I started sowing for other people but I saw the demand and started my own business", says Maria. The advantage of her business is that she works from home and can take care of her children. The disadvantage is that she doesn't have fixed clients.
Her dream is to open a store, and for now, buy wool at wholesale. This is her first loan with the institution in the first year she's been carrying out her business activity. For this reason Maria is requesting a loan to buy wholesale wool to make baby pants.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool to make baby pants.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is 34 years old and has a green grocery store. She is married and blessed with five children. Her spouse provides additional income to support the family.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she has repaid the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy tomatoes, cabbages, onions and fruits for sell and hopes this will enable her to earn more income to support her family by providing food and paying school fees for the children. Her future hopes are to expand her grocery business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbages, onions and fruits to sell

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Antoinette est une femme dynamique de 39 ans. Avec son mari, ils élèvent 3 enfants et habite dans un quartier de la ville. Elle tient une épicerie ou elle vend des produits de première nécessité. 
Antoinette a déjà pris des prêts successifs auparavant avec lesquels, elle a pu augmenter le stock des produits à vendre. Ce prêt va lui servir à acheter 2,5 tonnes de riz blancs afin de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.
Elle pense constituer de l’épargne avec les bénéfices qui va être investie dans la construction d’une maison familiale.
texts.en:
Antoinette is a dynamique 39 year old woman. With her husband, she raises 3 children and lives in a neighborhood of the city. She has a grocery, which she sells high-need products.

In the past, Antoinette has already taken successive loans, with which she was about to increase her inventory for sale. This loan will allow her to buy 2.5 tons of white rice in order to satisfy the needs of her customers.

She plans to save money from the profits to invest in the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy 2.5 tons of white rice to expand her business.

loans.name: Megyefo Nyame Group

texts.en:
This group (Megyefo nyame) consists of seven ladies who have an average age of 35 years. Beatrice is a woman who appears to be the source of motivation to her counterparts. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. She is identified by her brown-colored hair in the photo. Beatrice has been selling provisions for five years now. She has been helping her husband to feed the family and said that ID-Ghana has helped her a lot since many potential Micro finance institutions were just giving her false promises. She hopes to have the biggest provision shop in the area but has to have constant financial assistance. That is why she has come to join ID-Ghana.

Beatrice wants a loan from ID-Ghana so that she will be able to buy more provisions and supplies to sell to customers. Being a woman of much creativity and venturing into this kind of business speaks volumes for her hardworking character.

loans.use: to be able to buy more provisions.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.fr:
Rosette est une femme courageuse de 55 ans qui vit avec son mari et ses 5 enfants dans la ville d’Antsirabe. Pour assurer la vie quotidienne, elle vend des vêtements et des chaussures usagés en ambulant à la campagne. 
Cela fait maintenant 6 ans qu’elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra. Les prêts d’avant lui ont permis d’augmenter le capital de son activité. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 5 balles de vêtements et de chaussures friperies. 
Elle espère pouvoir constituer beaucoup d’épargne pour assurer la réussite scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Rosette is a courageous 55 year old woman, who lives with her husband and 5 children in the city of Antsirabe. To secure her daily life, she sells cloths and used shoes while walking around the country.

She has been a client at Vahatra for 6 years now. The previous loans allows her to increase the profits of her business. With this loan, she plans to buy 5 heaps of cloths and of used shoes.

She hopes to be able to save up a lot of money to ensure her children's success in school.

loans.use: to buy 5 heaps of cloths and second hand shoes to sell around the countryside.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane lives in the village Tsovagyugh of the Gegharkunik region. Gayane has three children but she lives alone.  Her two sons are in Russian Federation and working there, and her daughter is married and lives with her family. Gayane is unemployed and her only occupation is farming and agriculture. In her farm she has cows, calves, heifers, lambs, pigs, sheep and chickens. She sells her farm products, such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and eggs to her neighbors and also customers from the city. She also cultivates and gathers a good harvest of potatos, which she sells during the week at the city’s wholesale market. Gayane is impatient to store fodder for her farm cattle since the cold season already started and the need of fodder is greater and greater. With this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams Gayane will buy a  lot of fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for all her farm cattle since the cold season already started and the need of fodder is greater and greater.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Two years ago Zeinab, a 59-year-old widowed mother of three, started baking traditional Markouk (Saj) bread, preparing Mouneh and harvesting olives, in addition to preparing and selling olive oil. She runs her businesses from her house.

To make her enterprises easier to develop, Zeinab has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car to transport her purchased baking needs.

She is working hard to move her Saj business to a more public place and establish an official bakery.

loans.use: to buy a car needed for transporting her purchased baking ingredients.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 27-year-old single lady who has been working in the graphic design business from her house for four years.

She has special talents in her domain, which she is enriching with her university degree.

Currently she is working as a freelancer, from her house, while she is dreaming of opening her small company in the future.

Aya is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her university graphic design degree tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her university graphic design degree tuition fees.

loans.name: Jesus Es El Camino Y La Verdad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JESUS ES EL CAMINO Y LA VERDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria, la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, leche, arroz entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.
Los socios en general se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The partners are part of the community bank “JESUS ES EL CAMINO Y LA VERDAD”. This bank is in the district, province, and department of Cusco.
The partner is Mrs. Victoria. She continues with her business managing a convenience store. She's had her business for years which has been going well because of the effort that she put into it every day. She continues selling first need articles like rice, sugar, milk, and crackers, among others.
The partner is responsible and determined which allows her to get ahead her family. She's requesting a loan to buy sodas, milk, and rice, among other items.
The other partners work in agriculture, cattle raising, convenience stores, and selling animals. In general, the partners are very grateful for the loan granted and are committed to meet their scheduled payments.
The person who has the shaded face is not part of the community bank.

loans.use: to buy sodas, milk, and rice, among other items.

loans.name: Rasolan

texts.en:
It was hard for Rasolan to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Rasolan is a 60 year-old, married woman. She is a mother of three children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Rasolan has gained great confidence in the business as she has learnt how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Kelly Johana

texts.es:
Kelly es una hermosa joven de 19 años de edad, una persona práctica y soñadora que hoy se encuentra ante la comunidad Kiva, solicitando un apoyo económica para iniciar un negocio de panadería, ella no tiene hijos, solo unas ganas inmensas de ver su familia crecer, de comprar una casa y ser feliz al lado de sus familiares, de estudiar y progresar en la vida, el dinero será para iniciar un negocio inicialmente de venta de tortas, comprara los enseres, implementos y surtido de productos.
Se ve en un futuro con una enorme panadería posicionada en la ciudad, con sucursales y viviendo en una enorme vivienda.
texts.en:
Kelly is a lovely young woman, 19 years old, a practical person and a dreamer who today finds herself standing before the Kiva community, requesting financial support to begin a bakery business. She has no children, only an intense desire to see her family grow, to buy a house and to be happy together with her family, to study and to progress in life. The money will be for starting a business, initially selling cakes. She will buy appliances, supplies, and a stock of products.

She sees a future for herself where she has a huge bakery in the city, with multiple locations, and she herself living in an enormous house.

loans.use: to start a business, initially selling cakes: she will buy appliances, supplies, and a stock of products

loans.name: Deisy Dayana

texts.es:
Deisy es una joven de 24 años de edad, dinámica, práctica, inquieta, una persona que tiene que verse produciendo, ella es madre y se dedica al negocio de venta de mercancía por catálogo, principalmente ropa para mujer y vestidos de baño, trabaja de lunes a domingo, 12 horas diariamente, sabe que la alimentación y futuro de su hija está en sus manos, y ya que quiere lo mejor para ella hace su mayor y mejor esfuerzo por vender productos y llevar el alimento a casa.
Deisy consciente de que se aproxima la temporada de diciembre quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecerse de mercancía tales como ropa, abrigos y vestidos de baño.
Su sueño es montar un almacén y ver crecer a su hija bajo un ambiente de cultura y estudio.
texts.en:
Deisy is a young woman of 24, dynamic, practical, and restless. She is a person who has to feel productive. She is a mother and she works selling merchandise by catalog, mainly women's clothing and bathing suits. She works Monday to Sunday, 12 hours a day. Deisy knows that her daughter's food and future are in her hands, and since she wants the best for her, she puts forth her best and biggest efforts to sell products and put food on the table.

Deisy, aware that the December season is approaching, wants to request a loan to stock up on merchandise like clothing, coats, and bathing suits.

Her dream is to set up a warehouse and see her daughter grow up in an environment of culture and study.

loans.use: stock up on merchandise such as clothing, coasts, and bathing suits

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat is 44 years old, a widow and a mother of 2 children. She has been in the business of tailoring for many years. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR  to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces in order to meet her orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Riffat hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her orders on time.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 47-year-old, hardworking woman. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Sajida’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Sajida has requested a loan in the amount 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Zaibun

texts.en:
Zaibun, 49 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They offer a variety of daily use products and have a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Zaibun needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, and other items to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and to make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, and other items

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 37 year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years.

Sughran is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get boost in her earnings

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hard working woman from Pasay City, Philippines. She’s been a longtime member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She is the wife of Mario. She’s been selling different kinds of fresh fish for 12 years now, and the business helped her in paying their house expenses and other bills. She’s focusing on how to make the business grow for her to earn more revenue.

Elvira aims to attract more patrons and increase sales like what other entrepreneurs aspire to. She makes sure that the products are fresh every day and of good quality. Some of the profits earned in the business are being put in her savings account since she wants to invest for home appliances someday.

She requested a loan amount of Php 8, 000 so that she’ll be able to buy fresh fishes daily and the spare amount will be put on her savings account. She believes that the amount will be of great help for the growth of her business if ever granted.

On a weekly basis, Elvira regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy varieties of fish daily.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Nighat is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business.

Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time. She hopes to get an increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time

loans.name: Manguiline Santhiaba Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de femmes qui s'exercent dans le commerce et elles remboursent toujours leurs prêts avec succès. Madame Fatou Deme qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 37 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont trois filles. Depuis plus de cinq ans elle s'active dans la vente de poissons frais. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari à la prise des besoins de la famille.
texts.en: This group is made up of women who pursue business and they always successfully pay off their laons. Madame Fatou Deme, who is on the right side of the photo with her hand raised, is the representative of the group. She is married, 37 years old, and is a mother of five children, three of which are girls. She has been selling fresh fish for more than 5 years. The profits are going to serve to help her husband in fulfilling the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Paepae

texts.en:
Paepae is a 23 year old woman with 1 child. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Paepae requested for a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2010.
She will expand her business using her profit.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine,

loans.name: Natacha

texts.fr:
Natacha est une jeune femme sérieuse de 22 ans. Elle est mariée avec un enfant à charge. Elle vend des chaussures friperies depuis 5 ans. 
Elle a pris des prêts auparavant afin d’augmenter le stock de chaussures à vendre. Elle constate que les bénéfices des prêts lui ont permis d’améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille. 
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 7 balles de chaussures friperie afin d’avoir différentes pointures et différents styles. 
Elle espère avoir plus de clients et pouvoir épargner suffisamment pour l’avenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
Natacha is a serious 22 year old woman. She is married with one child in her care. She has been selling second-hand shoes for 5 years.

She has taken out loans previously in order to increase her inventory of shoes for sale. She assures that the profits from the loans allowed her to improve her family's living conditions.

This loan will allow her to purchase 7 packs of second-hand shoes in order to have different sizes and different styles.
.
She hopes to have more clients and to be able to save sufficiently for her family's future.

loans.use: to buy 7 packages of used shoes.

loans.name: Arika Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Catherine, a member of Arika Self Help Group. She is forty-three years old and a mother of two. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.
She does poultry keeping as her main business. She is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training in enterprise and financial management that has enabled her to run the business well.

She is borrowing from Kiva to add more chicks so that she can increase her income from eggs and chicken sales. This will assist her in taking care of family needs such as food and paying school fees for her child.

She is happy with Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more chicks that will help boost poultry farming.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 31 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.

Currently she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. Zahida aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is aged 28 and a mother of three children. She lives with her children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for four years to meet the family’s expenses.

Today Martha’s husband wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy the auto rickshaw. Therefore Martha has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Martha's husband can purchase the auto rickshaw and provide the proper transportation services to earn an income.
