She and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Manguiline Santhiaba Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce et qui ont toujours remboursé leurs prêts avec succès. Madame Louise qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 52 ans et mère de trois enfants dont deux filles. Elle s'active depuis plusieurs années dans la vente de chaussures et de pagnes tissés. Elle est très engagée et très dynamique. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en: This group is made up of women who pursue business and who have always payed back their loans on time. Madame Louise, who is on the right side of the photo raising her hand, is the representative of the group. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of three children, two of which are girls. She has been selling shoes and woven traditional clothing for several years. She is very engaged and resourceful. The profits will serve her to help her husband with taking care of the family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and woven pagne (traditional cloth).

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia highly appreciates your kind generosity, dear lenders. Your previous loan worth PHP 30,000 enabled her to buy more supplies for her inventory. It resulted to a higher income and was a big help in her daily needs. Thank you so much!

She was able to pay her previous loan faithfully. To continue improving her business, she is asking for PHP 50,000 loan this time. Again, she will use this to buy additional supplies and products for her store, sacks of rice, and reserved capital for cellphone load wallet. She has a good integrity to maintain her capacity to repay.

Virginia continuously meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her store, sacks of rice, and cellphone load wallet.

loans.name: Ricxy Oneyda

texts.es:
La Joven, Ricxy de 23 años de edad vive con su esposo, en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea, se dedica desde hace 08 años al negocio que es compra y venta verdura, es una mujer trabajadora  con muchos deseos de salir adelante.
La Joven Ricxy está muy contenta de poder trabajar con Prisma, necesita el crédito  para  compra de verduras como cebolla, tomates, papas, plátanos,etc. para su negocio, porque es su mayor fuente de ingresos con el apoyo del préstamo pretende surtir y mejorar su negocio.

Su sueño en el futuro es terminar de construir su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre 2015.
texts.en:
Ricxy is a 23-year-old young woman who lives with her husband in their home, located in a village. She has worked for 8 years at her business buying and selling vegetables. She is very hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead in life.

Ricky is very happy to be able to work with Prisma. She needs the loan to purchase more vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, potatoes, bananas, etc., for her business because those products are the main source of revenue. With the help of the loan she wants to supply and improve her business. Her dream for the future is to complete building her house.

San Lorenzo Valle Honduras - September 2015.

loans.use: para la compra de cebolla, tomates, papas, plátanos,etc. para su negocio.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Canteen business requires patience. It’s not like office work that starts at 8:00am and ends at 5:00pm. Canteen operators go to market early to buy necessary ingredients, endure the heat while cooking, and defy their throbbing body pain after every day of work.

Maria Fe, 50 years old, embarked on small canteen business commonly called in the Philippines as “carinderia” as additional income-generating venture. Her husband, Alejandro, is a self-employed worker with irregular income that isn't sufficient for their family’s daily needs. Maria Fe cooks various meal recipes and sells it in front of their house, so she can earn extra money while maintaining their household. She combined it with a variety store that sells canned goods, biscuits, candies, toiletries, charcoal, and others. Her regular customers are her neighbors, the local community, students and working people. Profit derived from her business helps a lot in their daily expenditures and children’s education.

Now she’s planning to cook more viands and meal choices to take advantage of the opening of the second semester for colleges. More students are expected to buy from her and it will boost her income. This is why she prays for PHP 50,000 additional capital that she will use to buy more ingredients for her canteen business plus additional supplies for her variety store.

Maria Fe aspires that someday her business will grow and her children will finish their schooling to get better chances to land stable jobs. She gives importance to harmonious relationship among her family members. She is an inspiration to her co-fellowship members at CCT who regularly meet every week to reflect of God’s Words and share stories about life and their businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her canteen business plus additional supplies for her variety store

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Like many women it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging our client Samina to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan. Samina is a 39-year-old woman and a mother of two children. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Shenaz

texts.en:
Shenaz is 52 years old and a mother of six children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business seven years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Shenaz buys materials required from the market for the type of embroidery she is expert in. Her son handles her transactions with her customers. Now she has become an expert in the embroidery business. So Shenaz requested a loan to be able to make both ends meet for her family.

Shenaz is thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 48-year-old married mother of two. She has been working as a tailor from her house for 20 years, supporting her beloved family in developing their living and covering their increasing living needs.

Today, since their living needs are increasing, Fadwa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a newly released autumn and winter fabric collection to tailor specially requested designs.

She hopes that one day she can move to a wider place and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a newly released autumn and winter fabric collection to tailor specially requested designs.

loans.name: Lademba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 10 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 17 avril 2010. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs. Elles ont de bonnes relations et s’activent dans le commerce, l’agriculture et l’embouche.Une bonne ambiance anime les réunions de groupe.
AISSATOU   debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche  est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 filles et 3 garçons. Elle s’active dans Le commerce d’huile.
Avec le prêt reçu elle achète 4 bidons d’huile de 20 litres chacun à 16 000 FCFA l’unité suivant une fréquence d’achat de 4 fois par semaine. Elle revend le bidon à 18 000 FCFA.  Le reste du prêt constitue son fond de roulement. Elle revend le bidon d'huile à 18 000 FCFA.
Les bénéfices serviront à épargner, à solder son prêt et aussi satisfaire les besoins familiaux et personnels.
texts.en:
This 10 member group is a part of a banc villageois, which was founded on April 17, 2010. The group is made up of women from the same village and surroundings. They have good relationships and pursue business, farming, and livestock raising. The group meetings always have a good ambiance.

Aissatou, standing on the right side of the photo raising her left hand, is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children, 3 girls and 3 boys. Her pursuits are in the oil business.

With the loan, she will buy 4 20-liter containers of oil at 16000FCFA each, with a frequency of purchase of four times per week. She sells each container at 18000FCFA. The rest of the loan constitutes her active assets.

The profits will help her to save, to pay her loan, and also to satisfy personal and family needs.

loans.use: to buy containers of oil.

loans.name: Mame Diarra's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 15 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 17 avril 2010. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs. Elles ont de bonnes relations entre elles et s’activent dans le commerce, l’agriculture et l’embouche.
MANE debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 23 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'une fille et de 2 garçons. Elle s’active dans le commerce d’huile de palme.Elle travaille en collaboration avec sa sœur. 
Avec le prêt reçu elle compte  acheter 4 bidons d’huile palme de 20 litre chacun à  16 000 FCFA l’unité. Elle paye 5 000 FCFA pour le transport de sa marchandise. Elle revend le bidon à 20 000 FCFA.
Une partie des bénéfices sera consacrée pour rembourser son prêt  et aussi épargner,  l’autre partie pour répondre aux besoins familiaux et personnels
texts.en:
This group of 15 members is part of the banc villageois, which was created on April 17, 2010. It is made up of women from the same village and surroundings. They have good relationships and they pursue business, farming, and raising livestock.

Mane, standing on the right of the photo and raising his left hand, is the representative of the group. She is 23 years old. She is married and the mother of a girl and two boys. She works selling palm oil. She works in collaboration with her sister.

With the loan, she plans to buy 4 20-liter containers of palm oil at 16000FCFA each. She pays 5000FCFA for the transport of her merchandise. She sells the containers at 20000FCFA.

A part of the profits will be used to pay back her loan and also to save. The other part will respond to her needs and those of the family.

loans.use: to buy containers of palm oil.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with five children. She has a retail shop and also does farming. She has been in the business for five years. This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, milk, detergents, rice, and maize flour to sell and make more income to support her in paying school fees for her children. She will also buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm. She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and educate her children to tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, milk, detergents, rice, and maize flour to sell and make more income to support her in paying school fees for her children.

loans.name: Grides

texts.es:
La señora Grides vive con sus dos hijos en una aldea de Santa cruz de yojoa, tiene un negocio de venta de comida  es una señora muy trabajadora.
Doña  Grides  esta solicita el crédito para poder invertir en su negocio en la compra de una vitrina y una estufa industrial ya que gracias a Dios le dio la oportunidad de abrir un nuevo comedor y así estar en la luchar día con día  para poder tener una mejor  calidad de vida.

Doña Grides de los dos negocios que tiene espera obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su clientela una buena atención,  Esta muy alegre por la oportunidad que Prisma le pueda brindar. 

su sueño es mantener los dos negocios y luchar por sus hijos para que tengan lo necesario para una buena educación.  



Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras –Septiembre del 2015
texts.en:
Miss grides lives with her two children in a Village of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. She has a business, and se sells food. She is a very hard-working woman. She is asking for a loan so she can buy a storefront window and an industrial stove for her business. She thanks God that she was given the opportunity to open asecond cafeteria and continue her daily fight to have a better quality of life. From the two businesses that she has, Miss Grides hopes to increase her profit and to provide good service to her customers. She is very happy about the opportunity that Prisma is offering her. Her dream is to keep her two businesses running and to keep fighting for her children so that they could have what they need to get a good education.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes, Honduras – February -2015

loans.use: Para la compra de una vitrina y una estufa industrial para su negocio.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 42-year-old married lady. She is a very talented woman and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community.

Some years ago she started her business of tailoring to help with running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She has now requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses in time to get a boost in her earnings.

She wishes to spend it on providing a quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 37 years old. She is a responsible mother of seven little ones. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of eight persons.

She is well-trained in cloth stitching and she provides stitching services to people at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth.

This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Robina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested.

Robina is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for herself..

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar, age 41, is a responsible mother of four children and lives happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her sixth loan with BRAC and her first with Kiva.

Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from local people and selling it to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have the amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell to earn money. Therefore, Kousar requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or expenses.

She is very impressed with this honorable support and wishes to take more loans after the payment of this loan. Kousar thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap iron goods, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc., for her husband's scrap business.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 42-year-old married mother of four. She has been working for a printing business for one year. She works from her house packaging cardboard boxes and bags for retail shops and patisseries.

Hiyam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school tuition fees. She hopes to develop her current business in the future so that she can move it to a larger place and increase her production.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Las Floresitas Group

texts.es:
Silvia continúa con su negocio de venta de cosméticos (de pie la segunda de la derecha, viste blusa celeste). El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en cosméticos por mayor, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque le pagaron todos sus créditos. Actualmente la banca sigue trabajando de buena manera y sus negocios siguen mejorado, “tuve ventas al contado y al crédito ambas me resultaron pagando todo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas al contado y a crédito, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de cosméticos de temporada. Su sueño es consolidar su negocio, ella desea comprar cosméticos para ofertar al contado y a crédito. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para comprar cosméticos para vender al crédito y al contado.
texts.en:
Silvia continues with her business selling cosmetics (She is standing second from the right, wearing a blue blouse). The loan she got was invested in cosmetics and her payments were punctual as all her credit clients paid her.

Currently the communal bank is working in good manner and their businesses continue to improve. "I had sales for cash and on credit and they all ended up paying me", Sylvia commented. The advantage of her business is having sales on credit and in cash, her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy seasonal cosmetics. Her dream is to consolidate her business. She wants to buy cosmetics to offer for cash and on credit. This is her first loan with the institution in the 2 years she has carried out this business.

It is for these reasons that Silvia is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics to sell on credit and for cash.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell on credit and for cash.

loans.name: Zawadi Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Zuwena, who is in her early 40s is a divorcee with one child who is still in school. She has been running a grocery store for three years now. She works from 4 p.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zuwena's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy the bestselling drinks in her grocery store. She dreams of expanding her grocery.

Zuwena will share this loan with her loan group Zawadi Kigogo, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the bestselling drinks in her grocery store.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora, estudió hasta primer grado, sin embargo desde pequeña inició a trabajar, su esposo falleció de una enfermedad terminal y fue hace aproximadamente tres años, vive junto con 2 hijas de las cuales dos están estudiando, pues aspiran a ser profesionales.

Sofía, se dedica a hacer tortillas, este es un alimento típico de nuestro país El Salvador, e indispensable en cada comida; ella desde tempranas horas de la mañana y con la ayuda de su hija mayor se levanta para ir al molino, para preparar la masa de maíz, posteriormente prepara la leña para luego encender el fuego y una vez ha alcanzado la temperatura indicada, inicia con la elaboración de las tortillas, dicha actividad la viene realizando desde hace cuatro años.

Sofía, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz y leña, pues ya se acerca la cosecha de maíz y necesita estar preparada porque es en esta época que los precios bajan considerablemente y de esa manera se ahorraría dinero y tiempo pues la materia prima la tendría en su casa.

Sofía, sueña con que sus hijas estudien para que lleguen a ser profesionales y formen sus propios hogares y tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sofía, age 48, is a very hardworking woman.  She went to school until first grade and from a young age she began to work.  Her husband passed away from a terminal illness about three years ago.  She lives with her two daughters, two of whom are in school because they aspire to be professionals.

Sofía works making tortillas, a traditional food in our country of El Salvador, indispensable for every meal.  From a very early hour, with the help of her oldest daughter, she gets up to go to the mill in order to prepare the corn dough.  Later she prepares the wood to light a fire, and once it has reached the right temperature, she begins making the tortillas.  She has been doing this for four years.

Sofía needs this loan to buy corn and firewood because the season for harvesting corn is coming.  She needs to be ready because it is in this time of year that prices drop considerably.  In this way she could save money and time, because she would have the raw ingredients in her house.

Sofía dreams of her daughters going to school so that they can come to be professionals and establish their own homes, having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea, who is from Toril, Davao City, has a wide space beside her house where she plans to put up a grocery store and car wash area someday. Meanwhile she has a table where she displays various items for sale. She wants to improve her sales area withf display cabinets and more stock to sell.

Irenea has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 for her business. This will gradually pave the way toward achieving her business dream.

Irenea’s husband, Dionisio, is already retired so he can give extra attention to her wife’s business. He’s always ready to assist her in watching over the store and providing other customer services. They have grown-up children and they are providing financial help for the school needs of their grandchildren which is truly a Filipino trait.

She continues to inspire her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share testimonies about life and to draw strength from the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of display cabinets for her store and buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 35 años de edad, es ama de casa, no tiene ningún grado académico, está acompañada, su pareja vive en el exterior y juntos tienen una hija de 2 años de edad.  

Isabel, ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a su pequeña hija, porque apesar que su pareja le ayuda económicamente no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su casa; fue por esa razón que decidió colocar su propio negocio, el cual es un cafetin en el que vende: tacos, tortas mejicanas, hamburguesas, entre otros.- Este negocio tiene 18 meses de tenerlo funcionando y se levanta a las 4:00 de la mañana para preparar todo lo que necesitara en el negocio, porque empieza a vender desde las 7:30 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, es un trabajo muy pesado, pero lo hace con todo cariño para sacar adelante a su hija.

Isabel, necesita el préstamo para comprar pan, tomate, chile, cebolla y carne para preparar los alimentos; pero también invertirá otra parte del dinero colocar una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde para venderlos a buen precio en navidad.
 
El sueño de Isabel, es incrementar su negocio para tener más ganancias y darle mejores condiciones de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Isabel is 35 years old and a housewife. She was not able to attend school. She is in a relationship; her partner lives abroad and together they have a two-year-old daughter. Isabel has had to work a lot to get her small daughter ahead, because in spite of her partner helping her financially, it is not sufficient to cover all of her household expenses. This was why she decided to start her own business, which is a cafe where she sells tacos, sandwiches, and hamburgers, among other items.

She has had her business functioning for 18 months. She wakes up at 4:00 in the morning to prepare everything she will need for the business, because she starts selling at 7:30 in the morning and sells until 5:00 in the afternoon. It is very hard work, but she does it with great love in order to get her daughter ahead.

Isabel needs the loan to buy bread, tomatoes, peppers, onions, and meat to prepare the food. But she will also invest a part of the money in building a chicken fattening farm to sell them at a good price at Christmas.

Isabel's dream is to grow her business to have more earnings and to give her daughter better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, peppers, onions, and meat to prepare her food and to build a coop for fattening chickens.

loans.name: Asosyasyon Jèn Vye Pou Devlopman Kayimit(Ajvdk)

texts.en:
In many rural areas of Haiti, having a goat means having a bank account. One breeds a goat and then sells it after three months to pay for school or to buy seeds for planting.

That is the case in Quartier Morin, a district of the north where Arins launched an association after the earthquake to contribute to goat breeding. His initiative was well-appreciated there. Thanks to that, Arins' community is able to find cash to buy bean seeds and sometimes to feed their households.

Now Arins is seeking a loan from Zafen to buy 18 goats for at least six families that are part of his association. With the proposed activity, a person will be hired full-time to look after the goats and provide vet care.

Form left to right in the picture, Filiseten (member), Dieumene (treasurer), Mimerose (advisor), Charite (member), Jocelyne (member), Techelet (secretary), Maxio (advisor), Renold (deputy coordinator), Louis (member) and Lucknere (member) and Arins (right) is the leader.

loans.use: to purchase 18 goats to breed and sell.

borrowers.first_name: Asosyasyon Jèn Vye Pou Devlopman Kayimit(Ajvdk)

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 34 years old with four children ages 13, 12, 6 and 1.

Her husband is a driver who earns a minimum salary that barely supports their everyday needs.
Helen sells clothes in her community to help out with their expenses. Its been her business for six years.

She started her business with PHP 5,000 in capital and over time and with great effort she was able to have regular customers, earning a net of PHP 2,000 daily which helps a lot with their needs.

Helen was able to start another business selling gallons of mineral water in her community.

Helen's hard work is all for her children, supporting their education and providing them with a better future.

Helen is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy pants, shorts, t-shirts and other clothes to sell to her customers.

The loan will enable her to increase her income and help support her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shorts, t-shirts and other clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 52-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business.

She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community.

She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

Rukhsana hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 49-year-old married father of four. He is the sole breadwinner of his family. Bilal is a hardworking man, specializing in body work on cars since 1980.

He is well known in his region because of his special talent in this domain, and because his hard work provides his customers with their desired results.

Bilal's business and house are located in an Underserved classified region, but he is working hard to make his talents reach a wider region far from his location.

His income isn't good enough to expand his business, since his set prices must go in parallel with his location capabilities.

That is why, in order to develop his business, he acquired a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to invest in buying more crashed cars to repair and sell for good prices.

loans.use: to buy more crashed cars to repair and then sell at good prices.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a 33-year-old married mother of four children. She is a Palestinian refugee who has been working as a Ffrench language teacher for 11 years. She helps support her husband, who works as a nurse and earns a limited monthly salary.

Their incomes barely cover the family's increasing living needs. A loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be used to buy carpet and curtains for her house to keep her family warm during the coming winter season.

Mirna hopes she and her husband can improve their family's social and financial situation.

loans.use: to buy carpet and curtains for her house to keep her family warm during the coming winter season.

loans.name: Aisalkyn

texts.ru: Айсалкын успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем кто откликнулся и помог ей в финансировании. На сегодня у Айсалкын в обороте есть товар на сумму 120,000 сом (KGS), это продукты питания и товары широкого потребления.  Ежемесячная прибыль Айсалкын - 34,000 сом (KGS). Она решила вновь обратиться в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита Айсалкын планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Aisalkyn successfully repaid her loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is grateful to the Kiva fund and to everyone who responded and helped to finance her. Today Aisalkyn has goods in stock worth 120,000 som (KGS). They are food products and consumer goods. Aisalkyn's monthly profit is 34,000 som (KGS). She has decided to apply to Bai Tushum Bank once again for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase her stock of goods. Aisalkyn plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to increase the range of goods in her shop and be more competitive.

loans.name: Lenin Francisco

texts.es: Lenin tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo André de 6 años de edad, el cual tiene de una discapacidad grave, se dedica al lavado de ropa en una lavadora, pues esto le ayuda a mantener su humilde hogar y especialmente los gastos de su pequeño hijo, solicita el crédito para la compra de otra lavadora  así podrá conseguir más ropa para lavar  e incrementara sus ganancias.
texts.en: Lenin is 30 years old and married. He lives with his wife and his 6-year-old son André, who has a severe disability. He makes a living by washing clothing in a washing machine, as this helps him to maintain his humble home and especially with his young son's expenses. He is asking for the loan to buy another washing machine so he will be able to get more clothing to wash and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives in the Akhaltsikhe district with her family. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they cultivate family-owned agricultural land and grow potatoes there. They sell harvested potatoes as well as for use at home.

Diana decided to start s business selling vegetables to generate a stable income. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL.

With the received credit she will purchase seasonal vegetables and will resell at the local market. Diana is very motivated and hopes that the new business will be profitable for her and that she will improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to begin selling vegetables

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad was living a tough life a few years ago; it was very difficult to cover her household expenditures. She is a 45-year-old married woman who, with the help of her husband, has been running a business of selling milk for many years.

She has buffaloes for milking. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 3 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from the Kashf Foundation, and now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales, thus earning a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing her milk sales in order to earn a better income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Clemence's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 8 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 17 avril 2010. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs. Elles ont de bonnes relations et s’activent dans le commerce, l’agriculture et l’embouche.Une bonne ambiance règne pendant les réunions de groupe.
ROCKY  debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche  est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère deux 2 filles et 4  garçons. Elle s’active dans l’embouche.
Avec le prêt reçu elle compte  acheter  un bœuf  à 150 000 FCFA qu’elle va revendre à 410 000 FCFA après élevage. Elle achète de l’aliment de bétail pour 25 000  FCFA et supporte des charges pour l’aménagement de l’enclos à 30 000 FCFA.  Le reste du prêt constitue son fond de roulement. 
Une partie des bénéfices sera consacrée pour rembourser son prêt  et aussi épargner au niveau du banc villageois,  l’autre partie pour répondre aux besoins familiaux et personnels
texts.en:
This group of 8 members is a part of the banc villageois, which was founded on April 17th, 2010. It is made of up women from the same village and surroundings. They have good relationships and are pursuing business, farming, and raising animals. During group meetings, there is always a good ambiance. Rocky, standing on the right of the photo and raising her left hand, is 38 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 girls and 4 boys. She is pursuing raising animals.
After she receives the loan, she plans to buy a cow at 150,000 FCFA that she will sell back for 410,000 FCFA after its raised. She is purchasing the feed for 25,000 FCFA and is covering the expenses for delivering it from the plot of land for 30,000 FCFA. The rest of the loan constitutes her current assets. A part of her profits will be used to pay back her loan and also to save at the banc villageois level. The other part will respond to personal and family needs.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Jancilyn

texts.en:
You might be the answer to Jancilyn’s prayers!

Here is Jancilyn, a 39-year-old entrepreneur from Minglanilla, Cebu. She is married to Roco, an Overseas Filipino Worker who was forced to leave his family to work abroad for a better chance to improve their lives.

Jancilyn feels the sacrifices of her husband, and that’s why she tries to earn a living to help him support their expenses. She’s selling the usual commodities in her variety store, while also raising hogs at the back of their house.

However, the usual dilemma of variety store owners like Jancilyn's is the long time debts of some customers that deplete her capital. Similarly, her hog raising business takes several months before gaining the returns on her investment.

As of now, she needs additional capital to buy more products to display at her store and also additional feed for the hogs. A PHP 40,000 loan will help her a lot. She can improve her profit and gradually expand her business, so that in the near future, her husband can come home to work locally. Both of them can guide their children as they are growing up.

Jancilyn gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products to display at her store and also additional feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Many Filipinos earn PHP 200 to PHP 300 per day. They budget this amount for daily food, transportation, and other expenses. Therefore they cannot afford to buy a big volume of supplies for household use such as sacks of rice, big bottles of cooking oil, several kilos of sugar, and so on.

This is the reason why retail stores are very common in different communities. Customers buy repacked cooking oil good for one-time or one sachet of shampoo good for two showers.

Josephine, 39 years old, manages a retail store and an Internet cafe called Piso Net (a coin-operated Internet PC). She's very grateful for the previous loan of PHP 20,000 which was generously granted to her by CCT in partnership with Kiva.

She was able to buy sufficient stock for her store and added packed viands for sale. Your support also was extended to her niece for her school needs. Helping her niece and supporting her business somehow lessens her longing for her own child.

Josephine is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to buy groceries and beverages, ingredients for different viands, and seed money for another unit of Piso Net. In due time, she aspires to put up another branch of Piso Net in a populous area.

She shares her experiences and aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries and beverages, ingredients for different viands, and seed money for another unit of Piso Net

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en: Sopheak and wife (both in the picture, standing inside their house), farmers and also fishermen, live in Koh Tamov with three children. Sopheak gets up to do farming in early morning and takes free time after farming to do fishing. Sopheak is a hardworking farmer. He works hard day and night to make his family condition improved; however, his family is living in a remote area without a power grid. His family has difficulty using a car battery as home energy. They need to spend money and time going to charge the battery every three or four days. During the peak season, Sopheak needs to go charge the battery more often than normal. It is not convenient and consumes a lot of time. As a result, Sopheak decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy high-quality solar home systems for his family safety and his future goal. His children will be able to study at nighttime better than before. His whole family also can live in safer environment.

loans.use: to pay for solar home systems.

location.town: Koh Tamov Village, Kampong Preahkorki Commune, Bor

loans.name: Sevim

texts.en:
Sevim is 46 years old and a mother of two. After her husband was deceased she started making yufka (thin sheets of dough) in a yufka shop. She improved her skills and started making yufka for winter at her home and selling it to her neighbors. With the help of her loan from Maya she bought a cooking plate and flour in bulk.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sevim Hanım 46 yaşında ve 2 çocuk annesi. Sevim Hanım eşini kaybettik den sonra küçük bir yufka dükkanın da yufka açma işine girmiş. Burada kendini geliştirdikten sonra evinde kışlık yufka yapıp çevresine satmaya başlamış. Maya dan aldığı kredi ile yufka pişirmek için saç ve un aldı.

loans.use: to buy a cooking plate and flour.

loans.name: Nilza

texts.es:
Nilza se dedica a vender productos artesanales, sabe que es un buen negocio en el Cusco, ella se traslada continuamente a los lugares arqueológicos a ofrecerlos lo cual implica mucho esfuerzo, pero es un negocio rentable. Su sueño es incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene y venderlo por mayor. 
la clienta tiene 25 años y 2 pequeños hijos ,ella necesita capital para comprar chompas, ponchos y bolsones ,así tendrá más  ganancias que le permitan sustentar a su familia y sacarlos adelante. Ella está muy agradecida y contenta con el préstamo pues lo usara para hacer crecer su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Nilza earns a living selling artisan products. She knows that it is a good business in Cusco. She travels continuously to the archaeological sites to sell her products. This involves a lot of effort but it is a profitable business. Her dream is to increase the quantity of merchandise that she has and to sell it in bulk.

She is 25 and has two small children. She needs capital to buy jumpers, ponchos and backpacks. Thus she will have more earnings which will help her to look after her family and get them ahead in life. She is very grateful and happy to have the loan as she will use it to make her small business grow.

loans.use: to buy jumpers, ponchos and backpacks.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 39 years old. He is married and blessed with 3 children. He does farming and has been selling the cash crops for all of the 8 years that he has been in the farming business.

He also sells electronics, and it has been profitable. This is his 2nd loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loan successfully.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant on his farm. He hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell. He will use the profits from his expanded business to educate his children.

Richard's future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming and grow more cash crops, make more income and be able to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant on his farm. He hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Emielyn

texts.en:
Armed with her dream to push her children’s studies to completion and eventually enjoy better living conditions someday, Emielyn, 37, is working really hard to improve her business.

She’s managing a small general store and she’s into buy-and-sell of frozen foods in their community in Minglanilla, Cebu. It’s a salable product and sometimes she runs out of stock. As much as she wants to distribute more items, her capital is limited.

Emielyn aims to enhance her store inventory with more grocery items and beverages for sale. She will also buy a volume of frozen foods to prepare for the coming peak season, the Christmas season.

She also aspires to expand her delivery area outside Talisay City in order to gain more customers. These are the reasons why she needs some help from you in the amount of PHP 45,000. She is positive that she can pay it back because of the anticipated increase in demand for her products.

She is married to Greg, a common employee, who is always supportive of her and her business. Both of them exert best efforts to have a sufficient living condition for the whole family.

Emielyn draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy a volume of frozen foods and also more grocery items and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Alhaji Sule

texts.en:
Alhaji Sule is a maize farmer from Madaki village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alhaji Sule is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Sule would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Sule can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alhaji Sule is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family, and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to buy improved machinery and hire skilled labor.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ivowali Group

texts.en:
Ismail, who is in his early 50s, is married with five children. Three of them are still in school while others are grown up . He has been running a retail shop for fifteen years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Ismail's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his business and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay college fees, covered household expenses, and saved some in his bank account. He will use this loan to restock the missing items in his retail shop. He dreams of developing his business and educating his kids until university.

Ismail will share this loan with his loan group, "Ivowali," which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in his retail shop.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas que se unieron con el objetivo de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido y solidario. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Cada una de las que integra este grupo son mujeres muy trabajadoras, pero entre ellas se destaca a la Sra. Lilian, una persona muy sacrificada que empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano cada día, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y es por medio de su humilde emprendimiento, que tiene los medios para poder procurarse una vida digna.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones, shorts, y otras variedades de prendas, de manera a seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city Coronel Ovideo. They are very self-sacrificing women that met with the goal of helping their families through cooperative work. They are in a program to eliminate poverty and are striving to improve the living conditions for themselves and for their families.

The members are very hardworking women, but of this group, Lilian is featured. She is a very selfless woman who starts working very early every day. She makes a living selling all kinds of clothing items. By way of her humble endeavor, she has the means to make a decent living. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, shorts and other types of clothing items to continue striving to improve her living conditions. She is grateful for the opportunity she has to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase various clothing items to sell, such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, shorts, as well as others.

loans.name: Famela

texts.en:
Please meet Famela, 26 years old, from Minglanilla, Cebu. She is selling Filipino favorite street foods, “penoy” and “balut”. Balut is a developing duck embryo that is boiled and eaten from the shell, while penoy is simply a boiled duck egg.

Famela buys these products in volume, cooks them, and pays 2 roaming vendors to sell it at retail. She also supplies some variety stores in their community.

Her income, combined with her partner, Edwin, an electrician, sustains their everyday needs. They have two young children and they want to save early for their college education.

Famela wants to expand her business by obtaining supplementary capital of PHP 40,000 to buy more trays of balut and penoy. She also plans to add other enticing street foods such as fish balls, squid balls, and tempura.

It will surely boost her income and savings at the same time. She dreams of building their own house someday, a typical dream of a starting family. She also prays for a happy family that is bound by love and care for each other.

She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more trays of balut and penoy, and also to add fish balls, squid balls, and tempura.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is very thankful to KIVA for the loan granted to her amounting to 18,000 PHP which she used to buy noodles, five boxes of canned goods, three boxes of snack foods, coffee, sugar and other additional items for her store. Her stock and income has increased and she was able to repay her loan on time. Also her income helps support her family's daily needs. 

Bernardita once again is requesting a loan amounting to 23,000 PHP to buy more groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, and rice to restock and sell in her store. Bernardita is hoping to setup a wholesale sari-sari store (grocery store) to provide better for her children and family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, and rice to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Ella es Marleni, una guerrera de mil batallas, una persona humilde que a lo largo de su vida ha rebuscado la forma de ganarse el sustento y la alimentación, ella actualmente tiene una tienda, pero no genera utilidad suficiente, puesto que es muy pequeña y no tiene suficiente surtido.
Es por este motivo y pensando en la sostenibilidad de su negocio que la señora Marleni quiere solicitar un préstamo para surtir su negocio con verduras, granos y frutas, buscando atraer mayor número de clientes y continuar con la labor que le ha dado de comer todo este tiempo.
texts.en:
This is Marleni, a warrior of a thousand battles. She is a modest person who, throughout her life, has searched for a way to earn money to sustain her and to buy food. She currently has a shop but it does not generate enough as it is very small and does not have enough stock.

It is for this reason, and thinking about the sustainability of her business, that Marleni is asking for a loan to stock up her business with vegetables, grains and fruits, as she looks to attract more customers and to continue with the work that has kept her going all this time.

loans.use: to stock up her business with vegetables, grains and fruits.

loans.name: Mary Berniepher

texts.en:
Your help can improve the lives of others!

Here is Mary, 35 years old, a resident of Libertad, Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte. She is currently running a store which offers the usual commodities that are needed in an individual’s daily life. She also distributes mineral water as another source of income. Her profit helps sustain the everyday necessities of her family with her husband, Woody, who is a tricycle driver. They willingly provide for the needs of their five children. The eldest is studying in college.

However, raising five children is no joke. It’s quite a challenging task especially when it comes to their educational expenses. This is why Mary wants to improve her store inventory to make it more competitive. She longs to buy more groceries, snack items, toiletries, beverages, and gallons of mineral water. She is asking for your valuable help through a PHP 8,000 loan. She is truly hopeful that this amount will help her attract more customers and will then lead to a higher profit.

She dreams of growing her business and have a better living condition someday. She would love to see her children finish their studies and gain stable careers. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, snack items, toiletries, beverages, and gallons of mineral water.

loans.name: Haseed

texts.en:
Haseed, who is in his mid-30's is single and has no children. He has been a supplier of electronics for twelve years now. He works from 8:30 am to 5 pm daily and he is able to get a good month's profit.
This will be Haseed's 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to improve his business by increasing his stock of laptops, flat screen TVs and cameras and has managed to repay all his loans successfully. He is so thankful for the loan from Kiva. Haseed earned some extra income which he used to take care of himself, to reinvest in business, save in his bank account and repay his loan. He will use this loan to increase stock in his business. He dreams of owning an electronics company.
Haseed will make sure he repays his loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase stock in his business.

loans.name: Blanca Neddy

texts.es:
Blanca es una confeccionista de 56 años de edad que trata de sacar a flote su producto estrella que es la producción de tollas, optó por confeccionar principalmente este producto para diferenciarse del mercado y tener menor competencia.
Ahora buscando sobresalir y captar mejores ingresos que apoyen el sostenimiento de su hogar, quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar la confección propia de toallas, por ello todo el dinero será para la compra de tela toalla.
texts.en: Blanca is a 56-year-old seamstress who is making an effort to launch her main product, the production of towels.  She decided to mainly make this product to set herself apart in the market and to have less competition.  Now, she is looking for a way to stand out and to obtain a better income that supports her household.  She wants to request a loan to start producing towels, so all of the money will be used to purchase towel fabric.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make towels.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas 61 is married to a teacher and has four children. As an entrepreneur, he has worked hard all his life and has raised his children away from poverty and struggle. For the last five years, he has been distributing juice to businesses and households across Soweto. Being a lifelong entrepreneur he has decided to grow this business by opening his own shop.

"I want to empower the young guys in my area who grow up in tough situations." says Lucas. He is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a deep freezer, install display units. and secure shop space in the local shopping center. He will also use the money to buy large quantities of the juice to cater for demand from all sides.

"I want to produce my own juice in the future and create employment for my people" he says when asked about his aspirations.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer, install display units, secure shop space, and buy stock.

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en: Ashura, who is in her mid-forties is married with two kids, who are still in school. She has been selling fish for nine years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair month's profit. This will be Ashura's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her business and paid back all her loans successfully. She is so happy with the loans and appreciates the support of Kiva lenders. She used the profits to pay school fees for her kids, make loan repayments, take care of her family, and to reinvest in her business. She will use this loan to buy fish, cooking oil and charcoal to use for frying fish. She dreams of being a big business woman and to make progress on her business. Ashura will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish, cooking oil and charcoal to use for frying fish

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is a 46-year-old married woman. She lives in the Batumi district with her husband and two children. Marine's husband teaches at local university and gets a monthly income. The family is experienced in producing wine. They produce wine at home and then sell it locally at a good price. Marine decided to expand the production and needs money to purchase more grapes. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $3,600 USD. With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of grapes for producing more wine. This will significantly increase her family's income. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase grapes in order to produce and sell wine.

loans.name: Nyomo Noo Noo Okwe Group

texts.en:
Within the locality of Chorkor in the Greater Accra region of Ghana are two outstanding women in the group called Nyomo Noo Noo Okwe.
Joycelyn is a very loyal and dedicated woman who is heart-full of gratitude for the sustenance and improvement of her business.
She is in her 10th cycle of loan and 15th year of selling provisions. Her hardworking and truthful attitude in the repayment of her loan has brought to her a prosperous state of business.
Joycelyn seeks a loan from ID-Ghana to buy more items to satisfy the need of her buyers.
She is married to a pastor with three children in their own house.

loans.use: to buy more items to satisfy the need of her buyers.

loans.name: Elizaberth

texts.en:
Elizaberth, who is in her late 50's, is married with three grown-up kids. She has been a food vendor since 1976. She works from 6 am to midday daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Elizaberth's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her mamalishe stock and has repaid all her loans successfully. She is doing fine with the loan. She used the profits to take care of her family and herself, to repay her loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the food store. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Elizaberth will make sure she repays her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the food store.

loans.name: Los Sembradores De Versalles Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS SEMBRADORES DE VERSALLES, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ocobamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Juana tiene 55 años de edad tiene 1 hijo y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al cultivo de frutas, la socia continua cultivando sus frutas para luego  venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando parea de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas entre otros.
Los socios en general se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Los Sembradores de Versalles". The bank is located in the Ocobamba district, in the La Convención province, and in the department of Cusco.

Juana is 55 years old, has one son, and is a widow. She divides her time between growing and selling fruit. She continues growing the fruit to later sell to her customers that request them. She is a responsible person and has had her business for some time. Her business is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it each day.

She wants to continue this work and in this way keep on supporting her family. She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other supplies.

The members as a group are grateful for the loan and are committed to making payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other supplies.

loans.name: Atitecas Group

texts.en:
“Atitecas” trust bank is made up of 8 hard working women who live in the city of Santiago Atitlán on the shores of one of the most beautiful lakes in the world, Lago Atitlán, located in Western Guatemala. 

Now, almost all of the members are mothers, with children in primary and secondary school, or still at home. The Atitecas have a wide variety of professions, making and selling clothing and other goods from typical cloths which they weave themselves, on the lakeshore, and managing businesses such as shoe stores and convenient stores. 

Dora is the president of the Atitecas, and had the opportunity to study through 6th grade. With 30 years of age, she is the mother of 3 children, a son who studies in secondary school a daughter in 6th grade, and a little boy beginning his studies, in kindergarten. Dora takes care of her children with the help of her husband, who works in agriculture and supports her in the businesses she manages, a shoe shop and selling fish and other seafood. In addition to these businesses, Dora also weaves and embroiders huipiles, traditional blouses, unique to Santiago, which she sells on the lakeshore. With this Kiva loan she will invest in fish and shrimp to sell, and also in some materials for her huipil production. 

Dora thanks the organization very much for all of the support, and Kiva, for the loan she receives, which opens the doors to success in her career and in those of her fellow group members.

loans.use: to invest in fish and shrimp to sell,.

loans.name: Dharmdew

texts.en: Dharmdew is 33 years old. He is married and has one child. He works in a banana company and in his free time, he cultivates rice. In 2014, he started planting rice with support from Seva MFI. Dharmdew lives in his father's house. His dream is to have his own house and take good care of his family. With his profits he has expanded his rice areas, that's why he needs a new loan of 10,000 SRD to buy inputs for his rice production.

loans.use: To buy the inputs of his rice production

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 34 year old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents. Her parents cooperates together in order to satisfy their family needs and demands and to be able to enhance their way of living. As for her, she is only focusing on her study and works in parallel as a secretary in a company. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her Technical Study fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva to continue her education, her only target.

loans.use: to pay her Technical Study fees.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, who is in his early 40's, is single with three kids. While one of whom is still small, the others are in school .He supports his life by running two projects, one of which is a shop to sell clothes and fashion shoes. He works from 7 am to 7 pm daily and is able to earn a very good profit per month.
This will be James' 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his clothing stock and has managed to repay all his loans successfully. He is doing great with the loan and appreciates the lender's support. He used the profits to pay school fees for his kids, save some in his bank account and make loan repayments. He will use this loan to buy up-to-date clothes and fashion shoes to meet his customers' requests and demand. James' dream is to expand his business and get known all around the world.
James will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date clothes and fashion shoes to meet his customers' requests and demand.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 45 years old, married, and blessed with 2 children. She has a retail shop and also practices dairy farming. She has been in the dairy business for 11 years, and she used the profits from her previous loan to open her retail shop.

This is her 2nd loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and is close to having repaid her previous loan. She will use this loan to buy more inventory of rice, flour, milk, and sugar for resale and hopes this will enable her to earn more income so she can pay her children's school fees and also buy dairy cows.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her retail shop, earn more income, and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of rice, flour, milk, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paula es una humilde y tierna mujer de 38 años de edad que guiada por su vocación y gusto por el emprendimiento monto un negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, y ahora está buscando un apoyo pues quiere poner en marcha un ambicioso proyecto de expansión y búsqueda de clientela, puesto que solicita un importante suma de dinero para tener en su granero la venta de legumbres, frutas y un mayor y completo surtido de abarrotes, acercando su empresa a un mini-mercado, un proyecto muy ambicioso que siempre ha querido realizar pero al falta de recursos ha sido su principal impedimento.
Todos estos esfuerzos los realiza persiguiendo un sueño, que es tener una casa propia.
texts.en: Paula is a humble and caring 38-year-old woman who, guided by her calling and taste for entrepreneurship, started a business—a staple goods store.  She is now looking for support because she wants to start her ambitious project of expanding and searching for clientele, which is why she is requesting a considerable sum of money to have legumes, fruit and a wider, more complete assortment of groceries in her inventory.  This will bring her business closer to a mini market, a very ambitious project that she has always wanted to carry out, but her lack of resources has been her main obstacle.  She is putting forth all of these efforts to pursue her dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to purchase legumes, fruit and a wider, more complete assortment of groceries.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 55 years old from village Kumisi. He has wife and son, who is involved in a trading business with brooms. He gets 300-400 GEL monthly, that is the only source of income for family. Nodar requested financial support to start his own business and get the chance somehow to increase his family's living condition. He couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo.

The program allows rural poors Like Nodar to get a chance for starting or re-starting business. With the money, Nodar plans to purchase a car and start trading with cheese. He will transfer the purchased cheese at the capital and sell there in a good price. Nodar will have his own loyal costumers and will generate his own income.

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased regards Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start trading with cheese.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
Xiomara es una hermosa joven de 21 años de edad la cual se dedica a sacar a adelante un negocio de venta de alimentos que inició por su propia voluntad, buscando generar ingresos para ayudar en su hogar y tener la oportunidad de estudiar, su dinamismo, buenas ideas, la han ayudado a tener buenos clientes, ella con productos frescos y con una sonrisa cada que va a entregar un producto busca que el cliente se sienta a gusto y quiera volver.
Debido a sus buenos resultados Xiomara cree que es el momento para impulso su profesión, por ello se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico para la compra de enseres y maquinaria para ofrecer servicios de cafetería, un plus gigante a su negocio que le traerá de seguro un mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Xiomara is a beautiful 21 year old young woman. She works to get ahead in her business selling food, which she started on her own. She wants to generate income in order to contribute to her home and to have the opportunity to study. Her energy and good ideas have helped her to gain good customers. With fresh products and with a smile for each customer that she serves, she has satisfied customers who want to return.
Because of her good results Xiomara believes that this is the time to move her business forward. This is why she is requesting financial assistance to buy the basic tools and machinery to offer cafeteria services. This will be a huge help to her business, which will surely bring a greater number of customers.

loans.use: to buy the basic tools and machinery to offer cafeteria services.

loans.name: Ngoc's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoc, born in 1977, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband and her two sons, living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation, the harvest of coffee and rice is about VND 40 to 50 million. However, the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She wants to pay for her children’s education fees and invest more in here children’s education but she does not have enough money while her children, one is at high school and one is at senior high school. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
She hopes that the loan amount will her children have good learning conditions and then they will have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education fees

loans.name: Las Flores Salcaja Group

texts.en:
Above the city of Salcajá, Quetzaltenango, on a hike on a cobblestone road up a hillside of cornfields and beautiful farms in the mountains of Northern Guatemala, we find the rural community of Santa Rita, a home to the 7 women of “Las Flores Salcajá”, or “The Salcajá Flowers”  trust bank. The youngest member, 23 years old, and the oldest, 42, these bright women, radiating happiness, light, and confidence are mothers of 1 to 4 children and run their own businesses, weaving and selling cortes, traditional skirts, and maintaining convenience stores, raising animals to sell in the market in the city below each week on Thursdays and Sundays. The majority of the group was able to study several years in primary school, and now work together with their spouses to support their families. 

Ángela is a group member who is 25 years old, mother of two small children, a 3-year-old daughter and a 4-month-old little son, Ángela is busy, running her weaving business, producing cortes, beautiful traditional skirts to sell, and caring for her children with the support of her husband. To strengthen her product, she is requesting for a loan in order to invest in high-quality threads, a comb for her loom, which separates the different threads that she is using, beautiful colors of dyes, and other materials to restock her supply. This dreamer-woman would like to duplicate her income and her sales, and strongly values saving, with the goal to always have money in savings for her family. She really appreciates the form in which Friendship Bridge works, how clear the paperwork processes are, the support from her group facilitator, and the dynamic meetings, where all women participate, learn, and grow together.

loans.use: to invest in high-quality threads, a comb for her loom, which separates the different threads that she is using, beautiful colors of dyes

loans.name: Javier Jose

texts.es:
Javier una persona práctica, recursiva, responsable y respetuosa de 37 años de edad, necesita tu apoyo, busca incentivar y aumentar la producción de su negocio de cría de ganado porcino.
Javier vive en una zona de postconflicto, es padre de 3 hijos, tienen 10, 7, 8 años de edad, su propósito, su sueño es cambiar el presente de sus hijos, quiere que tengan oportunidades, sueños, que estudien, se capaciten que no sean unos simples empleados, o con un negocio que solo les dé para vivir, los quiere ver triunfando en la vida.
Javier quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, alimento de engorde, vacunas y vitaminas, quiere aumentar la cantidad de animales disponibles en sus porquertizas.
texts.en:
Javier, 37 years old, is a practical, persistent, responsible, and respectful person. He is looking to boost the production of his swine livestock business and needs your support.

Javier lives in a post-conflict area and is a father to three children, who are ten, seven, and eight years old. His goal and dream is to change his children’s current situation. He wants for them to have opportunities and dreams, to study, and to receive training so that they are not ordinary employees or with a business that only gives them what they need to survive—he wants for them to succeed in life.

Javier wants to request a loan to purchase pigs, feed, vaccines, and vitamins to increase the number of available animals in his swine houses.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, fodder, vaccines, and vitamins.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en: Iyad is a 26 year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. His parents cooperates together and represents the main income source and as for him, he is focusing on his study and works in a company and works also in parallel as a painter. Today, he is in need for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his university fees. In the future, he is planning to take more loan to ensure a great educational path for him to be able to work at a proper company to gain good experience in the field.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Gerardo Ulises

texts.es:
Gerardo, es un hombre soltero, no tiene hijos, económicamente de él dependen sus padres y hermanos, es propietario de una carpintería  que es muy reconocida en su localidad, la cual es la fuente de ingresos para el sustento propio y de su grupo familiar.
Invertirá en madera, un soldador y lijas para madera, con estos materiales aumentara la productividad y calidad de los muebles que fabrica en su negocio, al incrementar su inventario, atraerá más clientes y obtendrá mayores ingresos económicos. 
Uno de sus mayores sueños es, en un futuro poder ampliar su negocio para continuar manejando su buen record crediticio y tener una mayor estabilidad económica para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a single man who has no children. His parents and brothers are economically dependent on him. 

He is the owner of a carpentry shop that is very well recommended in his community. His shop is the source of income that supports both him and his family.

He will invest in wood, a welding machine, and sanders for wood, and with these materials will increase productivity as well as the quality of the furniture his business produces. By increasing his inventory, he will attract more clients and gain a better financial income. 

One of his biggest dreams is, in the future, to be able to expand his business to continue managing his good credit record and have more economic stability for himself and his family.

loans.use: He will invest in wood, a welding machine, and sanders for wood, and with these materials will increase productivity as well as the quality of the furniture his business produces.

loans.name: Johana Patricia

texts.es:
Johana es una mujer de 27 años de edad, una persona guerrera, luchadora que no se rinde, persevera en sus objetivos, ella desde muy joven aprendió a elaborar artesanías con un material llamado cañaflecha (ver foto, lo que sostiene en las manos), ella lucha por lograr su objetivo de construir su vivienda en material (concreto y ladrillo).
Su mayor alegría la obtuvo hace un mes, pues su hijo, nació un precioso hombre que ha llenado de alegría su corazón.
Hoy ella quiere mejorar su producción, aumentar sus artículos y llevar sus artesanías a más personas, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cañaflecha en cantidades.
texts.en:
Johana is a 27-year-old woman and a fighter who never gives up and perseveres towards her goals. Since she was very little, she learned to make crafts with a material called caña flecha, a type of cane that grows in the region (see photo, where she is holding it). She strives to achieve her goal, which is to build a house out of concrete and brick.

Her greatest joy arrived one month ago with the birth of her son, a precious boy who has filled her heart with happiness. Now, she wants to improve her production, increase her inventory, and provide her crafts to more people. This is why she wants to request a loan to purchase caña flecha in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase caña flecha to make her crafts.

loans.name: Osu Nyame Bekyere Group

texts.en:
In a very developed area of Chorkor in the Greater Region of Ghana, is the group Osu Nyame Bekyere. There are three in the group, all skillful and hardworking women who work very hard to satisfy their customers' needs.

Hannah is a young, energetic lady who has three years working experience in the sale of secondhand clothing. She is single with no kids, due to her hardworking performance.

Her buyers have high demand for more clothing, therefore Hannah, along with her group, is seeking the help of ID Ghana for her loan portion of 800 GHS so she can fulfill her buyers' demands.

loans.use: to attain to buy more used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Nasyrzhan

texts.ru: Насыржан, 38 лет, женат, отец 2 детей, дочери 5 лет, сыну - 12 лет.
