Planning to eradicate this problem from the root, Mayerling is requesting a loan to buy materials to repair the roof of her house.  Also, she is looking to stock up on stationary products, soft drinks, and groceries.

loans.use: To buy materials to repair the roof of her home, it has leaks (her business is in her house).

loans.name: Alhaji Haruna

texts.en:
Alhaji Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. He is anticipating a good harvest this season. Alhaji Haruna has the opportunity to yield up to 8 tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Haruna had to sell his maize at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market. With the help of this loan, Alhaji Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Haruna will benefit from marketing support that help him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of maize. Alhaji Haruna is thankful that he has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to use for his business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing to eliminate the pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Alhaji Alasan

texts.en:
Alhaji Alasan is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. He is anticipating a good harvest this season. Alhaji Alasan has the opportunity to yield up to 8 tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Alasan had to sell his maize at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market. With the help of this loan, Alhaji Alasan can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Alasan will benefit from marketing support that help him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of maize. Alhaji Alasan is thankful that he has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to use for his business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing to eliminate the pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 23-year-old mother with 1 child. She runs and operates a small business of selling pancakes, buns and pork cake in her community to earn a living. Maria requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, frying pan and vegetable oil to help her run the business.

She will use her profit to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, frying pan and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is a hard working man residing in the rural town of Dagohoy, Bohol. He is married man and has four children. His oldest is 18 and the youngest is 1. He runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells goods ranging from eggs, seasonings, edible oil, assorted canned goods, biscuits and soft drinks. In addition to that, he also raises hogs.

He would like to boost both sources of his income. He joined CEVI to access loans to cater to his financial needs. He would like to enhance and maintain the inventory of his store and also improve his way of raising hogs. Artemio wants to buy supplies for the store, pig feed and piglets. In that way, it could help augment his income and he can continue to handle his finances wisely.

In the future, Artemio is determined that he will do his best to continue to support the welfare of his family and also support his children's education, too.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the store, pig feed and piglets.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 39 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 2 maiores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2012, este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, chapas e mais para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Rachel was born in Namaacha, province of Maputo. She is 39 years old. She is married with 4 children, 2 of them of age. All of them go to school. She is not responsible for anyone else.
She began working with Hluvuku in 2012. This is her fourth loan with them and she wants to use it to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, metal sheets and other items to continue building her home.
In the future, she intends to finish the construction works and secure the education of her two children until they reach college.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, metal sheets and other items to continue building her home

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel un hombre de 43 años de edad, una persona muy trabajadora, ingeniosa y autodidacta, se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino, las porquerizas y varias cosas en su hogar son construidas por él, es en verdad muy ingenioso e inteligente. 
Tiene tres niños, la mayor de 16, y los bebes de 12 y 7 años, vive en unión libre con su pareja, para Manuel su pareja lo es todo, los ama con todo su corazón y quiere siempre lo mejor para ellos.
Actualmente el señor Manuel se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para abastecer sus porquerizas ya que le quedan muy pocos animales, el dinero será usado para la compra de cerdos, vitaminas y alimento de engorde.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 43-year-old man. He is a hard-working, clever, and self-taught person. He earns a living raising pigs. The pigsties and other things in his home were built by him; he is really very clever and intelligent.

He has three children, the oldest is 16 and the younger ones are 12 and 7 years old. He lives in a common-law marriage with his partner. To Manuel, his partner is everything and he loves his family with all his heart and always wants the best for them.

Currently, Manuel is requesting a loan to stock his pigsties since he has very few animals left. The loan will be used to buy pigs, vitamins, and food to fatten them.

loans.use: to stock his pigsties since he has very few animals left.

loans.name: Salome

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Xai-Xai Província de Gaza tem 50 anos de idade solteira mãe de 2 filhas maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 5 netos dos quais 3 vivem em sua casa.
Trabalha como jardineira a mais de 9 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o empréstimo solicitado adquirir uma geleira para sua casa. Este é o seu 13º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende garantir o ensino dos seus netos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Salome was born in Xai-Xai, province of Gaza. She is 50 years old and she is a single mother of two daughters of age. She is responsible for her 5 grandchildren, 3 of which live with her.
She's been a gardener for more than 9 years, putting all her money towards the household expenses. With this loan, she wants to buy a fridge for the house. This will be her 13th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future, she intends to secure the education of her grandchildren all the way to collage.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her home

loans.name: Itiiti

texts.en: Itiiti is a 34-year-old mother of 2 children. To earn a living, she runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village. Itiiti has requested a loan to buy chemicals, taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, and a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves. These items will help her run the business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and provide for her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, and a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La socia Anita pertenece al banco comunal KUSKA LLANKASUN DE RUMICHACA BAJA.
La socia continua dedicándose  al negocio de venta de refrescos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que mediante su negocio la socia podrá tener más ganancias para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar azúcar, maíz, limón, canela entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Anita is a member of the KUSKA LLANKASUN DE RUMICHACA BAJA communal bank.

She continues to work at her business of selling juices. She is a proactive and hard-working woman who through her business is able to earn more income and in this way continue to help support her family. 

She has been doing this work for a long time, and thanks to the effort she puts into it each day, it is going well. She hopes to be able to keep doing this work and helping to support her family. 

She is requesting this loan to buy sugar, corn, limes, cinnamon, and other ingredients. 

She is thankful for this loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy sugar, corn, limes, cinnamon, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita has noticed that her store is not as attractive to buyers as it once was. She knows the reason why: her stock displays are limited. Angelita knows that a wide array of merchandise makes a “sari-sari” or variety store appealing to customers, but her limited capital prevents her from increasing her inventory.

For this reason, Angelita has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy a large volume of supplies like grocery items and dry goods. These additional items will improve the competitiveness of her store within her community in Toril, Davao City. She also aspires to be a wholesaler of soft drinks.

Every week, she meets with her fellow CCT members to share valuable advice and business tips. Her retired husband, Roberto, also gives his unwavering support to her. Both Angelita and Roberto want to enrich their lives and prepare for their future needs.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as grocery items and dry goods.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a zealous member of CCT Credit Cooperative for almost nine years, Rosario gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and business. She herself has also encouraged her group, her family and her community in Toril, Davao City by being a good model entrepreneur.

Rosario is a loving wife to her husband Edgardo, a driver, and a caring mother to their three children. She appreciates her husband’s hard work, and she complements it by earning additional income from her variety store and internet cafe business. She considers her business as a good foundation that will expand in due time with the grace of God. The couple hopes to bestow a stable business to their children in the future. For the meantime, they work hard for the completion of their children’s education.

As of now, Rosario needs additional capital to buy assorted groceries and beverages. She will also pay for her computer maintenance, buy computer parts, and internet connection upgrade. She is requesting for PHP 50,000 loan to address this need and she is knocking at your generous hearts.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for computer maintenance, computer parts, internet connection upgrade and buy assorted groceries and beverages.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy has a fishing business in the Philippines and she works hard to support her family. She has been in this business for the past 6 years.

Christy has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets.

In the future, Christy would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Biskila

texts.en:
Biskila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Biskila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Biskila would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Biskila can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Biskila will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Biskila is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 51 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Elsie runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell. Elsie has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Saugina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo, tem 26 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 1 filho menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 4 sobrinhos.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2014, este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento janelas e mais para terminar a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e adquirir uma viatura. O seu maior desafio é dar continuidade com os seus estudos.
texts.en:
Saugina was born in Namaacha, province of Maputo. She is 26 years old. She is married and mother of a small son. She is also responsible for her 4 nephews.
She began working with Hluvuku in 2014. This is her 2nd loan with Hluvuku and she wants to use it to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, windows and other materials to finish building her home.
In the future, she intends to finish the works and buy a car. Her bigger challenge is to continue her higher education.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, windows and other items to finish building her home

loans.name: Onolata

texts.en: Onolata is a 39-year-old woman with 3 children. To earn a living, she owns and operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market. Onolata has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, various paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine to help her run the business. She will use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paints, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Soloi

texts.en: Soloi is a 22-year-old mother of 3 children. To earn a living, she owns and operates a business selling taro and banana chips in her community. Soloi has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, a gas stove, and containers to help her run the business. She will use her profits to improve her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, a gas stove, and containers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and has a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family.

Erlinda has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of nipa roofing to sell. She has been in this business for the past 13 years. Erlinda successfully paid back her previous loan and she has requested an new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 28-year-old woman and married with two children. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She operates a small general store, selling varieties of food and other household items. She has been doing this for five years.

Cecilia requested a loan to buy bales of rice and a solar panel set to assist her in running the business.
She plans to use her profit to help cover her family's weekly expenses and provide better education for her children.

She has been an SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bales of rice and a solar panel set for her general store.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 50 years old and has one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell such as soap, milk, canned goods, chips, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Marilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as soap, milk, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 64 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Josefina has been in this business for 10 years.

Josefina requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, etc. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Duyen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyen, 31 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family lives mainly based on cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount.

She wants to repair the breeding facilities to raise pigs but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get the money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family have clean and strong breeding facilities, which will assist the breeding job well.

loans.use: to repair the breeding facilities to raise pigs.

loans.name: Lieu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lieu, born in 1973, is from the Kinh ethnic majority. Her family consists of five members, including her husband, her two daughters, and a child of her son. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from running the business of metallurgy, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She wants to repair her house, but she does not have enough money to pay for builders and buy building materials. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a clean and spacious house, and all the members of her family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Finoa

texts.en: Finoa is a 29-year-old mother with 3 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. Finoa requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, bottle of mushroom soy sauce, sack of onions, plates, tomato sauce and aluminum foil to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015. She will expand her business by using her profit.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, bottle of mushroom soy sauce, sack of onions, plates, tomato sauce and aluminum foil.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is a 31-year-old mother with 1 child. She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years.

Gene requested for a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Augusta Renee

texts.es:
la socia Augusta se sigue dedicando a sus negocios de casa de cambio y a su bar.Ella expende todo tipo de bebidas como gaseosa, jugos y cerveza.
Augusta es una mujer trabajadora que trabaja todo el día con fin de sacar adelante a su familia , su objetivo es ampliar su bar progresivamente, para ello la socia necesita comprar una congeladora , la cual le permita tener las bebidas al gusto se sus clientes y brindar mejor servicio.
la socia agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella.
texts.en:
Augusta continues to work at her money changer and bar businesses. She sells all types of drinks, such as sodas, juices and beer.

Augusta is a hardworking woman who works all day long to get her family ahead. Her objective is to expand her bar progressively. To do this, she needs to buy a freezer, which will allow her to have the drinks the way her customers like them and offer a better service.

She is grateful to the KIVA investors for continuing to put their trust in her.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria Elizabeth se sigue dedicando a su negocio,que es vender comida .ella es una joven trabajadora que lleva muchos años realizando este trabajo para sustentar a su familia, ella necesita tener mas capital para comprar carne, pollo, papa , arroz y aceite.
ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y agradece a KIVA por el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Maria Elizabeth continues with her business of selling food. She is a hard-working young woman who has been doing this work for many years to support her family. She needs more capital so she can buy meat, chicken, potatoes, rice, and oil.

She is committed to making her repayments on time and she is grateful to Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, potatoes, rice, and oil

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 58 years old and married with one child. Aida works very hard to provide for them.

Aida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Aida has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Aida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 32 years old and married with two children who are in school. Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, chips, milk, soap, eggs, etc.

Myrna has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, chips, milk, soap, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Alijandra

texts.en:
Alijandra is 59 years old and has eight children. Alijandra is a single woman.

Alijandra is in the agricultural business, farming fruits in the Philippines. Alijandra requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alijandra has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alijandra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Ella es Rocío una mujer de 51 años de edad que actualmente se encuentra separada de su esposo, una persona en la cual no crían, que siempre se había dedicad al hogar, pues su esposo le daba todo, pero ella con carácter y gran personalidad demostró la mujer que era pues monto un negocio de venta de alimentos con lo cual sostiene su casa y paga las deudas.
El principal Objetivo de Rocío es comprar una vivienda propia, algo que ha querido toda su vida, una apuesta a futuro, en lo cual trabaja todos los días para lograrlo.
Rocío buscando mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, diversificar la variedad de alimentos quiere solicitar un préstamo, invertirá en enseres, y materia prima para la elaboración de almuerzos, comprara refrescos y surtido de snack.
texts.en:
Rocío is a 51-year-old woman who is currently separated from her husband. She has always been dedicated to the home and she gave her husband everything. With a lot of character and personality, she demonstrated what kind of woman she was by setting up a business that sells food. This business supports her household and settles her debts.

Rocío’s main goal is to buy her own house; this is something that she has wanted her whole life and it is a future investment that she works towards every day.

Rocío seeks to improve her sales, increase her clientele, and diversify the food that she offers; for this reason, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy equipment and ingredients for making lunches, as well as soft drinks and snack food.

loans.use: to buy equipment and ingredients for making lunches. She will buy soft drinks and snack food.

loans.name: Yadith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yadith, es una ama de casa de 37 años de edad, preocupaba, responsable, visionaria, que tiene 3 pequeños de 7, 6 y 4 años, vive en un humilde hogar, aunque no tengan grandes lujos, ni propiedades, tiene su casita, con su trabajo de cría y venta de ganado porcino genera el sustento y junto con los ingresos que da su pareja mantienen el hogar.
Inicio su trabajo por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, su propósito a corto plazo es invertir en su vivienda, en un piso en cerámica, en pintar la vivienda y con el pasar del tiempo ir comprando muebles, mesas, cositas para el hogar.
La principal preocupación den la vida de Yadith son sus hijos, esos muchachos que lo significan todo para ella, es feliz viéndolos crecer en un ambiente juego, sano, de diversión, pero es consciente del sector donde vive, que fácilmente se pueden dañar, por ello les inculca buenos valores y hace mucho énfasis en su educación ya que espera que salgan de esa zona residencial en un futuro y se preparen para la vida en una universidad donde puedan convertirse en profesionales.
Yadtih actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de alimento de engorde para sus cerdos, quiere acelerar su proceso y obtener animales con buen peso para la temporada de diciembre.
texts.en:
Yadith is a 37 year old housewife, She is a concerned, responsible, visionary woman with three little ones, aged 7, 6 and 4. She lives in a humble home. Even though she has no great luxuries, nor properties, she has her little house. With her work raising and selling pigs she generates income, and together with her husband's income, they support the home. She started her work because she wanted to do it and because she has a vocation for independent work. Her short term objective is to invest in her home, in a ceramic tile floor, in painting the home and over time buy furniture, tables and things for the home.

Yadith is most concerned in life for her children. The children mean everything to her. She is happy seeing them grow in an environment of play, health and fun. She is aware that in the area where she lives, they could easily be badly influenced. That is why she instills good values in them and really emphasizes their education. She hopes that they can leave that residential area in the future and prepare for life in the university where they can learn professions and graduate.

Now, Yadtih is asking for a loan to buy feed to fatten her pigs. She wants to accelerate their growth process and obtain animals with a good weight for the December season.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten her pigs. She wants to accelerate the process and obtain animals with a good weight for the December season.

loans.name: Nu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nu, born in 1950, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She lives with her husband, son, son's wife, and son's child in Mai Son district, Son La province.
 
Her family’s main income is from their meager retirement salary, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. 

She wants to raise pigs to sell to get additional income for the family, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest well in the breeding, and she will work hard to get the money to repay the loan for the family on time.

loans.use: to raise pigs to sell.

loans.name: Oswaldo Jose

texts.es: Lechones, alimento, vacunas, vitaminas es lo que necesita Oswaldo para su negocio de cría de ganado porcino, pero al no tener capital suficiente para comprarlo de su bolsillo, acude a una ayuda crediticia que le permita incentivar y mejorar su actividad, preparándose para la temporada de diciembre, donde vende mayor número de cerdos, quiere generar buen dinero para ofrecerles a su familia una hermosa familia donde abunden el amor y algún detalle que haga sacar una sonrisa a sus seres queridos, ese es su objetivo.
texts.en:
Piglets, feed, vaccines and vitamins are what Oswaldo needs for his business of raising pigs. 

But since he doesn't have the necessary capital to buy these things from his pocket, he is seeking help from a loan that will allow him to impulse and improve his business, in preparation for the December season, when he sells the most pigs. 

He hopes to generate a good income so that he can offer his family, a nice, big family where love abounds, a few things that will bring a smile to the face of his loved ones. This is his goal.

loans.use: to buy a stock of pigs for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Alfredo Manuel

texts.es:
Alfredo es un hombre soltero de 36 años de edad, que diariamente trabaja y lucha por salir adelante, por cambiar su realidad, por aspirar a un mejor futuro, a una mejor vida, una persona que dijo no más, no quiere seguir siendo pobre, quiere trabajar claro está, honestamente por adquirir grandes cosas, todo fruto de su sudor, no solo laborar para sobrevivir.
Hoy Alfredo quiere solicitar un préstamo, uno que le permita salir adelante y sostener sus contundentes palabras, expresadas de sus deseos. Con el dinero comprara alimento, vacunas y vitaminas.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a single man, 36 years old, who every day works and struggles to get by, to change his reality, to hope for a better future, and better life; A person who said "No more".  He doesn’t want to continue being poor. He wants to work, for sure, honestly, in order to obtain great things, all from the sweat of his brow, not just struggle to survive. 

Today Alfredo wants to request a loan, one that will help him make a living and support his forceful claims, that express his hopes. 

With the money he will buy food, vaccines, and vitamins.

loans.use: to buy food, vaccines, and vitamins.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Alma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio continúa con su negocio de panadería. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando harina por mayor, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque vendió toda su producción. Actualmente su panadería mantiene a la familia entera, sus hijos colaboran en el trabajo como su esposa, “la harina que compré rindió muy bien, pude comprar un par de garrafas con las utilidades…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias y vende toda la producción, la desventaja es la falta de harina por quintal para hornear a diario. Su sueño es mejorar su panadería y vender en la ciudad, el desea comprar harina por quintal para contar con material de trabajo constante para las fiestas de fin de año donde la demanda aumenta. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 14 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lucio solicita un préstamo para comprar harina por quintal para hornear pan tradicional toda la temporada.
texts.en:
Lucio continues with his bread bakery business. The loan that he obtained was invested in buying flour wholesale. He made his payments punctually because he sold everything he made. Right now, his bread bakery is supporting his whole family. His children and his wife help with the work. “The flour I bought performed very well. I was able to buy a pair of a couple of tanks with the profits," he remarks. The advantage of his business is that the sales are daily and he sells everything he makes. The disadvantage is the lack of flour by the quintal to bake daily. His dream is to improve his bread bakery and sell in the city. He wants to buy flour by the quintal to have stable work materials for the end of the year festivities when demand increases. This is his second loan cycle with the institution during the 14 years he has been doing this activity

It is for these reasons that Lucio is asking for a loan to buy flour by the quintal to bake traditional bread during the whole season.

loans.use: to buy flour by the quintal to bake traditional bread for the whole season.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor earns a living by running a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells goods ranging from eggs, seasonings, shampoo, edible oil, assorted canned goods, biscuits, and soft drinks. She has two school-aged children. She lives in the town of Pilar, Bohol. 

Three months ago, she started her livelihood; serving neighbors in her place. Amor would like to improve the content of her store start to find ways on how to become more sustainable.

Amor decided to avail a loan to buy groceries, such as condiments, beverages and assorted canned goods. With the presence of these she could maximize the store's resources, enabling her to maintain the flow of its merchandise. Thus, she can start to save and invest in any possible business ventures to become successful. In that way, she could  provide her family with proper nutrition and better shelter to live in.

Amor is looking forward to continue to manage her sari-sari(variety) store for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy  groceries, such as condiments, beverages, and assorted canned goods.

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 21 años de edad que a pesar de ser madre soltera no se deja vencer, ella vive con su hijo de 4 años de edad en vivienda propia.  Ana se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos de forma ambulante como son: plátanos, pescado, elotes, entre otros, ya que de esta manera puede ganarse la vida y estar pendiente de su hijo. Ana desea construir un muro en su vivienda, que le permite brindar mayor seguridad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un muro y brindar seguridad a su hogar. Con el crédito recibido anteriormente logro instalar energía eléctrica por lo que se siente muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Ana is a 21-year-old woman, and despite being a single mother, she does not let herself be defeated. She lives with her 4-year-old son in a house she owns.

Ana works as a traveling saleswoman of various products, such as bananas, fish, corn on the cob, etc. so that she is able to make a living and be attentive to her son.

Ana wants to build a wall in her house, which will give her better security, so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a wall and make her home secure. With her previous loan, she was able to install electricity, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a wall and make her home secure

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Amelia works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from coconut wine vending. Amelia is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business for her tricycle transport business.

Amelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her tricycle transport business.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo es un socio dedicado a su trabajo para salir adelante,el sigue dedicando a brindar servio de taxi, el necesita el préstamo para reparar su automóvil que es su herramienta de trabajo y su único sustento. el no desfallece en su sueño que es comprarse un autobús, que le permita ganar mas y aportar mejor a su familia. el socio esta muy contento con el prestamo otorgado por los inversionista de KIVA.
texts.en:
Hugo is a member dedicated to his work in order to get ahead. He pursues a living by providing taxi service. He needs a loan in order to repair his car, which is his work tool and his only support.

He does not give up on his dream, which is buying himself a bus. This would allow him to earn more and provide the best to his family. This member is very content with the loan given by the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to repair his automobile.

loans.name: Fulgencia

texts.en:
This is Fulgencia, a 66-year-old “sari-sari” (variety) store owner. She is married to Rodolfo, a retired worker, and they have grown up children. They reside in Toril, Davao City.

Fulgencia’s income from her store varies from time to time as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. Consumers are inclined to buy from a store that has a wide variety of items and merchandise. She hopes to expand her business by adding to the selection of supplies in order to meet the demands of consumers. With that method, she would be able to boost her income, which she can use for her and her husband’s everyday needs. She can also save for emergency cases and for her retirement. She humbly seeks your help through a PHP 25,000 loan to purchase assorted dry goods and drinks. She will also try to innovate by investing in a coffee vendo machine. She’s praying that you have the kind heart to extend your generous support to her.

Fulgencia meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase assorted dry goods and drinks and to invest in a coffee vendo machine.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina es una socio muy responsable y trabajadora que sigue teniendo su negocio de complementos alimenticios,esta actividad es  rentable hoy en día y su deseo es abrir otra tienda donde pueda seguir expendiendo sus productos asi sacar adelante a su familia. ella solicita el préstamo para comprar vitaminas y complementos alimenticios.
ella esta satisfecha con el préstamo y agradece a los inversionista de KIVA.
texts.en:
Agripina is a very responsible and hardworking woman who continues to run her dietary supplement business. Currently, this is a profitable business and she hopes to open another store where she can continue selling her products. This way, she can provide for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy vitamins and dietary supplements.

She is happy with the loan and thanks the lenders at Kiva.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and dietary supplements.

loans.name: Tali

texts.en:
Tali is 37 years old and single. She has a small business of sewing clothes and sells them in her community to earn a living.

Tali requested a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine and tape measurement to help her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, needles, a sewing machine, tape measurement

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is thankful for KIVA's noble cause of lending to small businessmen like her. The loan that was previously granted to her helped finance and sustain her direct-selling business, which has been her means to cover her everyday needs.

Once again she needs funds to meet the advanced orders of RTW-clothes for men and women and children. She thanks KIVA and its supporters for the valued help on her livelihood; it is highly appreciated as she assists her grandchildren's schooling.

Myrna aims to put up a small general store to augment her income. She sees that a good education will allow her grandchildren a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready-to-wear clothes such as polo shirts, pants, T-shirts.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 60 лет, вдова, мать 2 детей. У Гулнары высшее образование, много лет проработала главным бухгалтером, сейчас на пенсии и работает ведущим специалистом в отделе миграции и молодежи. В качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1996 году начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 15 овец и 0,80 Га обрабатываемой земли, где выращивает картофель и люцерну. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулнара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для реализации экологически чистого вкусного молока. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса и хочет накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Gulnara is a 60-year-old widow, and the mother of two.  She has a higher education and, for many years, she used to work as a head accountant.  Today, she is retired but she still serves as a leading specialist on migration and youth.  In 1996, in order to provide an additional source of income for her family, she became involved in agriculture and animal husbandry.  She started her business with an initial capital of 50,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has four cows and 15 sheep on her farm.  She also grows potatoes and alfalfa on 0.8 hectares of arable land.

Eager to further grow her farming business, Gulnara has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and she has requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy one dairy cow and sell some delicious organic milk.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to grow her business, and she also wants to save some money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow in order to sell larger volumes of organic milk.

loans.name: Ana Lorraine

texts.en:
Ana Lorraine is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana Lorraine is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ana Lorraine has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Ana Lorraine has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Yuleidis Yuceth

texts.es: Yuleidis es una microempresaria de 33 años que emprendió su propio negocio en el año 2012, tras haber laborado en una cadena de almacenes de calzado; con la práctica prolongada, adquirió el conocimiento y habilidad, no solo para las ventas que era el rol que desempeñaba, sino también el conocimiento de proveedores y productos, así como la administración de personal, bases primordiales para llevar a cabo su propio proyecto. Esta valerosa mujer adecuó un local ubicado en el centro de Barranquilla, una excelente plaza en la que diariamente genera ventas a los visitantes del lugar.  Yuleidis debe estar preparada con nuevos modelos de calzado que garanticen ventas altas a razón de la época que se avecina, ella solicitó un crédito, su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar calzado para toda la familia; sandalias de plataformas, romanas, zapatillas y tenis. Yuleidis es madre de un niño de 10 años de edad y convive con su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla.  Su meta a futuro mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Yuleidis is a 33-year-old microentrepreneur who launched her own business in 2012, after having worked at a chain of footwear warehouses. With this prolonged practice, she acquired knowledge and ability, not only for sales (which was the role she performed), but also knowledge of suppliers and products, as well as personnel management--essential bases to carry out her own project.

This brave woman adapted a shop located in the center of Barranquilla, in an excellent plaza from whose visitors she generates daily sales. Yuleidis should be prepared with new shoe styles that guarantee high sales as the season approaches. She requested a loan, her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy footwear for the whole family: platform sandals, gladiator sandals, slippers, and tennis shoes.

Yuleidis is a mother of a 10-year-old child and lives with her partner in a neighborhood of the municipality of Barranquilla. Her future goal is to improve her family's living standard and to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy footwear for the whole family: platform sandals, gladiator sandals, slippers, and tennis shoes.

loans.name: Olviris Rafael

texts.es: Olviris es un microempresario de 33 años de edad que reside en Soledad, este municipio es considerado el de mayor crecimiento demográfico en el país, por lo que tenderos  de distintas regiones del país han aperturado negocios en esta localidad.  Olviris palpó la oportunidad de ampliar su base de clientes, pues él por tradición familiar se ha desempeñado durante años a la venta de verduras, específicamente a macitos de revuelto (hoja de col, cilantro y cebolla en rama)  muy utilizados en la preparación de alimentos. El maneja dos rutas en el municipio, aproximadamente 52 clientes a quienes visita día por medio, y en cuanto entrega sus pedidos son cancelados de inmediato. Él proyecta incrementar sus ventas al adquirir un vehículo que le permita abarcar más cobertura, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar una motocicleta, de este modo ahorrará en costos y tiempo cuando se dirija a realizar sus compras en el km 14 y demás proveedores que no están tan cerca de su lugar de residencia.  Olviris es soltero y es un padre responsable de dos hijos menores de edad a quienes les ofrece bienestar y desea que su negocio prospere para darles estudios de calidad.
texts.en:
Olviris is a 33 -year-old micro-entrepreneur who lives in Soledad. This town is considered to have the highest demographic growth in the country, which is why shopkeepers from different parts of the country have opened businesses in this area.

Olviris saw the opportunity to expand his client based. As part of his family tradition, he has worked for many years selling vegetables, specially macitos de revuelto (cabbage leafs, cilantro, and scallions), which are widely used in food preparation.

He manages two routes in his town, with approximately 52 clients whom he visits every other day. Once he delivers the orders, he immediately breaks even. He expects to increase his sales by getting a vehicle that will allow him to expand his coverage. For this reason, he is requesting his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase a motorcycle. This way, he can save cost and time when purchasing his products from providers who are 14 km away and are not close to his home.

Olviris is responsible single father of two small children for whom he provides for. He hopes that his business is successful so that he can provide them with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira hails from the rural town of Sagbayan, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods ranging from eggs, seasonings, edible oil and assorted canned goods to biscuits and soft drinks. Aside from running a store, she also runs a "carenderia" or eatery, and caters food for the local people. She is a 52-year-old married woman with five children. One of her children is still attending school.

She decided to avail herself of a loan to buy assorted groceries and pay for transportation. With the presence of these, she could maximize her resources, enabling her to maintain the flow of merchandise. Thus, she could start to save and invest in any possible business to become successful.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries and pay for transportation

loans.name: Sreynet

texts.en:
Sreynet is 22 years old. She is a single student who is from Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has earned an income from the fish selling business in the market since 2014, earning around $10 per day. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Finance and Banking, at the university in the city. Because she is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees for the third year, she would like to request a loan.

With this loan, she will have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree. After graduation, Sreynet wants to find a proper job with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for the third year of university.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en:
Helina is 25 years old and married with one child. She lives in a rural area outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands. She raises and sells pigs to restaurants or to the community to earn a living and has been doing this for five years.

Now Helina needs a loan to buy more pigs and pig feed to assist her in running her business. She hopes to build a big house for her family with the profits she makes and also cover her family's daily expenses.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed for her business.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
As a married mother, Anabel works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut wine.

Anabel is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as rice, sugar, etc.

Anabel has been sustaining her business activities through her previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mulimo Group

texts.fr: Le précédent crédit reçu par Delphin a facilité l'exécution des travaux champêtres quoique buté à un certain moment par la carence en eau d'irrigation, les oiseaux ravageurs et l'insuffisance de terres arables. Les revenus générés ont répondu à plusieurs besoins familiaux . De ce fait, le présent crédit sera orienté dans le même cadre d'idées dans la prise en charge du labour, sarclage, repiquage, achat engrais et produits phytosanitaires.
texts.en:
Delphin's previous loan helped him with his farming work during a period with a lack of irrigation water, destructive birds, and a shortage of arable land.

The revenues he earned helped him respond to a number of family needs. This current loan will be applied to similar uses such as to pay for plowing, hoeing, transplanting, fertilizer, and phytosanitary products.

loans.use: pay for plowing, hoeing, transplanting, fertilizer, and phytosanitary products.

loans.name: Faalagilagi

texts.en:
Faalagilagi is a 38-year-old mother with four children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, and box of milk, to assist her in running the business.

She will expand her business using her profits. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her convenience store, including a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, and box of milk.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Anita works hard to support her family. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

Anita is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her bicycle transport business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her bicycle transport business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture shop business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Caroline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, paint, etc.

loans.name: Fialupe

texts.en:
Fialupe is a 30-year-old woman with 1 child. She owns and operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living.

Fialupe has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and printing machines to help her to continue her business. She joined SPBD in 2009.

She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint colors, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and printing machines.

loans.name: Annabell

texts.en:
As a single parent of two children, Annabell works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Annabell is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell in her firewood business.

Annabell has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley thanks Kiva and its supporters and CCT for their support for small business people like her. The loans which were previously granted to her were a great help to grow and sustain her ornamental plant business. Aside from her farm, she also operates a jeepney and tricycle business so that she can fully provide for her family.

Once again she would like to request a loan in the amount of PHP 19,000 to buy fertilizer, pots, nets and various seedlings in order to grow a variety of ornamental plants. She will also use part of the loan for the maintenance of her vehicles in her transportation business. She trusts in having your continuous help for her livelihood.

Shirley aims to be more successful and to grow her businesses so that she can save enough for her children's college education. She faithfully meets up with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and farm inputs for their flower farm, and for the maintenance of her tricycle and jeepney as well.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a 42-year-old married woman with six children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Annaliza has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fruit to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Annaliza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 51 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Carol works very hard to provide for them.

Carol runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk food, homecare products and other groceries. She has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Carol would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk food, homecare products and other groceries.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cristina works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen food.

Cristina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy underwear, shirts, pants, etc. for her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy underwear, shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Aiympashsha

texts.ru: Айымпашша, 34 года, вдова, мать 4 детей. У Айымпашши - среднее образование, она знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айымпашша занимается пошивом и реализацией женской верхней одежды. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и воспитание детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айымпашша обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 12 рулонов велюра для пошива одежды. Доходы от кредита Айымпашша планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и планирует накопить средства на завершение строительства дома.
texts.en:
Aiympashsha is the 34-year-old widowed mother of four children.  She has a secondary education.  She knows exactly what she wants and she achieves all her goals on her own.  She sews and sells women's outerwear, and this activity constitutes the main source of income for her family.  She makes a total monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS), which is not enough to provide a decent standard of living and to educate her children.

Eager to further develop her activity, Aiympashsha has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and she has requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy 12 rolls of velours to sew some clothes.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her business.  She also intends to save enough money to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy 12 rolls of velvet to sew women's outerwear.

loans.name: Aliyahan

texts.ru: Алияхан, 57 лет, замужем. Она начал свою деятельность в 2005 году. Благодаря упорному труду в хозяйстве Алияхан на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы. На участке мерою 0,20 Га она выращивает кукурузу, на 0,05 Га есть виноградный сад. Ежемесячный доход Алияхан составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 овец. Доходы от кредита планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Aliyahan is 57 years old and married.  She started her own activity in 2005.  Thanks to her very hard work she now has three cows on her farm.  She also grows corn on 0.2 hectares of land and she has a small vineyard on 0.05 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of 4,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, Aliyahan has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and she has requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy three head of sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her business.

loans.use: to buy three sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Imomgul

texts.ru: Сельскохозяйственная деятельность тяжелый труд. Ни все может работать на земле и выращивать домашнее животных. Особенно на районах многие жители занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности.  Потому что на районе  прекрасная солнечная погода для развития сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Есть много поле для пасти животных и для выращивания растение. Дехканы будут сильными и трудолюбивыми. Имомгул одна из них. Ей 54 года. Имомгул не смотря на свой возраст, занимается растениеводством. Она не боится трудить. Имомгул 30 лет продвигает свою деятельность. У нее есть семья. Четверых детей по 19, 20, 11 и 10 лет. Старшие дети помогает маме в работе. Младшие учиться в школе. Имомгул еще выращивает скота у себя во дворе. Она хочет расширить земледелие. Приобрести много минеральных  удобрений и разных семян урожай. Для расширения деятельность у Имомгул нет денег. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.   Имомгул верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Farming is hard work. Not everyone can work the land and breed domestic animals. Especially out in the regions, many residents work with agriculture. This is because out in the region it is beautiful sunny weather for working with agriculture. There are many fields for animals to graze and for growing crops. Farmers become strong and hard working.

Imomgul is one of these. She is 54 years old. Despite her age, she works with farming. She is not afraid to work. Imomgul has worked with this for 30 years. She has a family; four children of 20, 19, 11 and 10 years. The oldest children help their mother with the work. The younger go to school.

Imomgul already breeds livestock in her yard. She would like to expand her farm and purchase mineral fertilizers and different seeds to sow. Imomgul does not have enough money to expand her business. For this reason she applied for a loan. Imomgul believes in you and your support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds to sow

loans.name: La Reine "b" Group

texts.fr: Bienvenue, est une femme âgée de 35 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis plusieurs années. Ce qui fait marcher son c'est son dynamisme, et l'accès au prêt. Elle veut acheter du sésame à 475 000 F pour revendre. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 7 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Bienvenue is a 35-year-old married mother of two children. She has been in business for several years. Her dynamism and access to funding loans are what make her business prosper.

She wants to buy 475,000 francs' worth of sesame for resale. The loan's usefulness is to acquire sufficient quantities to bolster her business activity. She has already been granted seven loans which were reimbursed on time.

loans.use: buy 475,000 francs' worth of sesame for resale.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 30 лет, замужем, многодетная счастливая мама 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи с 2004 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Айнура на сегодняшний день имеет лошадь, 4 коровы, 20 овец, на 0,70 Га земли выращивает картофель, занимается садоводством. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере 23,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность в дальнейшем вкладывать в постройку дома.
texts.en:
Ainura is 30 years old, married and the happy mother of three children. She has secondary education. As an income for her family, she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 2004.

Thanks to her persistent work, Ainura currently has a horse, four cows and twenty sheep. She also has 0.70 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and does gardening. The business brings a monthly income of the amount of 23,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves for fattening and reselling. Ainura plans to invest the income from the loan to further develop her business in order to have the possibility to further save money to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase some calves for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Anargul

texts.ru: Анаргуль, 57 лет, вдова, есть 6 детей. Образование- среднее, работает санитаром в Центре Семейной Медицины, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 2 теленка и 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход Анаргуль составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Anargul is 57 years old and a widow. She has six children. She has secondary education and works as a nurse at the Family Medicine Center. As an additional income for her family, she works with livestock breeding. She has two cows, two calves and five sheep. Anargul's monthly income is around 20,000 som (KGS). This money is unfortunately not enough to provide for her family.

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Ashrafkhon

texts.ru: Ашрафхон мужчина среднего возраста в самом рассвете сил. Ему 44 года. Он отец двоих детей. Его жена работает воспитательницей в детском саду. Ашрафхон занимается растениеводством уже 20 лет. Он знает все о тонкости этой деятельности. Сезон работы Ашрафхона началось, он собирается подготовить землю для зимнего посева урожая. Для этого ему нужно минеральные удобрения, чтобы обработать землю. Денежных средств не хватает, чтобы закупить достаточное количество удобрений, и он надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Ashrafkhon is a middle-aged man with great physical strength.  He is 44 and the father of two children.  His wife works as a teacher in a nursery school.  Ashrafkhon himself has been involved in agriculture for the past 20 years.  He knows every aspect of his work perfectly well.  This time of year, Ashrafkhon is getting ready to prepare his soil for the new winter planting season.  In order to do this, he needs to buy mineral fertilizers, but he doesn't have enough money to buy a sufficient quantity of fertilizers.  He is relying on your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers in order to prepare his soil before the planting season.

loans.name: Bekzod

texts.ru: Бекзод, 30 лет, не женат, детей нет, живет с родителями. Бекзод - кузнец, вот уже 9 лет он изготавливает декоративные решетки на окна, ворота, качели, также предоставляет сварочные работы, изготавливает чугунные батареи для отопления. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бекзод обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку чугунных батарей и железных труб для переделки и продажи. Он является лидером группы "Бекзод", всего в группе состоит 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Бекзод планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и планирует накопить средства на покупку земельного участка для постройки цеха.
texts.en:
Bekzod is 30, single, with no children yet.  He lives with his parents and works as a blacksmith.  Bekzod manufactures decorative bars for windows, gates,  and swings.  He also provides welding services and makes cast iron panels for heating.  His monthly income comes up to 8,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop his business, Bekzod has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy iron panels and steel pipes to transform and resell.  He is the leader of the "Bekzod" group, which comprises a total of three members.  He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further expand his business.  He also intends to save enough money to buy a plot of land and build a workshop.

loans.use: to purchase iron panels and steel pipes to transform and resell.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is a 24-year-old mother with two children. She runs and operates a small business selling pancakes, buns, and pork cake in her community to earn a living. Makerita requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, frying pan, wooden spoon, bottle of vegetable oil and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, fry pan, wooden spoon, bottle of vegetable oil and plastic bags.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
The countryside and areas previously affected by the post-election violence in Kenya (occurred in 2007) are often neglected, even by the government and financial institutions but Juhudi Kilimo tries to get to these areas in order to offer its services and to lend a hand to those who do honest work and who want to change the image of their country.

One such person is Beatrice who has now been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years and has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, tea, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “feeding my cows.” She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet it.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing her milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This extra production will immediately translate to more profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Beatrice is very visionary, and she intends in the near future to start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling it, and to start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future.

The various factors that have led to failure in previous situations have not prevented Beatrice from wanting to succeed and fulfill her goals. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Cyrill

texts.en:
Cyrill is a single woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cyrill is 33 years old and two of her children are in school.

Cyrill has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Cyrill has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Cyrill would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Edelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from doing manicures and pedicures. Edelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her bicycle transport business.

Edelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 54 years old and has seven children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dolores has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Luiset

texts.es: Luiset es una comerciante de artículos para el hogar muy reconocida en un sector de Soledad y emprendió su negocio ofreciéndoles sus productos a  familiares, vecinos y amigos en el año 1996, esta carismática mujer cuenta con una amplia experiencia y su base de clientes es extensa a razón de los excelentes productos que comercializa: electrodomésticos, enseres de cocina, prendas de vestir, calzado, productos de aseo; todos son productos de marcas reconocidas que ofrecen un buen respaldo y garantía. Luiset en compañía de su cónyuge residen en una vivienda del municipio y aunque no tuvo hijos, sus sobrinos han gozado del bienestar que ella les proporciona con las rentas de su negocio. A largo plazo su sueño es tener un almacén muy grande y como ella considera que lo que no se inicia, no se concluye, realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para surtir con ollas a presión, abanicos, lavadoras, prendas de vestir, calzado y demás encargos que le solicitaron sus clientes, para acercarse un poco a sus sueño de prosperidad. Así mismo tener un inventario que respalde la demanda originada por el fin de año, una época en la que sus clientes están más motivados a las compras de estos artículos.
texts.en:
Luiset is a very well-known home goods merchant in the area of Soledad, and she undertook her business offering her products to family members, neighbors and friends in 1996. This charismatic woman has lots of experience and her customer base is extensive due to the excellent products that she sells: appliances, kitchen appliances, clothing, shoes, toiletries. These are all products from well-known brands that offer a good endorsement and guarantee.

Luiset and her partner live in a home in the city and, although she didn't have children, her nephews have enjoyed the wellbeing that she provides them with income from her business. Her longterm goal is to have a really big store. Since she believes that what you don't start, you can't finish, she applied for a loan. It is her first Credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy pressure cookers, fans, washing machines, clothing, footwear and other orders that her customers request from her, in order to get a little bit closer to her prosperity dream. She also wants to have an inventory that supports the demand that comes at the end of the year, a season where her customers are more motivated to buy these articles.

loans.use: to buy pressure cookers, fans, washing machines, clothing, footwear and other orders that her customers request from her.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de  49 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 16 años, y su negocio es la quesería.
Ella es amable, buena persona y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘karhuiza’ cercana al lago sagrado Titicaca, la gente del lugar se dedica a la agricultura y pesca siendo un sitio turístico muy visitado.
Elena es de tez morena, baja estatura y vestir tradicional, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al engorde de ganado y con su hija que estudia en la escuela y pastorea ganado.
